name: Poseidon's Playhouse
description: A sardine's day dream to get groovy with nauti narwals.
landmark: An underwater oasis under a giant shade structure

name: Tac-O-Cat
description: These dusty ass burners serve hot fresh tacos every evening before sunset. Come grab one and wash it down with some warm fireball whisky and enjoy our crappy music and janky art car. We cruise out daily and love a good poesy to ride with us. We also can fix whatever bike you bring to us throughout the day, evening and night.
landmark: Green burning man symbol on the street of our camp

name: Oracle Camp
description: "Ride, I-Ching, Ride" theme camp will offer I-Ching readings  at camp and pedicab rides from out on the Playa.
landmark: look for the green vinyl Ride, I-Ching, Ride sign

name: Lakes on the Playa Village
hometown: Chicago, IL (Great Lakes actually more accurate)
description: Lakes on the Playa is our Village and we are all camps that call the Great Lakes regional burn, Lakes of Fire our home at home. We want to bring a taste of the fun, warmth and hard work that we all come from back home and share some moments with Black Rock City. Come for some touch-less sunscreen & friends , stay for the music, dancing and fire art! We are an all day / all night village that has something for everyone. We are a BED Safe Camp and strive to start conversations about consent and boundaries with the community. Take a ride on Tarna the flaming Jackalope Mutant Vehicle during her debut year on playa. On the outside, it's a metallic art car with a DJ sound stage, complete with lighting and flame effects. On the inside, it's a plush lounge and cozy gallery space.
landmark: 28' Dome, Fire Garden TFZ & Sunscreen Jackalope MV

name: Treble Makers
description:
The Treble Makers are here ready to help your playa tune take on a new tone, be it with our live French accordionist performance*, house-music-filled** dance floor, our friendly, tasty and bountiful Bottomless Bass Bar or the somatic gyrations delivered to your weary core by the one-and-only Buffer Bush. Swing on by and we will help you hit that higher note!

*He's been playing the instrument for 50+ years and might steal your g/f. Or b/f. Or maybe both of you together.

**A bit of Bass/DnB/Glitch will be there too. But no Trance. Well, maybe just a little Trance. But not at 5:30am. Promise! < 3
landmark: The Red Treble Clef in the sky!

name: The Fluffy Cloud Camp
description: 360-degree sound, lights, and... ramen? Sure, why not? At our camp we host a variety of immersive sound and light experiences ranging from wellness practices to passive art shows to full on dance parties under 60,000 watts of custom sound and light from our mobile art installation, The Fluffy Cloud.
landmark: 25 foot tall and 25 foot wide UFO-like artwork

name: Snow Cone Zone
description: snow cones Mon-Fri 12-2. Cherry  Blueberry. Bring your OWN CUP!  24/7 free no password wifi
landmark: 20 x 4 foot sign that says "Snow Cone Zone"

name: noMADart
description: Camp F.Art (Family Art) is a welcoming camp for Deaf, Hard of Hearing, Late Deaf, Hearing that know Sign Language or for anyone that is interested in the Arts. We are open minded Burners from all walks of life and have come together to create a safe place to share ideas and ask questions about creating Art. Our camp is primary HOME to the Build Team for Everlasting Love art installation.
landmark: blue light pole.

name: Come to Cheesus!
description: Come To Cheesus Camp provides a welcoming environment for you to congregate and share your perspectives in religion and potentially even convert to the practices of the Church of Cheesus Christ by receiving your daily bread, giving testimony, and confessing your mortal sins.
landmark: Neon "Come to Cheesus" sign

name: The Desert Squirrels
description: The Unofficial Mailmen of Black Rock City connect Burners through hand-written messages via postcards/letters! Participants send and receive mail at random from other random participants. The idea is that everyone will receive an intimate & anonymous message from another Burner on the playa. These letters and messages are gifts that Burners will be able to take with, hold on to, and hopefully collect over the course of their years at Burning Man. Participants can either find an Unofficial Mailman to send a letter or come to our camp that will be set up in a simple fashion representing a Burner's take on a post office. The small group of us are excited to start this adventure on the Playa and connect Burners with one another like never before!
landmark: giant life-sized mailbox with a giant red flag

name: Cotton Candy Vibes
description:
Gift Economy Credit Union
Conversations about gifting and the economy. Leave or take a gift from the gift vault. Record your gifting habits in the Public gift ledger.
landmark: "Gift Economy Credit Union" banner on the street.

name: Awesomesauce
description: We believe in fun. And big inflatable balls. And having fun inside big inflatable balls. If this sounds like your jam, roll on over for Awesomeball and strap in for an exhilarating experience. Stop by the Unstable and we'll even top you off with an ice cold cup of Unicorn Tears (may or may not be sourced from actual unicorns).
landmark: Big fuchsia pink truck and unicorns

name: High Desert Cinema
description: A place to kick back and relax at the end of a hot day to watch an awesome classic movie with friends. Hot Buttered Popcorn and theater candy... sit down a spell before you take on BRC for the night! We'd love to have you!
landmark: Large lit up marquee -  High Desert Cinema

name: Camp Shutterbuggy
description: Camp Shutterbuggy is home base for our mobile photo booth art car in the shape of an antique camera. Join us nightly for Snappy Hour at 9pm, have a cocktail, get a souvenir photo, and then hop aboard for a playa art tour! We depart at 11pm each night. Everyone is welcome until we are full.
landmark: Shutterbuggy mobile photo booth.

name: Wolf Pack
description: Were Wolf Pack and to us being a pack means family and we consider every citizen of Black Rock City part of our pack!  This year we are proud to announce we will be continuing our most popular workshop, our stained glass workshop!! this workshop is for any burners who want to learn a new skill! we will teach you how to work with glass and make something with materials we provide that they can take home and display with pride with an amazing story attached to it. We also will be bringing back out photo booth with a twist! We are an extremely 10 Principals oriented camp with an emphasis on leave no trace and radical self expression.
landmark: The large hand painted wooden sign

name: Camp Crasy
description: Art Support Camp for Last Bet Motel, complete with check-in desk and donation bin to help our Reno neighbors experiencing homelessness. Drop by to donate unopened non-perishable food, toiletries, and hygiene products.
landmark: Desk, scaffolding, mattresses, and donation bin.

name: TwistHanger
description: Come experience the excitement of climbing on stuff, mixed with the age-old fun of Twister. TwistHanger features over 500 square feet of climbing holds built around the game Twister! Right foot red, you're off to a good start. Left foot green, you've got this. Left hand blue... wait, is that even physically possible? Give it a shot, but try not to fall! For even more climbing fun, challenge your friends (or a stranger) in Darwin's Theory: Survival of the Fittest. Be the first to climb to the top and hit your button to win!
landmark: TwistHanger Structure

name: Marley's Place
description: We are a mutant vehicle support camp for Marley The Playa Copter.  We also have a Martini Bar underneath our cool and spacious shade structure.  Come join us for a cruise around the city on Marley or rest a spell in our lounge while sipping your Martini.
landmark: Wind Spinner and our desert camo shade structure

name: Lux Elixirs
description: Drink organic meads paired with herbal tinctures to keep the party going all night - naturally. We are cultivating a different kind of bar scene, including community driven DJ sets, workshops and drinks like no other on the playa!
landmark: 20 x 20 White High Peak Tent

name: Camp BUI
description: Camp BUI – Burners Under the Influence – one of the friendliest camps on the playa. Camp BUI was started in 2006 and over the years have added friends as well as numerous Burners who happened to camp near us and asked to join. We are known for our excellent cuisine, our Shot of the Day, and our Pineapple Upside Down Cake Thursday event, and our spacious common area where visitors can enjoy a sit in the shade and a cold drink of water. Camp BUI takes citizenship of Black Rock City seriously and we heartily embrace the 10 Principles. Visit us at campbui.org.
landmark: Lighted BUI Banner over entrance and corner sign

name: ANDAS
description: The Teatime Initiative is a Art Support Camp that proudly presents the art piece "The Giant Suitcase" - the ultimate beacon for travel located somewhere on the open playa.
landmark: Look for the Giant Glowing Teabag Sign

name: Carnage
description: Art support camp for Chronotron project
landmark: shiny metal camper

name: ZaZen
description: ZAZEN is your home away from home on the Playa.  Come have a drink with us, enjoy some shade, take a nap, learn how to burn from some real vets, play some games, make a confession in our confessional, get dressed up in our Playa Prom Photobooth.   If you are looking for good souls and good connection come by and see us!
landmark: ZAZEN GATE / Tie Die Dome

name: Pablo's Breakfast Cantina & Spa
description: Come visit our breakfast bar for breakfast quesadillas, churro pancakes, micheladas, and coffee-infused tequila. What's the "spa" you ask? Come see us and find out!
landmark: 30 foot geodesic dome and sign that says "Pablo's"

name: Northwest Mist
description: Northwest Mist provides a soothing northwest atmosphere to escape the heat with misting and quiet music and conversation.  Step through the tent doors for a refreshing and friendly encounter.
landmark: Red/white striped tent w/ int'l flags on the sign.

name: Camp Wineaux
description: Camp Wineaux provides a total wine experience with unique, interactive wine tasting events such as blinded tasting and vertical tasting as well as educational (and drinking) events hosted by our camp sommelier, Wine Wench.  We also offer a medieval-theme dust-free chill tent to hang out in. Monday afternoon- "So You Want To Be a Somm?" and blinded tasting; Wednesday afternoon - Wine Appreciation Overview and somm curated tasting; Friday - Friday Finale - vertical tasting of a premium Napa red blend.
landmark: Two blue & yellow banner flags & colorful curtains

name: PlayCreate
description: PlayCreate! Enjoy our shade, sip a drink, and participate in one of our many workshops. Workshops 10AM - Noon; Bar Service Noon - 4PM
landmark: white camouflage walls and 2 black sign placards

name: Tower of Slackjaw
landmark: 60 foot metal tower

name: HIFI House
description: Atmospheric desert vibes. A place to go to for afternoon siesta or evening. Come and watch the sunset, jump the trampoline or just get a quick stop to inflate that flat tire!
landmark: steel circle gazebo with line lights

name: DragonCamp Armory
description: DragonCamp Armory teaches women to hand-make their own sexy cyber armor bikini. Participants will trace, cut, pound, and decorate thin sheet aluminum into a cool and amazing custom fitting metal bikini costume (think Game of Thrones). Photo-ops against our castle dungeon set, or climb astride one of our animatronic dinosaurs or Dragons to share a waking dream!
landmark: Life size dinosaurs and dragon mutant vehicle.

name: PEACE IN THE MIDDLE EAST
description: Middle eastern eclectic lounge
landmark: clorful Moroccan rugs and pillows

name: Better Bitstream Bureau
description: It is the mission of the Better Bitstream Bureau to be the leaders in Black Rock City for advancing the art of generating bits and inside jokes for each and every camp, burner, and sparkle pony on the playa. We celebrate the sudden, surprising, and chaotic subversion of expectations. If you need consultation on your bits, stop by our offices, where our team of puppets are standing by to assist you. And keep an eye out for our representatives who will be visiting camps to offer official grades for your bits.
landmark: 10' tall light obelisk in front of 3 carports

name: PolyParadise
description:
The Village of PolyParadise has been influencing the Hearts & Minds and Washing the Bodies of Playa Citizens from '2:00 - 10:00' since 1999 celebrating 24 years in BRC in 2020.

Polyamory involves openness to multiple loving relationships, with honesty among all partners. We welcome ALL Poly & Poly Friendly folks to camp within our borders.

The Village of PolyParadise 2020 welcomes the addition of two Theme Camps within its borders | Twisted Swan | Temple of Bacchus.

PolyParadise is NOT a Swinger Camp. Being Poly or Practicing Poly is NOT a requirement for camping with us, but being OPEN MINDED about other people's lifestyle choices IS!!
landmark: 10' Black Metal Man with Red Heart/Infinity Symbol

name: Schnitzel Camp
description:
The red carpet rolls out for stars ans stars to be!
Celebrate the movie world - as actor or director, as star or wannabestar, be fun and be....dirty!
landmark: Stars and the (Circus) tent

name: Better With Butter
description:
Butter my buns and call me a biscuit!
You can keep your ghee, fancy margarine and oils, because it's all butter from here baby. 
We'll be offering classes all week including yoga, DJ sets and learning how to compost (on and off the playa)... always followed by some sweet and savory buttery snacks. 
Look for our tiniest bar on the playa as it travels around with a thimble sized shot ski and other tiny accoutrements...of course included are tiny delicious buttery snacks. 
Watch your step, it's slippery in here.
landmark: Butter Flag flying high

name: Pretty Pickle
description: A relaxed and welcoming outpost on the dusty road to nowhere. We have daily afternoon cold pickle service (Noon to 2 pm Monday through Saturday). We invite passersby to step under our shade, enjoy a refreshing treat, and ride our disco pickle swing! In-the-know visitors may inquire about our playa-famous pickle warmers!
landmark: green and pink flags and Pretty Pickle sign

name: Clown Car Camp
landmark: The clown car

name: Camp Gotalotgoinon
description: We are a collaborative of thinkers, creators and imaginative artists that are building a community and immersive art experience through movement and sensory triggers. Motivated with love we are a savage team
landmark: Rainbow splatter flag! Puzzle Box and Dj Tent

name: Equal and Opposite Force
description: The I-Ching is here to help us navigate life's challenges. Our camp offers I-Ching readings, and teaches campers how to throw the coins for themselves. Also, we invite everyone to follow along with our morning and evening Tai Chi practices.
landmark: Yin-Yang Flags

name: Camp-Lemon-Tree
description:
Has life been handing you too many lemons? Is your cup already full and you'd like to fill someone else's? Welcome to Camp-Lemon-Tree! The complimentary compliment camp with a Compliment Cohort ready to commend! 
At Camp-Lemon-Tree we believe in the power and domino effect of praise, appreciation, and overall warm-fuzzies. It's no secret that living in Black Rock City (and beyond) can be a mental and physical challenge, and what better ailment than spreading love and kindness? 

Come by to complete a Compliment Card for a fellow Burner, Fish for Compliments, and enjoy a Compliment Sandwich with a Camp-Lemon-Tree Lemonade!
landmark: Camp name sign and compliment booth at the curb

name: Mountain Mayhem
description: The best little dive bar this side of anywhere. Mountain themed antics.
landmark: Chairlift seat / Tall sign with 2 M's

name: Pussy Day Spa
description:
Do you like fun?  Then visit the Pussy Day Spa.  We offer a choice of refreshing body wash, pubic hair trim, and pussy massage including happy ending.  What's not to like? 

Pleasure and bliss awaits as we pamper and delight you.  Your boundaries will be respected, your feedback / adjustments encouraged, and your wishes fulfilled.

We guarantee it will be the best experience you will ever have at Burning Man, or anywhere else.  Open daily from 1 to 5 pm, we take reservations (recommended) as well as walk-ins.
landmark: Pussy Day Spa sign

name: The Parlour Room
description: Host to Diversion Traffic School for bike citations, Old-school fuckery, Pranks galore, Snarky Shark Brigade, Late night fireside chats and shenanigans galore.
landmark: Flashing stop sign & tricked out living room - bar

name: Camp Scone Fucker
landmark: Trampoline and fabric chandeliers

name: Pussy Avalanche
description:
Introverted nerd? Love cats? We've got a camp for you!

Stop by in the heat of the day to lounge in our Chonker Domes, flip through cat magazines, send a post card home, or see if there's something you like the Litter Box.  We have cooling and hot drinks most of the time
We have events nearly every day – and are always available for folks who want to stop by and play a board game or just get out of the sun for a while.

Feeling adventurous?  Climb into the Butt Blaster to include your bony backside in this year's magazine, or risk horrible injury playing Extreme Cock Fighting!  No chickens will be harmed.  You - not so much.
landmark: two 'cat domes' by the street

name: Free Photography Zone
description: Free Photography Zone, for over 2 decades at Burning Man, has been photographing the participants in a professional studio setting and gifting each person with their individual print.  No waiting for emails get you print on the spot.
landmark: Red walled gallery displaying large B&W portraits.

name: Arbitrarium
landmark: Large Yellow Shipping Container Deck & YoK

name: El Station BRC
description:
Camp Porta (Party) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization based in Carmel, Ca. in the Monterey Bay. We celebrate community, music and alternative art in the desert and beyond year-round.

We are an international and diverse camp that continues to produce new ideas and art. Our vision is a unification of gender, race and color through music and art.
landmark: bright red neon rope lighting

name: Second Wind Pirate Cafe
description:
Our café gifts a Second Wind to weary burners to keep them alert and awake for their nightly adventures.
Shortly after dinner, the Second Wind Pirate Cafe offers strong black coffee the pirate way— no sugar, no milk, no fuss.
We offer games including the world-famous Jam or Lube? and Guess That Sea Shanty! as well as immersive theater experiences such as Megaphone 5 Minute Battle, Sex With Ghosts, and "Don't Slip" Interactive Art played.
Find the warm, inviting glow of a pirate-themed hexagonal-shaped coffee bar with the Jolly Roger flying high above it. Follow the smell of freshly brewed coffee and the sound of distant sea shanties!
landmark: Hexagonal bar heavily decorated like a pirate ship

name: Playa Pete's Plaza
landmark: 50 foot tall brightly colored tower and Ship!

name: Cirkus freaks
landmark: Yellow oktober, and clown car

name: Hair of the Dog (HOTD)
description: HOTD is the first and longest-running bar at Burning Man.  We hold a little piece of the original fire.  We have free flowing opinions, poorly made cold drinks, sometimes painful music, and a magic, home town bar vibe.  Awesomely placed on Rod's Road, when you find us, you'll be glad you did.   http://thehotd.com
landmark: Giant bright orange HOTD Sign

name: ElectriCity
description: ElectriCity will help your electrons flow, accumulate, or disperse on playa, through electronics and bike repair support, LED and device solar charging, and providing an electrically balanced rest stop in the dust, complete with electrolytes to positively recharge your body and mind.
landmark: Blue flag with atom symbol,  ElectriCity sign

name: Cirkus Freaks
hometown: Black Rock City, Reno, Joshua Tree, Seattle
description: We believe in immediacy, and don't actually support the internet.
landmark: The Yellow Oktober art car, the blr paddy wagon

name: Sunset Lounge
description: Sunset Lounge and  Frick Frack Black, you know us, you love us and we're all getting back together finally. Up to our usual shenanigans .. Come find us.
landmark: large led arch and 3 green lasers

name: Cingulata Camp
description: Best gourmet grilled cheese on the playa.
landmark: A blue streamer & a yellow streamer on a 25 pole

name: Happy Hanuman
description: Welcomes all our fellow burners.  We will be manifesting several art carts that will make appearances on the Playa along with a large Bloom of Jellyfish to dance along with.  We will also have a large calligraphy water wall and sporadic body painting available upon request.  Come check us out!
landmark: Light beacon and large Happy Hanuman Logo flag

name: NuTz Camp
description: Here comes the sun. Beautiful beats and positive vibrations overflow the Playa at NuTz Sunrise Parties. C'mon!
landmark: Multicolor triangle shade structure and NuTz sign

name: Otter Space
description: Interactive exhibits, mostly late at night. Stop by to travel to Lazy Land or experience life in a different body. Or take in the beauty of our art.
landmark: Aframe trailer with Electric Lazy sign

name: Camp Peachy
description: We're just peachy! Come chill with us and enjoy some peach iced tea, peach bellini's and our peachy bum walls!
landmark: Lit up Peach, surrounded by a wall of peachy bums

name: Loadie Camp
landmark: 72 foot long SharkCar

name: Snarky Marquee
description: Have something you want to say, stop by the Snarky Marquee and get your snark on. Put it on one of our 3 reader boards.
landmark: The 3 marquee boards.

name: BatCave
description: Come join us for artisan lemonade Monday-Saturday from Noon-3pm. Then stay to hang out in our BatRoost, or fly off into the dust. The unique flavors we are serving up will always be non-alcoholic, served with ice, changed daily, and you can try more than one!
landmark: lemonade stand with bats hanging from it

name: Epiphany Jewelry Co.
description:
The finest jewelry store on the playa.
(we like to keep it minimal and surprise people)
landmark: big orange tent.

name: Ojo Grande Tiki Bar
description: Ojo Grande Solar Powered Self Propelled Mobile Tiki Bar Hydration Station
landmark: Ojo Grande Tiki Bar

name: Camp Babe
description: Camp Babe is an art collective of free spirits spread out around the globe. We hope to bring the best of the playa to our default communities. Stop by for some good laughs and to learn about the projects we brought to the playa this year!
landmark: Wooden "Camp Babe" sign and two shade structures

name: Knot Sure
description: Black light chill space, stripper pole, decorative rope tops and chill music.
landmark: Large tent like shade structure, Knot Sure sign

name: The Pink Spot
description: The Pink Spot is a warm, friendly, inviting camp that provides shade, badminton, yard games, a Big Bunny double decker art car and great dj vibes day and night.  Come by and enjoy a beverage with us!
landmark: Pink Dome/35' high color changing 10' wand nightly

name: Dolly Llamas
description: Bringing southern charm, hospitality, and wit to the playa since 2022. Y'all come back now, ya hear?
landmark: Neon Dolly Llamas camp sign and flag

name: CatLand
description: CatLand, come on by for kind words and back scratches. Extra points if you love cats.
landmark: Pink LED cat silhouette beacon 20' high

name: BRC Wheels On Meals
description: We are a collection of folks primarily from the San Francisco East Bay area with a sprinkle of folks from around the globe. We provide hot and fast meals to artists during build week. Our motto is "Food coming at you at 5MPH"
landmark: yellow and black wheels on meals banners

name: Decadent Oasis
description: A windswept grove of white palm trees by day, with fun activities abound; an iridescent oasis in the dark of night. Welcome to the magical playground of Decadent Oasis, where we invite you to dance, play, perform, and chill. Fun experiences and games, performance stage, dance parties, and friendly folks imbue within an eco-conscious camp made from mostly reclaimed/reused materials. Stop by for a warm welcome and find shelter from the storm.
landmark: Glowing, pulsating palm trees.

name: Camp Chirp Chirp
description: Pack of fancy drink slanging, fun loving, shit talking misfits from all corners of the universe.
landmark: Tiki Bar and sky scanning lights at night

name: The Royals
description: The British Royals are here! We offer English Afternoon Tea with British Insults and operate our London Fog Machine. Please - Mutant Vehicles should drive on the left side of the road here.
landmark: Two Airstream trailers with cell phone tower

name: Pampers Campers
landmark: Unlisted

name: Camp Bird of Paradise
description:
BIRD OF PARADISE 

All are free to flutter into our CAMP BIRD OF PARADISE where we offer a shady place to lounge. 
Hydrate at our BAR OF PARADISE which will have ice cold beverages through out the week.  Converse with our BARDS OF PARADISE - an eclectic group of sage bards, scientists and physicians out of Mammoth Lakes California conversant on any subject - medical or otherwise.  Take a ride into the deep Playa on our amazing Mutant Vehicle - THE BIRD OF PARADISE.
landmark: Our amazing Mutant Vehicle THE BIRD OF PARADISE.

name: Aluminaughty
description: Aluminaughty is the base camp for AutoDiscoDance Bot the giant robot mutant vehicle as well as LilDustUp the visual representation of the intersection of every opposing view ever had.
landmark: aluminaughty sign

name: BAR MACTROPOLIS
description: Bar Mactropolis where everyone is a VIP.  We solve all your hydration, entertainment, conversation, and chill needs and dreams. Black Rock City's Oasis awaits you.
landmark: Large Decorated Truck and Trailer

name: Tiki Bar & Hammocks
description: Bring your thirsty lips over to enjoy a fresh cool island drink or Kava tea and visit and connect with neighbors and fellow burners.  Share all your great stories "this one time, at burning man…!  Get some advice if you are new to burning man, and of course, swing in our hammocks with us or relax on our sofas and stools in the shade!
landmark: Tiki bar and metal structure with hammocks

name: Diver UP Camp
description: She rises from the desert floor like the feminine goddess she is. Be sure to check out the 21 foot tall Diver UP sculpture on The Playa. We are simply her keepers. Diver UP Camp is an Art Support
landmark: Our hanging Diving Helmet and photo of Diver UP.

name: Safari Social Club
description: The Safari Social Club invites you to swing by and stay a while at our tropical jungle themed bar. We're into Brendan Frasier and funk music so come give our wheel of chance a spin and let the good times roll. But there's always a chance of rain in the jungle so don't be surprised when our misting system brings the tropics to life!
landmark: Carport with two safari themed flags at each side

name: Chai Lounge
description: The Chai Lounge mission is to bring people into a deep interaction with other humans on the playa for a deep loving, profound and even spiritual healing experience. This is a place for deep and powerful times of positive human and spiritual consensual connection. Inviting guests to sit and connect over tea and creative activities such as movement and creative activities such as yoga, dance, martial arts, painting and drawing.
landmark: 30ft high upsideown triangle with thebrew letters

name: Tickled Mink
description: At Tickled Mink … where everyone's a star! … we are here to help zhuzh you at our Hollywood minkup mirror vanity before you start channeling your inner diva. If you don't know how, we'll teach you to smeyes like a mink, so once you sink into our fuzzy, plush, cerulean photo throne, you'll be oh so ready to strike a picture perfect pose as your glamour cover page photo shoot begins. You've never looked more minktacular!
landmark: white fabric covered dome / tall aqua banner poles

name: Party Naked Tiki Bar
description: We serve cold alcohol Tiki Punch, for those age 21 and over (ID is required), starting at 11:00am daily. We serve all day and into the night. Enjoy the sounds of classic rock in a cool, relaxing clothing optional environment. Stop in and have a seat in shade or where you can get some sun. You are bound to meet someone new and the environment here encourages having conversations. You never have to get naked to enjoy but if you do, you may get "leid". Come party with us for our 12th year & please bring your own cup to be LNT friendly. Remember nude is not lewd.
landmark: Welcome to Sin City or Party Naked Tiki Bar sign

name: OHF- One Human Family
description: From Macedonia to Florida, our camp welcomes everyone to chill in our comfortable space and recharge. Coffee and Tea offered daily along with Conch Blowing, Yoga, Jewelry making and great discussions. Come join us as One Human Family.
landmark: LED Mushroom

name: Lingerie Lounge
description: We will adorn you and adore you, fulfilling all your lingerie and costume needs! We have a huge inventory of hand-picked, sewn and dyed items, and our attentive camp members will find just the right item for you. Come see us for lingerie and other fabulous and festive items! We serve all sizes, ages, genders, gender identities, gender preferences, race, creed, religion, and color! Our goal is to remind each Burner who visits us that they are beautiful. Open M-F, 10-2.
landmark: Tall Lingerie Lounge banners, plus sign when open

name: Camp Connection
description:
We are an art support camp that supports two art installation, both by artist Darrell Ansted, a nine-time Burning Man artist.  Darrell will be bringing Awaken, a new piece for 2022, and part of Centered, a 2019 Burning Man art installation.

Our campmates come from all over the United States - Boulder, CO; Park City, UT; Jackson Hole, WY; Detriot, MI; Seattle, WA; Albany, GA: and Los Angeles, CA.
landmark: 7 feet tall steel ring, which is 2 feet wide.

name: Hostel
description: For The Curious
landmark: A large flag pole with two different flags.

name: Electric Giraffe Safari Park IV
description: Come out and find a real living walking talking robot giraffe! His name is Russell and he dwells at the Electric Giraffe Safari Park! Come find us and pet his nose! He'll actually talk to you! And if we're driving about, feel free to ask for a ride!
landmark: Lovely orange Electric Giraffe!

name: Playa Penthouse
description: Elevated, restful, shady platform, from which to view the entire Playa. Lively discussions about life and relationships. Coffee in the mornings, cocktails in the evenings. Dance parties day and night. Our interior chill space/playpen is perfect midday or midnight. People from all over the world come to share experiences or simply enjoy our view in silence. "Our view doesn't suck"! We are the home of the Eros Tangier this year. Informal discussions all week on topics as varied and vital as "Living The 10 Principles", "Couples Communication", "Self-acceptance in sexual transition", "Finding a safe space for partners to express and discuss fantasies" and "Do not fear". We're not real doctors, but many claim we are.
landmark: tall tower, with lights/flames at the 4 corners.

name: Club Burner
description: IF YOU NEED A SHOWER OR A COLD DRINK, A RIDE SOMEWHERE OR A SHOULDER TO LEAN ON COME VISIT CLUB BURNER. WE HAVE A SMALL ART CAR THAT CAN MOVE 2 PEOPLE AND THEIR LUGGAGE ACROSS THE PLAYA.
landmark: THE FRONT OF THE BAR HAS A LARGE ROOSTER FACE

name: Breakaway Republic
description: Get a new, better Playa Name from our drunk Playa Name Robot. Talk to customer support, a bartender or a complete stranger at our many phone booths. Top it all off with a drink at our cosy Bar De Nom.
landmark: "Playa Names" sign and Scottish Lady Robot

name: SUNRISE CAMP
landmark: LOOK FOR A SMALL VILLAGE WITH A HIGH FLAG OF PEACE

name: Camp Fashionably Late
description: A camp that welcomes all walks of life. We strive to create an environment where you can express yourself through art sessions, witness amazing talent from our DJ's so we can dance together and meet some Burners that love learning about the world and the people that call BRC home.
landmark: Pirate flag

name: Gypsy Monkey Carnival
description:
Gypsy Nebula Village is home to the Gypsymonkeys on the BRC Boardwalk, Bad Ice shaved ice bar, and the Bucking Beaver Burlesque stage and lounge. also the Gypsy Castaways with Selim's Gyration Station, Misbehavior Science Camp, the Dream Charter, and the Tellus Wheel.
 Enjoy shaved ice, or cotton candy and adopt a mutant monkey,  play games, and win prizes. You can ride the biggest cock on the playa or go for a slow mosey on the Bucking Beaver. The Gypsymonkey lounge is shady during the day and black-lighted at night and always welcomes the weary traveler to rest and enjoy our ambiance and snark.
Make sure to join us for our nightly happy hour at 5:00 and Burlesque shows starting at 6:00.
landmark: 20' tall Madam Zelda with her welcoming embrace.

name: Mighty Misfits
description: A mighty misfit is a person whose behavior or attitude sets them apart from others in an uncomfortably conspicuous way. A fish out of water, square peg in a round hole, round peg in a square hole. If you feel like you don't fit into the default world, come and join the Mighty Misfits' activities. We are a welcoming dusty respite where you can sing along with our live music, enjoy some refreshments, and feed your body and soul.
landmark: Mighty Misfit led-lit sign, large dome

name: WHITE RABBIT ARMY
landmark: Large wooden pair of pink panties on street corner

name: Camp LALA
description: This year Camp Lala will be seeking out entertainment deprived locations on the playa, and targeting them with sublime, surprising and baffling Flash Mob interactive performances. If you would like to give the gift of booty-shaking, twerking, or general silliness, come by to participate! Otherwise, see you when you least expect us!
landmark: Lit Camp LALA sign!

name: Circle of Friends Camp
description: Our camp is focused on inspiration, new friendships and ultimately to continue expanding our great circle of friends through the amazing people we meet in doing this project and along the journey in doing so!
landmark: Yellow and Red Circle of Friends Flags

name: Camp ASL Support Services HUB
description: We are a Hub that provides a space for deaf burners, signers, and those who want to learn.
landmark: Orange Cone that says ASSHub

name: Dragon Clan
description: Members are enthusiasts of fire performance arts and ultralite human flight, and will be hosting various workshops around the theme of fire, flight, dragons, and knights. We also have a bar!
landmark: Big & painted Dragon Clan out front

name: Future Turtles
description:
The Future Turtles is your friendly gay-next-door camp. Join us for our sunset parties and hit on our adorkable bartenders. The Smut Lounge is open 24/7, as is Impossibility Space, an intimate interactive theatrical story experience slash cuddle space.

If you're a little braver, we offer Desert HIIT every morning: a real HIIT workout that is accessible to people of all fitness levels and abilities, but also actually a good workout too. 

Then come to the pillow fort at midnight, for socially sexual activities in a male, fully consent-based environment.

Either way we promise you'll meet the nicest people and make lifelong friends!
landmark: 44 foot LED tower

name: Burner Brown
description: Great music, party games, dancing, and general shenanigans.  We make janky look good!
landmark: colorful 6 ft flags , sobriety checkpoint sign

name: The Living Room
description: Did you forget to bring your living room to the burn? Don't worry, you can use ours! We have comfy spots to chill out, relax, and/or socialize. Join us in the morning for yoga, the afternoon for a radically inclusive musical jam sesh, or anytime you're looking for a place to hang out, day or night!
landmark: White dome with a green flag and LEDs.

name: Camp EAT ME
description: We're Camp EAT Me! A collective of goofballs hailing originally from San Francisco, but now all over the country. We're here to serve you the awfulest waffles you've ever had on the playa in 2022!
landmark: EAT Me sign and saloon doors

name: Buddha Lounge
description: The Buddha Lounge is a sound camp offering DJs, workshops, ecstatic dance and meditation.
landmark: Large Buddha Lounge sign in front of an Airstream

name: Hoh
description: Moist, wet, drippy, dank, damp, soggy, sloppy, sluggy, slippery, squishy rainforest. And a tree.
landmark: 12-foot-tall hugging tree

name: Ass Clowns (subject to change)
description: Dusty Buns is a small oasis on the outskirts of town.  We're a beautifully lit, small and simple camp designed to offer the citizens of Black Rock with some wonderful experiences.  This is a space to interact and play.
landmark: Hexagon light above the tan tent at 2:45 and L

name: Wrong?
description: What could go Wrong?  At camp Wrong? you can find the best wrong advice at our Wrong Advice Bar.
landmark: Wrong Advice Bar near Barbie Death Village Art.

name: GALACTIK
landmark: spinning disco ball lit with multicolour disco lights above dance floor under shade structure

name: Battle Born Burners
landmark: Banner on front of the Bar "Battle Born Burners"

name: Bad Boy's Discover Your Kinks
description: Introductions to BDSM for the Vanilla but Curious
landmark: 12x20 foot white Dungeon with large Bad Boy sign

name: All In Reflektion
description: All In Reflektion is a place to reflect and be your best self.
landmark: Big All In sign

name: Gravity
description: Step into a digital realm of perceptual vastness, defying the physical and mental limitations of your perceived reality. Gravitate towards your dream experience in one of many time and space altering attractions. You will surely find your true center of GRAVITY here.
landmark: BIG LED Gravity Sign

name: Rat Trap
description: We are your dirty dirty dive bar open all hours, day and night. Come on in, drink our booze, ride our horse and practice radical self stupidity.
landmark: Giant steel rocking horse and mannequins

name: Radio Electra
description:
Radio Electra 89.9 FM. 
Out on the playa once again for our 22nd year! Bringing you our usual eclectic array of music, mayhem and critical commentary!  We welcome Theme Camp representatives and artists to stop in and tell our listeners about your projects and camp events live on the air.  Or you can give us a prerecorded PSA.  We are here to help make your project a success.
landmark: Radio tower with "Radio Electra" signs out front.

name: Deaf Granny's Kitchen
description: Meet Deaf Granny, a little old lady inhabiting a vintage 1950s kitchen.  She's serving up goodies (and some baddies) within a semi-improvisational interactive performance art project.  Sit in her kitchen and interact with her and the satirical stereotype characters that surround her.  Together, we will humorously confront and break down your preconceived notions and lovingly draw you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening to concepts and forms of visual communication and particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf peoples.  Oh, just come.  We'll mess with your head and everyone will have a grand time!
landmark: high billboard with Deaf Granny's face & red arrow

name: Friki Diki
description: Come to the Friki Diki bar in Golden Guy alley for some non-culturally-appropriated, non-denominational, hand-crafted, grass-fed drinks and fun.
landmark: bamboo tiki hut with the Friki Diki sign in front.

name: Irrelephant Bird Camp
description: Colorful eyebrows? CHECK! Dunking Contest? CHECK! Bad Movies? CHECK! Yacht rock? Jock rock? Not rock? Check, check, and check! Trying to get a handle on what we do here at Irrelephant Bird Camp? Don't even try it. Just come by and get a little silly with us, touch base with reality, or take a nap overseas.
landmark: Surf lounge with painted beach backdrop

name: Burnpops Scorpion Anglerfish
description: We are an all inclusive, family friendly camp. Come grab an ice cold popsicle or a delicious cocktail and take a ride on the all famous Scorpion Art Car!
landmark: Scorpion Tail

name: Black Rock Public Library
description: Come to our stacks to relax and learn facts. A one-year checkout, perhaps? Let it lapse and staff shan't be lax, lest all order collapse. We said quiet in the stacks! No, not us. Union contracts.
landmark: Black vinyl banner w/camp name; white book flags

name: Pandora's Lounge & Fix-it Shoppe
description:
Our camp keeps our fellow Burners biking: our repair shop offers education,  tools and parts, for bike repair. Actually we'll help you repair just about anything, but bikes are our specialty. We also love to mix drinks and host visitors in our adjacent lounge.

Bike repair is our specialty, we will teach you to do your repair. We are open 24 hrs a day. We have a bar and lounge to make life easier.
landmark: The Big Red Arrow

name: Freaks United Karma Collective
description:
Come learn how to fly your freak flag at camp FUKC! Freaks United Karma Collective is your spot for learning, with focus on kink education, yoga & mindfulness, playa survival, COVID education, and Arts & Crafts. 

Did I mention we have the irrefutably best Bloody Marys in town? Yup. The best.
landmark: FUKC flag

name: Magic Lantern Society
description:
The Magic Lantern is a wandering inn, located at the end of all worlds. Well-appointed with antiques, curiosities, and mysterious old books, we are a space for deeper human connection, and a warm and inviting sanctuary to the weary traveller. 

Our centerpiece is our unique Trading Booth, where stories and secrets are the only accepted currency. Anyone can step up to don our shopkeeper's hat—we believe in erasing the boundaries between host and traveller.
landmark: garlic-shaped tent

name: Clamp Camp
description: The Clamp Camp mission is to help you hold it together…temporarily.  Please stop by to consult with our Clamp Counselors who will help you with your clamping needs, or stay a while for creative fun in our workshop. Become a contestant for our Clampionship Belt or Golden Clamp Awards!
landmark: Big Clamp Camp sign and our giant arrow bus

name: Ludus Symposium
description: Ludus (playful love) Symposium (Meeting for music, drinking and intellectual discussion) is a place to hang out on our friendly deck/bar above the playa and watch cheezy cult movies.
landmark: Colorful ohm flags lining our border

name: Mellow Mountain
hometown: San Francisco bay, San Diego, Portland
description: Mellow Mountaineers invite you to come play on the swings, climb the big purple M look-out, ping-pong, be served frosty beverages and snacks, hang in the lounges and hammock dome, sing Karaoke and get and give Kissy Fish mutant vehicle smooches.
landmark: Swings & "M" purple structure w/white night lights

name: Daydream
hometown: Global Community including Lebanon, UAE, Israel, USA, Canada, Mexico, Colombia, Shanghai, Australia, New Zealand and BEYOND!
description:
What a day (or night) for a Daydream! Come and create, express, relax, renew, revive, and be inspired. By day, we are an art participatory camp where you can help create a community collaborative mural in our from yard. Come to our lounge and check out our Daydream Museum. At night, come and ROAR! to the sounds of our incredible musical lineup while you dance in our auditorium of sounds and lights.  

What is a Waking Dream if not a Daydream? Come and be a part of the magic!
landmark: The Giant Jaguar Head and Waking Dream Art Wall

name: Camp Peace of Ass
description: If riding your bike is a PAIN IN THE BUTT, come see us at Camp Peace of Ass where we will address your problems by covering your bike seat in cushy, colorful, fleecy, bike seat cover.  Guaranteed to bring Peace to your Ass, or your money back.
landmark: Giant convex mirror display and Camp POA sign

name: BRCtoh
description:
BRC TOUR OF HOMES
One stop resource for finding your forever home in the desert.
Our friendly and welcoming staff will assist you with all your housing concerns, while creating lovely trinkets or quenching your thirst. Please come to our Thursday event - Tour of Homes 4PM!
landmark: Multicolored Tiny home. BRC Realty flags.

name: MOTHERPRISMS' MAD HOUSE
description: HAUNTED HOUSE BUT IN TENTS.  WEAR YOU BEST HALLOWEEN OUTFIT TO GET CANDY.  OPEN MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY, 6 TO 11 AT SILICON VILLAGE.
landmark: LARGE TENTS IN L SHAPE, HUGE SIGN OUT FRONT

name: Hushville Free Library
description: A curated collection of high quality books, especially on the topics of popular science, sci-fi, fantasy, and miscellaneous other topics. Do plan to browse.
landmark: book shelves adjacent to Annie's Comfort/Hushville

name: Mo's Mini Martini + Erotica Camp
description: Mo's Mini Martini and Erotica. The only place on the playa for the hottest erotica(written by YOU)and the coldest martini. Drop your camel at our Bedouin tent and find a clear piece of carpet for the best martini in BRC. Your ruggy neighbor may be a nude magician or a long haul trucker but we specialize in a convivial atmosphere for the best view and conversation on the playa
landmark: Giant martini in the sky

name: HEX Collective
description:
We are artists. Adventurers. Consciousness engineers. Life hackers. Flowstate facilitators. A dynamic international network comprised of creative and talented entrepreneurs, leaders, authors, speakers. We are a tribe impacting humanity in large and small ways – all year round.

We gather on the playa to connect, laugh, grow, dance and share! To give back. To exceed the scope and impact of our offerings and gift each year we return home. To expand as a force for change, positivity, and love.

We believe in exponential impact of empowerment, the momentum of meaningful movements, the cathartic creative power of conscious community.
landmark: 6; 2-story illuminated scaffolding towers

name: Camp Shanks
description: We are support staff for Black Rock City Supper Club and ESD (Ken, Mac, Erika, Nathan) and for ARTery.  We are the organizers of the annual Nevada Burners Photo Shoot (always Thursday of Burn Week at 4 pm on the 6 o'clock side of the Man).  We are BRC ICE (not Arctica!) and we welcome you to our occasional FluffBar (best found in passing).  There's also a photo booth with sheep.
landmark: Camp sign, FluffBar, Bo Peep sheep art/photo booth

name: NOMMOS
description:
We are Nommos and we come from the water. 
Take a deep glance into your present
Expand yourself, grow, feel, and evolve
Swim beyond your imaginable limit
Embrace "The Privilege"
Stop being you to be YOU
Stay awake and connect from there
Do!
Adopt leadership and protect our blue planet
Through Water we change the world
landmark: large chill area next to Nommos mutant vehicle

name: Camp Be Bothered
description: We Camp Be Bothered to fill this out.
landmark: Hot pink and aqua draping over a 20' geo-dome

name: Zoo Camp
description: ACB (Animal Cracker Box) bus will offer some day and night cruises with music on board and fresh drinks
landmark: White ZOOCAMP FLAG or ACB Artcar

name: Sovereign Nation of Farkovia
description:
The Co-Reality Collective (CRC) is an international group of burners, artists, philosophers, technologists and polymaths who hosted magical online parties for their communities during lockdown.  These creative not-for-profit community events featured immersive theater, fun shops, play shops and forged friendships hosted through an interlinked web of zoom rooms.
Now CRC is being called to Playa, to bring forth their immersive theater, fun shops, play shops and friendship, In Real Life (IRL) to hold creative space at Black Rock City 2022.
landmark: "CRC" lit up sign and LED Stuffed Unicorn Head

name: Flaming Flamingos
description: Flaming Flamings Down Under International is a camp that brings Aussie Burners to the Burn to make fire art
landmark: Illumination Village Village sign

name: Rascaltown
description: Just a few Little Rascals living inside of Hushville. Come visit us.
landmark: Tie Dye banner that says Rascaltown

name: UnStable
description: Home of Chester the Fire breathing, Flame throwing mutant vehicle hosting both amatuer and professional
landmark: Illumination Village Sign

name: The Last Mercantile
description: The Bizarre Bazaar of the Last Word Camp offers many delights & temptations.  Procure some necessities/sundries at the well-stocked Bodega.  Manifest your dreams - or nightmares – when you open our secret door & slither through our celestial portal; witness the Steampunk Ultimate Drink Machine concoct delicious libations for your drinking pleasure; play our 10 principles roulette wheel at the bar; get bad advice from our good campsters; decorate a pair of our provided sunglasses; climb our observation platform for Playa views, get a facial, paint your nails or take a nap at our relaxing Spahh.  All welcome Monday through Saturday 2-6PM.
landmark: Big Red Carnival wagon with "Bizaare Bazaar" on it

name: Enrichment.Institute
description:
The Portal Enrichment Center will host the Weighted Companion Cube Mutant Vehicle, along with (non-portal related) Virtual Reality content.

Classes describing how soon "Full Dive" VR will be available will be taught during the day. In the evening, Test Subjects will compete in the "Beat Saber" competition ladder, and the best two high scores in each age bracket will compete Saturday Night after the burn for the final Annual "Burn Beat Saber" champion title.

VR meditation will be available very late night.
landmark: Go to the Playfully Yours bar and ask

name: Camp Scatter
description: CAMP SCATTER pays tribute to the all but forgotten Prince of Mayhem, Elvis' chimpanzee, SCATTER PRESLEY, who once reigned over GRACELAND with a bottle of Bourbon and an unbridled libido. This pampered CHIMP was draped in the finest studded jumpsuits and was known to be the life of the party. We celebrate our friendly furry fiend with daily shenanigans and nightly Elvis movies featuring the most unruly interruptions at our legendary BANANA HAMMOCK THEATER. Stop by and swing with us; grab a banana rum shot or an ice-cold beer and put your monkey feet up.
landmark: 4x 8ft orange flags with monkey faces & LED sign

name: Tequila Bees
description: The Tequila Bees, Buzz on by Anytime and say Hi........
landmark: Tequlia Bees lighted sign.

name: Boom Boom Womb
description: Boom Boom Womb is a chosen family of burners who elevate the feminine and funky and celebrate child-like wonder.
landmark: 3' Moon. Shade with 18' truss topped with lights.

name: El Tesoro
description: El Tesoro - The Treasure, NOT the tequila.  Although, our drinks are superb, out life size games are extraordinarily delightful, and our excitement is even better.  Thirsty souls (sore soles) are always welcome.
landmark: Giant El Tesoro sign, shape of the NEVADA

name: Nose Fish
description:
Mornings, come by and get our alien to secrete you a cup of fresh coffee. 

Afternoons, come by Repair Cafe to  *Get your costumes altered and your rips mended , *Fix your bike, * Fix your defective electronics (EL Wire/LED/???) repaired. 

Evenings enjoy the MEZ interactive video screen and dance the night away.

Are you a fixer or sewist?  Come by and fix stuff with the Nose Fish Fixit Folks.
landmark: Large colorful fish kits and fish skeletons

name: Kelly's
description: Camp Caralho is a close-knit, gay-friendly diverse camp with a history at burning man that goes back to 1993, Come chill out in our Art Light Chill Space or learn something new about: Coffee Appreciation, Playa Cooking, Or old time Gay Flagging.
landmark: Camp Caralho flag in front of our camp

name: Fresh Squeezed!
description: Art & Lemonade since 2006. Come join us for ice cold lemonade and group painting.
landmark: Large yellow flags with giant Lemon

name: Flat Tire Cafe
description:
Flat Tire Cafe serves cold brew coffee every morning from 10AM to 2PM and fixes bicycles in our bike shop during the same time! We offer an interactive game lounge and community gathering space in a beautiful shady environment. Host to community happenings and pop-up performances, our vibe is very daytime and welcoming to everyone. 

Come by and enjoy a cold brew while we get your bicycle going!
landmark: Giant colorful scaffold shade structure - Big sign

name: Arabella's Lair
description:
Arabella is a beautiful art nouveau phoenix with stunning lighting and dramatic flame effects as well as a luxurious bar and lounge area inside.   
When she isn't up to shenanigans at the trash fences or disrupting "circle" over at yum camp, she lives here, in her dusty lair.
landmark: The most beautiful art car (or flame chicken bus)

name: CouchBurners
description: A cozy oasis offering shade, restful couches and a hammock forest, life-size games, workshops, a cuddle-puddle, tasty libations, late-night warming fire and black coffee. If you know where to look within our inviting Ma'Ahal, you may also encounter a rather curious little shopkeeper. Black Rock citizens for over a decade, we are a diverse international collective of travelers, hosts, creators, misfits, and friends from many walks of life and corners of the earth. Find us by the perimeter of international flags.
landmark: Perimeter of international flags

name: HARDLY
description: Hardly Theme Camp runs a 24/7 whiskey western themed saloon known as "Hardly's".
landmark: bright red H 50 feet in the air.

name: Clue Bar (Murder Mysteries)
description:
Signature cocktails, hydration, and murder under the shade.
Join our theatrical company for murder most foul, don those sexy heels and join us for the drag races and disco, or join us for the neighborhood block party on Sunday!
landmark: Solid red structure/red and yellow flags on street

name: Fantastic Sams
description: Camp Fantastic Sams is the playa's diner and dive. We serve breakfast during the week (check the schedule) and drinks when we feel like it. We are LGBTQIA+ friendly, and look forward to seeing you at our camp.
landmark: big fantastic sams sign and pride flag

name: Shaman's Dream Journey
description:
Our Plan objective involves the following:
Learning the Art of "The Shamanic Journey" (an Altered State of Awareness) through  traditional drumming, guided meditations, visualizations,  medicinal teas, and ecstatic body movements. 
Participants will be guided in a Dream Journey to  the Spirits of the Desert  Plants and Minerals to learn their wisdom and ask for their guidance to become better stewards of the land.
landmark: Our camp name will be painted above our entrance

name: Camp Millions of Cats
landmark: Gigsville village

name: Cabana Club
description: The Favorite Vacation Destination for the Citizens of Black Rock City!
landmark: Cabana Club Lighted Signage

name: I Love Elephants
description: We love Elephants & the wisdom of Ganesh: We love them in herds, on carousels, in paint, in song, and thru our Asana practice. Express your love of them! We are hosting talks, yoga, sound baths and music everyday! Be guided to bliss under our huge Ganesh tent! Paint laser cut wood elephants in our Yaari Tent of Glow. Body painting too!  This may seem irreverent, but elephants look strange, yet are the most compassionate animal on this planet! Humans are more strange – we can learn much from these loving creatures. Conventional approaches to saving elephants isn't working – we need the unconventional! Be Unconventional – Join "I Love Elephants" camp at Burning Man! We also have a multitude of info-panels with little known elephants facts. Meet our Elephant activists too ;)
landmark: elephant carousel and light sticks projecting 40'

name: Synapse Conduit
description:
Our ultimate objective is to bring people together to build a multi-generational camaraderie and friendships that extend beyond the playa, bringing/keeping the spirit of the 10 principles to the default world.
 
Our interactivity starts with the Synapse Conduit bar which has proven to be successful not because we pour strong drinks and play loud music but rather because it is intimate and interactive with music in the background where our love shines through with our number of activities.

From the bar you walk into our multi-media experiential portal into a parallel universe.... 

 - Fortune Telling and Tarot Card Readings
- Body Groove with KareBear - Your neighborhood dance class!  
- Hat Exchange Bar
- Ted Talk Wednesday
landmark: Silver eye and lightning bolts

name: Black Rock City Piano Bar
description:
Enjoy live music on playa.  Our Baby Grand Piano combined with all the amazingly talented individuals in Black Rock City creates magical moments.  
Come join us for cold on tap beer, and listen to wonderful acoustic music.
landmark: The 4 BRC Piano Bar flags of our lit Marquee

name: Jazzy Cat Butts
description:
JankyAzzCats Village Features camps The Janky Barge, Catmandu, Camp Butter, Loca Colada, and The Black Rock Bandits. 
Our village is focused on the theme of artistic expression of movement - not just through one's own body, but with physical art. Attend our Art car symposiums, workshops, and village happy hours to learn more about building and designing moving art vehicles.
Come by for sunset tiki cocktails at our Oasis Bar, lounge and dance with us at the Catmandu projection dome, and have a drink or two at Loca Colada Lounge and the Butter Bar! Our art cars do community ice & recycling runs in the morning.
landmark: The Janky Barge, Azeban or our large LED shield

name: Krepe Burners
description:
Come eat the best crepes in ze world!
Real French Crepes, made by a real French crew!
Choose to have your French crepe flambée with Rum, or one of our non alcoholic option.
landmark: Rogue Nation Village sign

name: Black Rock City Tea Company
description: We welcome everyone into our shaded Tea Parlor to partake in our original sun brewed teas (alcoholic for 21+), participate in a Tea Ceremony led by one of our Tea Masters, sing along with live piano karaoke and engage in lively conversation.
landmark: teal arbor out front with the Tea Company sign

name: Washed Up Yacht Village
description: Come get your costumes fixed, your snaps affixed, and your Bailey's fix at Snap n' Chap and Old Gregg's Place!
landmark: Orange geo-dome and storage container roof-deck

name: Dream Inn
description: On Monday thru Saturday come to a scheduled event at EBB & Glow Village and enter the raffle for that night's stay (for 1-2) at The Dream Inn, a luxury bed and breakfast. Upon winning, you'll be checked-in by the Concierge who will orient you to the Inn's amenities and house rules. You'll be treated to welcome snacks and beverages, shown toiletries with which to refresh yourself and plush loungewear to relax in while listening to the soothing music of your choice. You'll spend the night on freshly laundered 100% cotton sheets with a cozy duvet for warmth.  A Continental Breakfast basket will be delivered to your door in the morning.  Before 10am checkout, select an item or two from the jewelry chest to keep as permanent mementos of your LNT stay at The Dream Inn.
landmark: purple roofed round canvas tent with a big lantern

name: Fabulous Disaster
hometown: San Francisco, Los Angeles, Pittsburgh, New York, Durham, Wellington, Vancouver, etc.  We're spread all over.
landmark: Gigsville's car on fire

name: Twisted Swan Celtic pub
description: Open 8PM-2AM  M-F come for good beer, irish coffee, mead and whisky.  Water for those who want it.
landmark: The big blue pub with the red door.

name: Perky Parts
description: We are a motley bunch of degenerates and doctors who love our music, our drink, and our fun.
landmark: Dante's Inferno Structure

name: Krème Burners
description: Imagine you are riding your bike through Black Rock City in the Nevada desert, sunburned, tired and dusty. You hear music in the distance. You arrive to see beautiful people dancing, laughing, drinking and bouncing on a trampoline. Someone hands you a ticket. What's going on here? Soon someone brings you a real earthenware ramekin and a clean stainless steel spoon! It's cool in your hand and smells of caramelized sugar. When you look inside you see the freshest raspberry with a sprig of bright green mint sitting atop a dark brown and tan mottled surface. You dip your spoon in and the top layer cracks audibly. Beneath the fissure is a cool, rich, creamy custard. You have just experienced one of the tastiest Creme Brulees, and that too, at Burning Man. You will never be the same.
landmark: Rogue Nation Village  Sign

name: Temple of Bacchus
description:
Come have some wine and rest a while

Bacchus loves you he just loves you more between 2pm and 8pm since that's when we serve.  But come by any time and sit a spell or take a hammock nap.
landmark: Large banner with the camp name temple of Bacchus

name: Mary E's Lavender Hand Wash
description: We are a friendly camp that provides a relaxing hand wash and massage. Lotion and conversation are also provided. We are open from 11:00 to 5:00 Monday through Friday and Saturday 11:00 to 1:00. Join us also for our Thursday night Purple Rain party at 6:00.
landmark: Large dream catcher

name: Habitat for Insanity
description: Habitat for Insanity creates and uses novel burner technology. We produce hand-tossed, wood fired pizza in an oven of our own design. We run Live Karaoke, make new and classic drinks on shave-ice form and run daytime talks.
landmark: White Star tent with Habitat for Insanity logo

name: DR. PLAYA'S EAR NOSE & THROAT
description: Come to see Dr. Playa to have your ears, nose, and throat refreshed by our complete package of spa-like treatments- no appointment necessary! We offer cotton swabs to clean dusty ears, essential oils for for your mask, and an 'injection' of infused vodka (or plain juice) to soothe your throat. 'Cat' scans are included! Yes, we will use our handy, silly stuffed cat to scan your body from head to toe. All ages welcome and encouraged to visit!
landmark: Look for the "Dr. Playa ENT Clinic" sign

name: Glam Clams
description: Community! Love! And! Music! / Movement! / Massages! / Mischief! At the G.L.A.M. Clams, we are the family you want to choose. Come connect with fellow burners and take care of our community at our welcoming space. And, shake your damn booty on our dancefloor. Souls of Black Rock City unite
landmark: Lit up Glam Clam sign or container roof deck

name: The Empress Theme Camp
description: Relive the glory of the Victorian age and enjoy the comforts of a more civilized time in our reinterpretation of a Victorian drawing room. Every afternoon and evening, our gracious hosts and hostesses dress to the Victorian theme, hand-serving  selections from our tea collection along with light snacks.
landmark: Flaming Lamppost

name: OHM HOME
description: OHM Home: We are a mutant vehicle support camp. Home of Ohm Kar, Manta and Tripto Bot. Come n boogie.
landmark: Mutant Vehicles OhmKar, Tripto and Manta.

name: Camp Sweaty Betty
description:
Friendly neighborhood misting Parlor, hair washing, Spa and Bike Repair. Stop in and experience an overall cooling sensation from head to foot as you stroll through the mist. Got crunchy hair, feeling a bit beat...You may qualify for an emergency hair wash; perhaps there is an opening in the massage room...Stop in and chill. Got a flat, derailleur doesn't work, chain broke, we can fix that also. 
Misting & Bike = Open 11:00 to 4:00. DIY Service 10:00 am – 7:00 pm. 
Hair and Spa = Open to Temple Crew Monday - Tuesday
Open To Public: Wednesday – Friday 10:30 am – 3:00 pm
landmark: 2 Big signs that say ' Camp Sweaty Betty'

name: Vines Without Borders
description: We are a true wine bar and lounge, exclusively offering great, chilled wines from around the world annd served by people from around the world. Stop in from 3-12 daily and enjoy our great wines, curated tastings, Burning Man themed art projects, and make some new friends. We celebrate a different wine producing region daily.
landmark: Mural with Camp Name, and Large Round Light Ball

name: Cameltopia
description: You Look Thirsty! Welcome to Cameltopia, your desert oasis and refuge from the sun's heat. You are welcome to pet the camels but please do not feed the animals. Recharge your soul and fill your vessel with premium unleaded H20 at our post-apocalyptic "Route 66" gas station. Our attendants will refuel your canteen while you browse our Inconvenience Store. Saturday-Friday 10AM-4PM Playa Standard Time. Wednesday afternoon is our annual "Hump Day" party from 3:33 - 5:55pm with an eclectic mix of tail-shaking beats!
landmark: gas station setup on the camp's frontage road

name: T.B.C.
landmark: Red and yellow colors, Lit up installations, Bball

name: Home Sweet Dome
description: At the heart of Hushville, Home Sweet Dome offers shade in the daytime, a lighted area at night, for social interaction and chill. No music, this is Hushville, unless it's home made hand made with acoustic instruments. We host events in the Hushville Events Calendar with our space, and offer battery charging for your phones, cameras, computers, etc. We also can provide light bike repair, and have some supplies to get your bike back up and running.
landmark: geodesic dome in custom maroon/white/blue domeskin

name: Fyre Fly
description: Come join Camp Fyre Fly and Mutant Vehicle Fyre Flye for free playa excursions and refreshments to enjoy BRC like you have never seen or experienced before.
landmark: Giant eagle mutant vehicle soaring above clouds

name: Primal Oasis
description: Reforming from the primordial dust, we are a handful of hardy burners welcoming adventurers to join us for refreshments and respite. Drop by and find yourself challenged to a mission.
landmark: The big AEZ tower. We will be close nearby.

name: Pig Nest
description:
Pigs unite! 
Pigs eat pizza, find us deep playa at the Saucy Sow.
Pigs need rest, find us in the city at the Pigs Nest.
Pig out, pig in (let us begin).
landmark: 10' tall Pentagonal wood structure with blue cloth

name: The Crusty Swan
description: A tiny, "neighborhood" pub where you can sit for a bit and enjoy a wee dram of whiskey or a tall glass of iced tea (for you that don't imbibe), along with some good craic.  Erin go bragh!
landmark: Irish flag in Hushville.

name: Camp Clusterfuck
description: Crystal Groove is a mobile sound stage fueled by unconditional love and bumping high vibration house music.  Look for a cluster of glowing crystals in the distance and feel your way to your highest state of bliss.
landmark: Big yellow bus with a three story scaffolding

name: Discotique Pancake Boutique
description: We're a network of volunteers inspired by the 10 Principles of burning man, united in the pursuit of a more creative & connected world. We're on a mission to extend Burning Man's culture to our everyday lives.
landmark: 6x LED Mirrors

name: Religious As Fuck
description: We are a bunch of people that speak openly about our relationship with God. Some of whom simply have found Christianity as well as other faiths to be helpful in our own spiritual journeys. When we interact with people at Religious AF, we are there to welcome them, serve them and answer their questions.  We aren't recruiting them, or asking them to join anything. We practice Radical Inclusion, conversation, prayer, and ritual to all who seek it: gay, trans, straight, high, sober, clothed, naked, polyamorous, monogamous, celibate, gracious, and grumpy alike. We have welcomed people in all of those categories and more because we also identify as those folks. We want to participate and co-create experiences that open hearts and connect us with the Divine.
landmark: May I Bless You Sign

name: Phantasmagoria Camp
landmark: Address  and sign Hot Mess camp

name: Playa Jazz Cafe
description: A Jazz club/ Cafe featuring nightly Jazz jam sessions and performances and daily chill space and workshops in Jazz history and theory.
landmark: Green Parachute Dome and "Jazz Cafe" sign

name: FAFA Camp
description: Stop by FAFA Camp, and you may very well meet a new friend who will offer you a cozy refuge, some libations, and a warm welcome.  Our Campers come from all over the world and U.S., and this international and national diversity drives the ambience of our camp and our interactivities.  We sing; we dance; we offer interesting interactivities that often change from year to year; we participate in our neighborhood.  We look forward to meeting you all!
landmark: FAFA sign and international flags

name: Hibernaculum
description:
The Hibernaculum is a bat and cave-themed workshop space and a set of fun, interactive installations. The Hibernaculum provides physical activity and outdoor-themed workshops; a photo booth; and other fun cave-themed experiences.

Hometown: Vancouver island; Colorado; California; the UK; Alberta; Mexico
landmark: merry go round with a big bat head and wings

name: Airstreameri and What Not
description: Home to Playa's Best PostCards & Dusty Scientific Talks! Because 'nothing to write home about' doesn't apply here & ignorance is not bliss. Bring your address book & send some love back to the default world! Special libations + yard games every evening!
landmark: Large silver PEACE sign + Airstream Trailers

name: Camp Pull My Finger
description: Biscuits and Gravy Brunch (Tues/Thurs) "Second best thing you'll put in your mouth all week" as reported by somebody.  Dailey themed bar and scheduled events.  Stop by for shade and shenanigans
landmark: Large silver shade structure with hand cutouts

name: Southern Discomfort
description: We all come from the South of something. Best Kentucky Lemonades on the Playa. Stop by to disconnect to reconnect.
landmark: the Southern Discomfort flag

name: Nothing Butt Art
description:
We supply the canvas and paint, you supply the cheeks or any other body part, together, we will create nothing butt art! Complimentary T-shirts provided to participants. We also feature body stamp temporary tattoos . Stop by, make some art and get a tramp stamp.

Sunset Journey Home Table. Share your journey "Home" while enjoying an ice cold IPA. Our bar table has become a focal point for all to express themselves with marking pens, paint, pictures for gifting their stories for all who visit the camp.
landmark: 20' x 30' Aluminet shade cover

name: CURB
description: Like if Cheers and Paddy's had a baby bar, except without the homophobia, misogyny and casual racism.
landmark: Reno Arch emblazoned with BRCU

name: Cranky and Sons Bike Repair
description: Come to Cranky and Sons for assistance, education and advice for all your cycling needs, from a flat tire to exploded derailleur — we'll help you get back out onto the playa.  If you've got some free time and can lend a hand, grab a beer and a wrench and help us help those in need!  Mechanics on duty mid-morning to mid-afternoon; DIY tools and supplies available 24/7.
landmark: White flag:  "Cranky and Sons Bike Repair"

name: Camp Frame Works
description: Do pickle backs tickle your fancy? C'mon down to pickle town for our hotdog happy hour and quench your thirst with some pickle back goodness.
landmark: Lots of triangles in the bike parking area

name: Glowskull Asylum Int'l
description: Glowskull Asylum Int'l brings extreme metal radical inclusion to the playa. Are you craving some good headbanging and want to meet exotic misfits from random places all over the world? Our bar, SkØllushery, and art car "Castle Glowskull" will be hosting mischief, ultra-violence, and twisted METAL (and other forms of rock) daily. All varieties of humans welcome!
landmark: line of LED flame lampposts and our skull art car

name: Valhalla On The Playa
description: NA
landmark: LED Man statue

name: Simian Akademy
description:
Flat bicycle tire and nowhere to turn?  Well, you may be 'all thumbs' but if at least two are opposable, we can help you fix it!  Drag that squeaky chain or flat tire to Simian Akademy and our dedicated team of trained monkeys will help you fix it.  If a monkey can do it, you can too!

Looking for a truly unique interactive experience? Come visit the Olfactorium where our Mistress of Scent will concoct a custom perfume just for you, based on your unique, personal preferences.

Feeling cranky from the heat? Your new best friend getting on your nerves already? You need to CHILL THE FUCK OUT AND COLOR! Come visit our shaded dome to relax and color your frustrations away. Choose your favorite, beautifully embellished swear word, or perhaps a picture of unicorns being total assholes!
landmark: Two pointy white pylons, and dome with 6 antennas

name: Nerd Ranch
description: Meowdy! Beam on down to Nerd Ranch, y'all! We've got the hairiest wampas and sharpest lightsabers this side of the wormhole! If your 1-UP is kicking in, and you need refreshment, stop by Gowron's Glory Hole for a cool power-up beverage. Cylons in your tent? Come get deputized as a Sheriff of Nerd Ranch and show them who's the law! If you've been lied to by cake too many times, stop by for Picard Day or Galactic Empire Day and dance your antennae off! So whether you're a hoopy frood who knows where your towel is at or the scruffiest of nerf herders, bring your onesies and tune up your warp drive, because today is a good day to Burn! Yeehaw!
landmark: glowing NERD RANCH sign on our gate entrance.

name: Daddy Issues
description: No daddy issues? Come get some! We are a group of life-long friends, predominantly in Seattle, WA. We love rainbows, being playful, and a little bit of riff-raff, but we also invite everybody to come explore their deeper selves through our feelings corner. Join us for our annual Queer Pancakes Brunch (Weds at noon) and Dad Rock Happy Hour (Mon evening). At night you can come enjoy our light art installations, including a lit up rainbow 3 story climbing structure and a LED game and interactivity wall. We all have daddy issues, and from this we have become a group of light-hearted, playful, and introspective aliens.
landmark: Daddy Issues sign; 2 story wood cubes 3 cubes wide

name: Alter Ego
description: Camp Alter Ego wants to create experiences through art that challenge and expand one's sense of self.
landmark: ALTER EGO sign & 5 Black flags on White Structure

name: Kamp Kaos
landmark: The big maze on a corner on the A radial.

name: Cool Cat Cafe
description: Cool Cat Cafe - We are all meow all the time, 24/7 meow. It's not just a word, it's a way of life. Stop by during the day for refreshing drinks and events or stop by at night to visit our bar. We look forward to meowing with you.
landmark: Sphinx Sculpture & Disco Cat

name: Miso!
description: Come join Miso! for late night miso soup and sake underneath our 20 ft bar tower. Enjoy our consent based workshops and events during the day in our event space. All are welcome!
landmark: 20' tall tower with the big yellow buddha

name: Friendgasm
description: Friendgasms! Fweddings! Lucifer! Hamilton! Craft cocktails! We do it all, we do it randomly, and we do it for the glory of our Dark Lord! (And we also honor the Oxford comma because we're not barbarians, even if our overuse of exclamation points is nigh-criminal.)
landmark: Large dome covered with shade triangles

name: Baby Behead and Breakfast
description: Rest your weary soul in our unique village of outsiders. Baby Behead & Breakfast isn't a free hugs and yoga camp instead we make you cringe and you'll like it. Join us for breakfast or chill in our lounge for tea and hookah.
landmark: the babydoll lamp posts

name: Rumor Mill
description: A Burning Man theme camp dedicated to exploring our humanity, both as individuals and as a collective. Guests at our camp are encouraged to listen, think, and express their ideas for improving the human condition.
landmark: Half Sun and Prototopia Sign

name: Camp Shit Ain't Right
description:
Hicktown-based with international flair - campmates from Wyoming, Canada, New Zealand, Russia, Australia, Germany, Netherlands... aaaand I'm definitely missing some.  
Come visit for public lounge, clothing boutique, large-scale painting, shitty punch and more!
landmark: Large "Camp Shit Ain't Right" sign

name: Black Rock Observatory Theme Camp
description: Black Rock Observatory is a mobile astronomical observatory dedicated to showing people just how amazing the universe is. Started at Burning Man in 2014, we have expanded beyond the borders of Black Rock City to educational institutions and events all along the West Coast.
landmark: Big Green Parachute

name: Camp Skynyrd
description: An Oasis of Ignorance in a Sea of Enlightenment
landmark: Car-B-Que [center of Gigsville]

name: Hookers & Makers
description: Hookers & Makers is a camp dedicated to turning spectators into participants via crochet, crafting, casting and general shenanigans.
landmark: Big crochet arch.  (Also maybe Falcor)

name: Bright Cider Life
description:
Icy cold cider, shade and shenanigans every afternoon. 
Wednesday and Friday Sunset English Wassailing ceremony 
Mon, Thurs and Sat  4pm Kundalini Yoga
landmark: Giant Apple

name: Space Punks
description:
Live Music, YOU make it happen! full backline stage, Day and night.
Sonic Boom Saloon, Daytime drinking and whip cracking!
landmark: 20 x 20 Stage truss with silver maniquins on front

name: Nuclear Dandelion
description:
Helping discover and release the inner beauty and strength in everyone even in the harshest of times. Come visit our "One Dandi of a Spa" daily.

https://www.nucleardandelion.com/
landmark: white/yellow flags surround the main structure

name: Drips and Drops
description: Coffee and tunes to sooth your dusty soul. Hours of service vary greatly.
landmark: 2-3 Large Shipping Containers in village center

name: Old Gregg's Place
description: Are you in need of the touch of a scaly manfish's sweet hand?  Need a sip of refreshingly cool Bailey's while dancing to some of the sickest funk on playa?  Come visit Old Gregg's Place -- we'll deal with it.
landmark: Orange geo-dome and storage container roof-deck

name: VW Bus Camp
description: For Waking Dreams VW Bus Camp and Leopard Lounge is bringing back our fabulous lounge and day spa, Grateful Dyed tie dye party, Mother's High Tea, Hooping, Games, Live Music, Brain Freeze Challenge and wait there's much, much more! Enter camp, tour and experience 1990's style Burning Man. Expect so many surprises and so much fun that you will never want to leave. Also, bring a white cotton T shirt for Wednesday's Grateful Dyed party!
landmark: VW Campers, Tiki Bar and large sparkly school bus.

name: Lily Pad Lounge
description: Snap n' Chap: attachment and abrasion therapy craft camp
landmark: Flagpole with Snap and Pirate Duck

name: Shady Village
description: You Look Thirsty! Take refuge from the sun and frolic with our trained Camels. Recharge your soul and fill your vessel with premium unleaded H20. Our attendants serve artisanal organic water while you browse our Inconvenience store. Saturday-Friday 10AM-46PM Playa Standard Time.
landmark: Giant blinking LED snocone

name: IKIGAI
description: We all hail from different countries and cultures around the world but we all share the lifelong pursuit of finding one's personal Ikigai, reason for being.
