DISTRIKT is a 501c3 Non-Profit music and arts organization, supporting an inclusive and diverse community of performers and artists through events, partnerships, community involvement, mentorship and relationship building. DISTRIKT was founded in 2010 based on the ethos of the Ten Principles of Burning Man, and over the past decade has evolved into globally recognized philanthropic organization.  

DISTRIKT is an ever-evolving organization with a core believe that it is important for us to have a strong connection and experience with the community that we celebrate.

Our mission is to leverage our wide community reach to support efforts focused on helping our community, our country and our planet.
landmark: joyous dancing crowd and large DISTRIKT sign.

name: Destiny Lounge 3D
description: Destiny Lounge 3D invites you to enjoy our astounding 3D lounge completely surrounded by amazing 3D UV artwork! Have your mind completely blown by our incredible artistry, and get the best sloppy wet Free Blowjobs available on the playa: all ages, genders, and species welcome!!
landmark: Large Destiny Lounge sign on pointy white canopies

name: Scarbutts Cafe
description:
The Breakfast Club Village Houses,
 Scarbutts Cafe-serving  brisk Spankings 9am-12noon

 Pancake Playhouse- serving hot pancakes 9am-12noon

Objectification Station 1pm-3pm Monday through Friday. Come get objectified or get compliments and get rewarded with a delicious quenching  drink.

 

Text for What Where When
Monday-Friday 9-12  Stop by for Pancakes,Spankings and Soft Rock.1pm-3pm Objectification stat
landmark: scarbutts cafe sign and Pancake sign

name: Badlands Bordello
description: Badlands Bordello is a steampunk brothel Our venue will be open Daily for the Chillzone 1pm - 4pm, great music, Herbal teas and refreshments. Our Comfortable venue will have numerous psychedelic decorations, theme parties, psychedelic lightshows and interactive experiences. The Venue will also feature very comfortable and plush furniture. Wednesday at 4pm - 8pm will be our All White Psytrance world class DJ Party!
landmark: Bordello Frontage with LEDTree, Chicken, Stoplight

name: Camp Bamboozlers
description: A playful oasis on the playa creating mind and heart opening experiences for the community. Our welcoming lounge is a place for people to recharge to the tune of gentle, psychedelic-inspired electronica music while developing deeper bonds with our fellow humans. Our events aim to help people be present in the moment, learn something new about themselves and others, and receive a gift they will treasure.
landmark: Bright psychedelic banner at our entrance

name: Ganesh Camp
description: Ganesh Camp is a lush retreat for dusty desert denizens. Noon 5, Tue Fri, celebrate and beat the heat in the bar in a large, cool desert tent from India or sit by the burn barrel at night!  Or play volleyball during the day.
landmark: Rajasthani desert tent or lighted "Ganesh" sign

name: Planned Playahood
description: Planned Playahood is offering "second aid" services to un-fuck your burn.
landmark: Blue sign on scaffold

name: AndCamp
description: &Camp is a queer affirming, sex-positive theme camp that celebrates the unity underneath what, on the surface, appears to be duality. Day/night, pleasure/pain, life/death. &Camp is also home to the "This L'il Piggy" mutant vehicle, the lovable piggy who poops freshly-baked cookies!
landmark: golden dome (14'x24'), 2 hanging trampolines, 8' &

name: Mayan Warrior
description:
Mayan Warrior is the result of a collaborative project that has united artists, craftsmen, photographers, designers, technologists, architects and musicians from Mexico City and other parts of the world.

The project's original intent was to present to the world the incredible ascent of contemporary Mexican electronic music while paying respect to the deep and ancient sources from which that visual and auditory culture had grown, all of this to help raise awareness and founds for Mayan Communities in need of basic infrastructure to thrive. 

Both light and sound are curated by some of the world's most prominent artists to transport participants to the very origins of the culture – and to a new understanding of contemporary electronic expression.
landmark: ILUMINA a toroidal steel light tower

name: Putt Putt Palace
description: Pickle Planet is a motley crew of seasoned playa vets that have been building & contributing to the playa ethos for 20+ years. PP campmates offer a more mellow, "Snarkle Pony", lighthearted fun, to the event. Our camp frontage hosts a, 24/7, Pickle Ball Court and holds a daily tournament. There is plenty of comfy space to hang out and get cozy around a fire in the evening. PP is also home to early am coffee bar and friendly afternoon Pickle Back Bar where our village aim's to please and will take great care of replenishing you along your journey. Namaste.. f ur day & have something pickled!
landmark: Dome & Pickle Ball court

name: Global Village
description:
The Global Village is the First International District at Black Rock City, gifting offerings from over 10 camps from around the globe in the form of food, drink, performance, wellness and more. One of our highlights is our Sauna from Finland, swing on by and stay a while. 

We are a Global Village made of regional international camps from around the world! Come to our space to experience our "World's Faire" ." Take a steam in our Sauna, relax in our lounges, try unique foods and drinks from exotic lands and talk to our marionette in a language of your choice. Come learn in our workshops, play in our domes, and make a BurnerWorld a little smaller.
landmark: Big Globe on the Tower

name: Goa People
description:
We want to take everyone on a journey around the globe. Our main goal is to share what we know about this amazing planet with everyone willing to stop by at our camp. We are designing a very unique experience that will turn our main tent into a different continent each day. We will have 7 days to show our guests 7 different continents. 

A very cool thing we are planning to do is to bring a refrigerated truck and use it as an ice-bar, we will call it 'Antarctica"" (so to cover all 7 continents). Inside this truck, we will build a bar, we will place there some nice decorative elements made of ice to bring up the atmosphere. We want to celebrate our planet with all its diversity and greatness, and we welcome everyone who wants to join us in this celebration.
landmark: White tent with sign "Around the world in 7 Days"

name: AdramaNation
hometown: New Orleans, California, Nevada, Arizona, Texas, Belgium, Sweden, Colombia
description: AdramaNation is an all inclusive and diverse camp focusing on a drama free and fun filled burn.  Engaging workshops, delicious delicacies, hydration, art, weddings, burnercise, and good company are to be found with us.  Whether you need a safe space to escape your drama or a place to meet new friends, you're always welcome here.
landmark: AdramaNation Yin/Yang Sign

name: Black Rock University
description: Black Rock University teaches the 10 Principles and Larry Harvey's dream. Virgin Burning Man 101 Headquarters! We also teach playa survival, compatibility and comfort skills to make the desert easier.
landmark: US Flag on a vertical flagpole Costco tan carport

name: Trotsea
description: Live Birds love you!
landmark: flagpole wrapped in green LEDs, with tie dye flag

name: Black Rock Roller Disco
description: Every city has a roller rink.  It's the same for Black Rock City. The Black Rock Roller Disco is the roller rink in the middle of the desert. Here you can put some wheels on your feet and have a funky good time skating the night away.  We're open 24 hours a day every day.  We have skates for you, people to help you and everything you need to share the Burning Man experience at a roller skating rink.
landmark: Golden Gate Bridge

name: Intergalactic
description: Galactic Jungle's interstellar research starship is on a collision course with Black Rock City. Its mission: To abduct BRC residents and submit them to a multitude of vibrational SCI-FI Soundwave experiments.  On this trip to Black Rock City, Galactic Jungle will attempt to access the "universal harmonic code" where sound waves are manipulated to alter the space time continuum, allowing the ship to travel further than any species has ever traveled in the Universe. Needless to say, strange experiments will commence.
landmark: 5 Art Cars and the GJ Black and White flag.

name: BRC Hash House Harriers (BRCH3)
hometown: Phoenix, AZ, San Francisco, CA, and Washington, D.C. as well as other assorted cities throughout the United States.
description:
With members of the BRCH3 found in several camps across the playa, a group of us camp together in the Bike Repair Camp. Our mission: share hashing with BRC while keeping the beer cold and bikes running smoothly.

Join us for a hash on the playa. In addition to our Annual Red Dress Run (Thursday, 3pm, meet at the man), we host a variety of hash activities and events. Check out our events page for more information!

The BRCH3 pays homage to our roots as hashers as we encourage our wankers to live in harmony with the 10 principles of Burning Man while sharing our own hashy culture and community. The two overlap quite nicely!
landmark: Big dome and oversized wooden red BRCH3 letters.

name: Crossroads
description: Crossroads is the place to be for The BEST Live Music on the playa! This camp features 20 of the funkiest, grooviest most outrageously talented musicians and singers in the world. We offer full concerts with songs you love, songs you forgot, and songs you've never heard of but still you wanna dance! We also feature amazing burlesque, boy-lesque, and other alternative acts by beautiful, sexy performers unashamed of bringing something extra to the stage. Additionally we serve delicious, mouth-watering drinks by a super-friendly group of mixologists who can't wait to help you get the party started. And if that wasn't enough we also have the coziest little chill space for you to rest your weary feet and snuggle up with your whole crew in our VIP Condo! Come check us out!
landmark: Giant lit stage with the skulls & Crossroads sign

name: Plaisance
description: Plaisance is French for "a concept of pleasantness in the moment."  We are a Faux French camp highlighting the greatness of everything French.  French Toast, French press coffee, French glacé cones (aka sno-cones), and the finest in cheap French wine. This is capped off by some of the finest fake French accents west of the Louisiana Purchase.  We offer many different educational and entertaining workshops (e.g., Ask a Drunk Lawyer), and afternoon refreshments on our Veranda.
landmark: Beige gazebos and covered front porch

name: Space Racers
description: Have a burning question about deep space exploration? Or a sketchy story you're eager to get off your chest? Come get blasted out of this world with the Space Racers!
landmark: Giant "Space Racers" Banner (or sign)

name: Beats Boutique
description: Beats Boutique is The Fleek of the Week! We will provide the sexiest thrift shop on the playa!!! Not only will you be able to come in and get a whole new wardrobe 24/7, we will have an open bar and banging beats to enjoy in the daytime hours! Beats Boutique is one of the most unique theme camps in BRC!
landmark: Pink /Purple Circus Tent w/ Beats Boutique Flag

name: End of the Line
landmark: Train Depot

name: Wanderer's Camp
description: Our Camp is an oasis on the playa for the Wandering Burner who happens upon our camp and finds shade, HUGS, ice-cold gin/tonics, and delicious hot dogs.  Come by every afternoon from 2:30 to 5:30 for a hot dog or veggie dog, a gin/tonic, and enjoy the shade, great company, and music.  Everyone is welcome to relax in our shade even when we aren't serving.
landmark: Yellow Flag, Wanderers Camp or HotDog Heaven Sign

name: MOSAIC
description: Camp MOSAIC. A colorful home where bright patterns have been produced by arranging together insightful souls constructed with the 10 principles that truly create a MOSAIC of life. A place to experience growth, friendship, love, and good vibes only.
landmark: 7 foot tall BE HERE NOW & MOSAIC signs

name: Camp Fuck If I Know
description: Camp Fuck If I Know offers advice and information.  Come chill in our lounge area, have a chat and sip on a refreshing beverage.  All are welcome.
landmark: our camp sign 'Camp Fuck If I Know'

name: Camp Ridiculicious
landmark: 1V Dome & Flat top Shade (Long table + Chairs)

name: Lost Art
description: Lost Art is a camp devoted to bringing forgotten arts to the playa. In this age of zoom calls, twitters, and tik toks, we bring the forgotten art of IRL conversation and connection shared over a dusty meal.
landmark: Large map of neighborhood and food menu at corner.

name: Salute Your Jorts
description: Salute Your Jorts is your local BRC summer camp. In the distance you'll see jorts flags flying in the wind, and as you approach you'll be met with decorative light up signs that let you know you've arrived. Come on down to get some fly jorts, sip some late night tea with strangers, and boogie down to some fly beats you won't find anywhere else on playa.
landmark: Look for the jorts flags and our light up sign

name: Duckbutt
description: Sunrise or Sunset, we're your place for a respite. We aim to inspire your higher self with an hour long lecture borne of wisdom by those who delve into the heart, soul, and intellect of humanity. Sit, listen, relax, then discuss what we've heard and take that gift with you out to the playa.
landmark: CAMP KNOW PLACE? BANNER

name: Sunset Portal
description: Celebrating the setting of the sun, we gather together each evening, old friends and new, to thank the day for all that it has provided and prepare ourselves for the night yet to come. Join us for Friendship Weddings at Sunset Tuesday and Friday.
landmark: Giant glowing SUNSET sign

name: Bitchin' Braid Camp
description: Come for the braids, stay for the bar parties.    Please grab a partner or find one in the braiding lounge to make a plan for a style that will last the week.  Braiders on hand with all the supplies and skills to get you taken care of,  including mirrors to check out your sweet self on the way out.  No hair?   NO PROBLEM.   From 10am to sunset we have have hosted bar parties, new faces, new specialty drinks, new outfits and new music every two hours.  Want to be apart of our camp's 10 year tradition, head over right before sunset to grab a bevy and enjoy a special treat as the sun starts kissing those mountains.  Miss you already, so swing by.
landmark: RED K LIGHTED SIGN

name: Fuck You, I Love You
description: Where minimalist psychedelic circus meets sacred play and sensorial freedom. We are bringing a connected, loving, sacred space, to offer a compassionate container to physically and metaphorically hold a space for you to live fully embodied through safety, play, ceremony, immersive invitations, and magic.
landmark: The Living Room sign!

name: Sweaty's Last Resort
landmark: 3 story scaffolding, row of colorful flags

name: Wah-Nah-Shotskee
description: Welcome to a loosely wound summer camp extraordinaire! Wet your whistle with a game of truth or dare to participate in a game of skill. Lounge through the afternoon activities, or turn up with a fire performance and a shot-skee!
landmark: Lit Wah-nah-shotskee sign next to a 16' dome.

name: Camp Walter
description: There are always friendly and amazing people to meet, art to inspire, and other surprises.  Show Up, Be Nice, and of course Clean Up your Shit before you leave.
landmark: Tower of Terror

name: Bao Village
description:
Come see the Bao Village, visit Camp BaoChickaWowWow to taste our buns!

Fill your belly with our fresh and delicious steamed-to-order pork, red-bean, and custard bao (dim sum buns).

If a full belly demands it, find rest in the comfort and shade of the solar infrastructure powered by Camp of the Rising Buns.

Join us for BrunchBao, SunsetBao or the food themed Far East Night Market!
landmark: Bao Chicka Wow Wow Sign/ Titanic's End art car

name: Benevolent Elephant
description: We formed to create meaningful connections and nourish communities thru the fusion of Music, Performance, and Culinary Arts.
landmark: the large silhouette of an elephant head.

name: Stag Camp
description: At Stag Camp, we invite anyone and everyone (drama free) including singles, couples and small groups from all walks of life. We have no strict regiment of things to do or fees to pay. We all just come and hang out, creating a community among ourselves that is unique, fun and will be whatever you make of it!
landmark: 1950's Red Classic Fire Engine

name: DISTRIKT - Bike Battalion
description: Designated bike parking area across the street from DISTRIKT.
landmark: bike parking across the street from DISTRIKT.

name: Tierra Bomba
description:
We bring Colombian passion, Latin American spice, & good times from the Global South all the way to the playa!
Itching for that Colombian coffee that'll cheat your sleep? Mouth watering for that Mexican mezcal that'll make you move? Body is sweating for a set packed with sultry salsa, bachata, & cumbia?
Come get a taste of the Tierra Bomba vibe– tropical total!
landmark: Military tent with net shading and tropical decor

name: Frizz
description: Camp Frizz, a chill cafe & bar to come retire at!
landmark: Camp Frizz Flag, White School Bus

name: Friendly Village
description: If you're looking for Friendly Village, you're really looking for Shotski Wanderlust, Academy of Arts and Sciences (and the Bad Idea Bar), and Size Doesn't Matter! Find us under those camp names! We have it all! Science! Art! Skiing! Snowboarding! Apres Ski! Bad Drinks! Running Naked Around the Entire Perimeter Fence! Exclamation points!
landmark: Ski lift chair, Academy of Arts and Sciences sign

name: Pathogen Trackers
description: Pathogen Trackers camp is excited to return to the playa and provide the gifts of food and drink to those in need.
landmark: 60' Watch Tower, surrounded by Big Black Trucks

name: Nightchaser's Dusty Disco
description: A mystical, immersive and magically psychedelic dance party and gathering space for EVERYONE. Hosting nightly dance parties and a daytime BBQ with assorted and carefully curated house music, funk and disco.
landmark: Giant Chasers of the Night Sign with Disco Balls

name: Bao Chicka Wow Wow
description:
Come visit Camp BaoChickaWowWow to taste our buns!

Fill your belly with our fresh and delicious steamed-to-order pork, red-bean, and custard bao (dim sum buns).

Join us for BrunchBao, SunsetBao or the food themed Far East Night Market!
landmark: The Large Bao Chicka Wow Wow Sign

name: Lost Boys Candy Cove
description: A camp full of super cute misfits called the Lost Boys who contribute our own colorful thread to the tapestry of Black Rock City. We offer a relaxing cove of respite to all, as well as some yummy treats from our treasure troves of candy.
landmark: Big "Candy Cove" sign above the swanky lounge.

name: Mycodelic Forest
description: We are a mycologically based theme camp located in the 3 O clock sector. We love mushrooms and all fungus related things! Like the mycelium that connects the roots of the forest, the Mycodelic Forest serves to connect the humans that pass through it. Come sit in our shade and have a cold home brew beer while listening to a wide variety of music. You may learn something!
landmark: Psychedelic Archway that says Mycodelic Forest

name: Jungle Oddity
description: From the dust emerges a jungle oasis lost in time and space. Come visit our sonic lounge and dancefloor to boogie down like wild jungle animals! Stop by and get a massage or sound healing treatment throughout the week.
landmark: Geometric climbing tower with 5 flag poles

name: Get Toasted
description: Cinnamon toast and cinnamon whisky...
landmark: pavillion and toast cart

name: Vulcan Empire
description: Creating a network of motivated movement artists working to teach, spread, and promote fire, flow, or circus arts around the world. Working together to create Vulcan Empire in Black Rock City builds our network and allows us a space to reach each other from our many diverse paths in life. We hope our diaspora inspire and influence each other and continue to support each other long after the dust settles.
landmark: "Vulcan Empire" sign

name: Iceberg Cowboys
description: We wrangle icebergs and ride 'em off into the desert
landmark: Blue LED Icicles and Polar Bear Truck

name: Swing City
description: Swing City is a camp that provides a playground for all to come and enjoy. We have 6 traveling rings, space for partner acro-yoga and other acro activities as well as silks and cyr wheel play. We encourage all who are interested to join us in whatever capacity they are able and comfortable with.
landmark: 60' x 40' x 18' scaffolding structure

name: Secret Garden
description: A chill space with the feel of a Zen Garden where you can have a drink at the ground level bar while visiting with friends, new and old. A DJ set-up will be playing music that's fun, but not too loud to have a conversation over- want to spin the Ones and Twos, go right ahead. And, when you aren't socializing or getting your groove on, you can stop in for a drag contest,  games night, or a workshop/ seminar.
landmark: Raked playa dust and rocks that form a Zen Garden

name: The Rogue Scarab
description: We present again, our unique glowing winged Rogue Scarab beetle, featuring a fully Playa-accessible trampoline for the citizens of Black Rock city to rest, travel and participate in it's truly inviting form.
landmark: Rogue Scarab Mutant Vehicle

name: Armageddon Bike Camp
description: Armageddon Bike Camp - it's not the end of the world, it's the safe word! Think Armageddon for all your bike needs. We offer professional bike repair daily. We've been providing bike-love to the 3:00 sector for over 10 years!  We also host a couple of great parties: a Tuesday night-time party and a Thursday afternoon Alley Cat bike race/scavenger hunt, Funny Bike Demo and Disco dance party, at our awesome Prism dance floor. Get a ride, or take a slide on our art car, the Classic Slide, and enjoy classic rock (and renditions) in camp or on the playa. Our 28ft dome 'living room' and outdoor shade structure provide options for the perfect hang-out space, no matter the weather open to visitors 24x7. Drop in any time!
landmark: 28ft dome with blue parachute & lighted camp sign

name: Altitude Lounge
description: Come lounge on our tower overlooking the playa and see what you helped create, listen to our down-tempo beats at sunset, and jump in our art car as we cruise in style
landmark: 30-Foot lit scaffolding tower with spotlights

name: Trailer Trash
description:
Morning Coffee Shack. 
Did someone say coffee?! Yes, we are serving up your morning cuppa (coffee, tea, hot chocolate) along with conversation and camaraderie. 
Come join us. We hope to see your beautiful faces!
landmark: larger-than-lifesized "Bender" at the coffee shack

name: Preservation Society
description: Preservation Society: Come find what has been lost. Our events refresh you with movement and dance, challenge your frame of mind, and satiate your hunger.
landmark: Preservation Society sign, snail car, big flowers

name: Deux Ex Detective Agency
description: Need some assistance, sweetheart? Been tipped off to some suspicious activity? Stop by the Deus Ex Detective Agency to crack a case or bask in the gritty noir ambience. We've been serving Black Rock City hard-boiled truth since 1937.
landmark: detective's office straight out of the 1940s.

name: Fancy Flamingo Society (FFS)
landmark: Purple & pink flamingo flag flown from our tower

name: Kosmic Kamels
description: Kosmic Kamels is a collection of modern nomads from all over the Middle East and the galaxy who want to give BRC the gift of our common heritage - warm tea and coffee, a good smoke, a place in the shade, soothing Arabian string music and open conversation.
landmark: Huge Kosmic Kamels Sign

name: Kamp Suckie Fuckaye
description: Kamp Suckie Fuckaye is home to Burning Man's longest running fire conclave, Garnish. Our infamous Kamp Suckie Fuckaye Saloon invites all citizens of Black Rock to come have a drink and talk some shit. Made up of a variety of artists, performers, and career entertainers KSF is collective of the creative! Join us for our workshops, performances, and all around good times. Come, join our family. SUCKIEEE FUCKAYEEEEE! (Not a sex camp.)
landmark: Suck N Fuck Saloon

name: Amazeballz
description: Get Lost! In our super neat logic maze. Spend your time walking around in circles trying to solve a puzzle instead of any of that other stuff.
landmark: Big pink, green and yellow "Amazeballz" sign.

name: Booty Kitchen
description: Booty Kitchen is a community of  friendship-homies geared towards being homie-friends in a food-centric type of "FEED ME NOW" way that transcends bounds unless the bounds end up being barriers in which case it doesn't matter anyways.
landmark: Large dome with a white vinyl cover on the curb

name: Airpusher Collective
description: Airpusher Collective:  We celebrate love, art and music. This collective of visionaries believes in the power of community and creativity, of collaboration and inclusion, of fun and silliness.
landmark: Giant Airpusher logo sign

name: Lazy Skool Daze
description: Lazy Skool Daze brings back your school days-- with an adult twist! Come join us for Drunk 90s Singalong, Recess, face painting, guidance counseling, Burner 101, field trips, and sunset cuddles and drinks! Look for the giant alphabet blocks and trampoline.
landmark: 4' alphabet blocks and 14' trampoline

name: A Transformation Station Camp
hometown: New York, San Francisco, London, Los Angeles
description: A Transformation Sub-Station ... a global camp of ideators and mindful innovators that share a common purpose to be of service for all of humanity ... all while practicing the importance of connection, play, mindfulness, and love.
landmark: Large animal structures on the curb

name: Endstation
description: Destination unknown? Camp Endstation is a harbour to the wanderers without direction, to the nomads without path. Our small camp was founded on the idea of providing anybody who stumbles around in BRC with a tiny but memorable experience.
landmark: the black flag with train track logo (20 ft high)

name: Handlovers Lounge
description: A soft landing space for hands, lovers, lovers of hands, and everything in between!
landmark: 20x20 pyramid w/ 40 foot tall flagpole

name: Relaxomatic
description: Our Strip Mall will lure you in; our Saloon and Lounge will keep you hydrated and comfortable. Visit one of our many stores out front–the fortune teller, the boutique, or the adult fantasy store–and then make your way back to The Relaxomatic Lounge, perfect for those looking to decompress and unwind in a comfortable setting. Just outside the main lounge, find Osmos, Glome, and Pandora's Dome. Once you find your way inside, lights, colors, and fluff will lure you into peak relaxation. Need a refreshment?
landmark: gient, white, inflateable cooling tower

name: New Desert Outpost
description: The New Desert Outpost is an explorer's lounge with an antique vibe. We are dedicated to helping all burners find and share new adventures and novel new experiences. Join us for afternoon tea and bespoke cocktails, tarot, storytelling and safari-inspired games.
landmark: wooden sign which says "New Desert Outpost"

name: Dusty Dreamers
description: Welcome to the Dusty Frogz camp! We've built a French guinguette in traditional Parisian style where we provide daily entertainment and typical French beverages. Think about Champagne, Cognac and our famous Ricard. On top of this, we have two petanque courts available 24/7 and a great selection of music played by our DJs. You can easily find us on the playa, just look out for the 25 feet Eiffel Tower and get inside its legs to experience a 360° cooling mist.
landmark: Lookout for the 25ft Eiffel Tower

name: Plug n Play
description: Are you an aspiring DJ without a camp to play out at? Well here's your chance! We offer open DJ sessions (weather permitting) to anyone at any skill level, regardless of music genre. Simply bring your own Rekordbox playlist on a USB stick and your own headphones and we provide everything else, including club-standard Pioneer DJ equipment and PA system.
landmark: Blue parachute and Tensegrity structure

name: Floasis
description: Our mission is to spread joy and help people find their flow. To us, this means helping people uncover and embrace their true selves, and from that place of self-love, experience joy and harmony with their community and be in service to the world around them.
landmark: Look for the big Floasis sign

name: Brokedown Palace
description: Brokedown Palace is a Grateful Dead theme camp specializing in hospitality.  Our full bar is always open.  Our dance floor is always open.  Come in and enjoy Dead tunes and assorted rock and roll, both live and recorded.  We are a chill hang by day and a psychedelic roadhouse by night.  Massive doses of skulls and roses.
landmark: Life Size Dancing Bears and Steal Your Face

name: Kaleidoscope Collective
landmark: Look for large colorful kaleidoscopic flags

name: Heroes & Super Villains
description:
The Brighter the Light, 
The Deeper the Shadow…
Heroes & Super Villains (HSV) invites members of the Burning Man community on an interactive, multi-sensory journey of personal discovery. HSV invites YOU to explore the inner workings of experiences that have shaped your life, your views and your perspectives. We utilize the framework of the Hero's Journey created by Joseph Campbell in his study of myth, culture and society. Come by for a taste of our SOULFUL hospitality.
landmark: flags, trampolines, dancers & the Skullicious Bar!

name: DusTEA Pickles
description:
A painterly pop of of color contained a giant terrarium packed with colossal Colorado-inspired wildflowers. Within the flush foliage burners, and their special someones, can find refuge from the bump-bumping beat of Black Rock City. 

Stop by to get hot or cold tea, re-hydrate with some electrolytes, enjoy a cheesy date night, be serenaded, or just sit down and enjoy a nice show or learn something new.
landmark: Collossal folliage and our LED chandelier.

name: Mission Country Club
description: We bring a taste of San Francisco's Mission District to Black Rock City! Mission Country Club is an organically-grown camp, consisting of folks from all over - San Francisco, Reno, Los Angeles, Washington DC, Boston, New York, Seattle, Portland, Ireland, Germany, Belgium and beyond. We've been kicking it on playa since 2004 and over the years we've been home to Flannagan's Pub, Flannagan's Tacos + Whiskey, the Magic Kurry Cart, the Sangria Soundclash, the BRC Hip-Hop Playa Ball, the Brian Brunch and Bugaboo the art car. Don't forget to check the book for our 2022 shenanigans! We can't wait to be home with all of you!
landmark: big orange MCC banner on our shade structure!

name: ASAP
description: ASAP is a San Diego based Arts Collective. Our camp also hosts the mutant vehicle, The Punkin Project.
landmark: Wooden bar with a metal ASAP sign lit with LEDs

name: Beaverton
description: Camp Beaverton is an intentional, experimental, and experiential Burning Man community theme camp. We are a group of queer women/trans/genderqueer/lesbian/bisexual/heterosexual/etc... or folks who are simply as wayward as the playa is dusty. We celebrate sexuality, self exploration, and respect for one's journey on through this life. Our goal is to provide a safe space for queer women and trans folks on and off-Playa. We encourage education, participation, inquiry, conversation, and self-reflection. We extend our goals to the greater Black Rock community by hosting workshops and social events.
landmark: Rainbow Camp Beaverton sign & large beaver symbol

name: Camp Tsunami
description: Camp Tsunami welcomes you to stop by our camp for a Playa Fashion Makeover and a Sno Cone each afternoon! Then come back in the evening for games, fire spinning, and the Bike Ramp of Death. Oh - you're a morning person? Come learn Knife Throwing a few mornings during the week, too!
landmark: Flaming sign that says "Camp Tsunami"

name: Ultimate Celebration
description: Our garden of shaded, LED-illuminated bungee couches is open for bouncing/relaxing all week long, day and night, but things really get going around 8pm/dark (Mon-Fri), when we celebrate the Waking Dreams theme by projecting immersive supercuts of dream sequences on our theater-sized projection screen, and serve our signature beverage Ultimate Celebration (one bottle of cheap champagne plus five hours of optional "energy"/caffeine) from our bar. Every champagne bottle will be opened by a guest, using a sabering sword. Join us at dusk, and stay for the show!
landmark: LED-lit bungee couches

name: The Mansion
description: The Mansion camp might remind you of the classic silly and sexy parties of the Playboy Mansion but with our "Mansion Manners".  The frontage resembles a southern mansion with 600 square feet of shade under a 12 foot ceiling with TVs, couches, a disco ball, and magical led/lighting and sound. A limited bar will be providing select libations and non-alcoholic choices to legal guest. We host events of all types eg; crafts, clinics, karaoke, dancing and for our fellow burners who will be able to lounge, dance, sing, and create. Because it is our mission to never stop the party,  an array of unplanned events is sure to pop up. See you in the dust!
landmark: Giant monkeyhut covered in aluminet

name: Emergence
description: Look for the Emergence owl! Come by our camp camera-ready to get your custom play ID made or listen to one of many people who love to talk about geeky things. While you hang we'll give you a popsicle (21+ gets adult version) and let you lay all up on our pillows or roll in our grass.
landmark: Big owl sign

name: Declusterfuqerization Gone Loco
description: Declusterfuqerization is your place to get sendy, gnarly, and tickled up, over, and on top of our climbing wall and bar. We have Not Piss and plastic grips; climb up and get down.
landmark: the climbing wall tower with a smiley face flag.

name: Camp Hotdog
description: We bring the hotdog, we are the hotdog. We relish every opportunity to ketchup with old friends or meat new ones. This year we will be serving up coffee, pancakes and (of course) hotdogs at the new Dusty Dog Diner (The Triple D). Come by for a hot wiener, a cold drink and some cool tunes. What condiment are you?
landmark: 20 foot high pole with light up hotdog on top.

name: Wheel of Bugs and Splendor
description: The wheel of bugs and splendor provides guests the opportunity to face their fears by spinning a wheel and delight in some dried tasty treats.
landmark: Wheel of Bugs

name: iBurn app/ Shrunken Heads
description: iBurn app  has a map of Black Rock City featuring listed Art projects, Themecamps and Events with a filter ability to sort on types of events. It also has a favorites functionality where you can add your friends or favorite camps and Art. Full descriptions with other data like emails. locations, Home towns, etc are also available.
landmark: Scottish Lion Flag

name: Mos Eisley Village
description: Mos Eisley. You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy. We must be cautious.
landmark: Flagging+large banners (8x10') clearly state name

name: Burnstream Court
description: Burnstream Court is our recreation of a 1950s trailer park full of roundy silver trailers. Passersby are welcomed many hours each day with invitations such as Putting for Pabst, or enjoying a grilled cheese sandwich.
landmark: grouping of Airstream trailers, lighthouse beacon

name: Parea
landmark: Trash Fence TV Stage

name: Dusty Justice
landmark: Sizable DUSTY JUSTICE sign and banner

name: Après Ski Injury
description:
Trippy and spacey, laser eyed and shiny objects, landscape, aliens and faces are beating in all different frequencies of the current music being played, projected onto you. Real-time rendering and FFT make it possible. Buckle up for a deep dive into the vast reaches of music!
Join us at our cocktail bar, with VJ Delta T & Eck
landmark: Green school bus

name: Street Justice
description: Our Strip Mall will lure you in; our Saloon and Lounge will keep you hydrated and comfortable. Visit one of our many stores out front–the fortune teller, the boutique, or the adult fantasy store–and then make your way back to The Relaxomatic Lounge, perfect for those looking to decompress and unwind in a comfortable setting. Just outside the main lounge, find Osmos, Glome, and Pandora's Dome. Once you find your way inside, lights, colors, and fluff will lure you into peak relaxation. Need a refreshment? The Champagne & Propane Saloon serves coffee in the morning and cocktails...well...all the time, set to the smooth sounds of 70's easy listening and–of course–fire poofers.
landmark: giant water-cooling-tower-shaped white inflatable

name: Zendo Project 3:00
description: The Zendo Project provides a safe space and peer-to-peer support for individuals who are having challenging experiences, drug-related or otherwise. Our services are open around the clock during Burning Man at the 3:00 and 9:00 portals.
landmark: Zendo Project flags next to medical and rangers

name: Zen as Fuck
description: Relax in the Zen Dome or turn your life upside down on the Wheel of Dharma, the choice is yours.....
landmark: The 20 foot Wheel of Dharma in the forest of LEDs

name: Corner Pocket
description: Billiards at Burning Man! Corner Pocket Camp is your Black Rock City Pool Hall. New for 2022: FULL SIZE TABLES! Come enjoy learning and playing up to five pool games: 8-ball, 9-ball, Cutthroat, 3-ball, and Goonball. We'll have tournaments with awesome prizes and FUNishments, as well as special events such as "Strip Pool" and "Heckle Pool". Also, DARTS!
landmark: Flowy green and white spandex activity tent

name: Clevian Circularity
description: Clevian Circularity is based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, but has members from around the world. We are open 24/7 with direct, small-scale interactivity.
landmark: 11 foot diameter glowing sequencing snowflake

name: Muffin Bottoms
description: We are a group of artists, musicians, and all-around goofballs who love bringing silly, whimsical energy to the playa. Come by for live music and games in the afternoon, or find us in deep playa with giant 15-foot puppets.
landmark: A lighted, paper-mache Muffin on a 20' pole

name: Nocino's
description: Nocino's is the Tokyo Sector's Local Pizza Tavern in the 9 O'Clock neighborhood. That cozy social place where people come to hang after a long day of [redacted] and [censored] to connect with beer, pizza, and good music.
landmark: Pink and yellow flags on top of a 16' parachute

name: Drawn Inn
description: THairapy is your one stop shop for fabulousness. Get your hair did, you cup filled, and your swerve on. Look for scheduled events in the book or just swing by and say hello.
landmark: two tents with pink and blue flowing fabric

name: Galactic Labyrinth
description: The journey towards the heart is always a journey home.
landmark: Brightly colored labyrinth laid with flagging tape

name: Brand-Ur-Ass N More
description:
Brand-ur-Ass N More will stimulate your entire being, from your mind to your ass. Bare your butt at the hitchin' post and
get a temporary brand. Bathe in sound in the Sonic Spaceship, do some cock ropin', enjoy tunes, belly up to the saloon,
enjoy the giving tree, and hitch a ride on our vehicles. Y'all come N play!
landmark: Wooden corral posts

name: Deep Playa Surprise
description: Deep Playa Surprise brings the magic of the Deep Playa to the citizens of Black Rock City by offering daily gifts of culinary and artistic delight. Home to the art installation Docenting Adults, offered to those who wish to take a transformational and artistic journey into Deep Playa.
landmark: Deep Playa Surprise freeway off-ramp style sign.

name: Found It
description: A place for seekers of truth, love, community, sick beats, dirty bass, and self-expression to breathe that sweet sigh of relief- "I've Found It!"  We are DJs that care about the musical journey and the vibe we put out there into the world.  Come for a musical journey, sound baths, one of our self-love and empowerment workshops, beautiful art, or just stop by for a drink and some hugs in our LED Cloud Forest dome.
landmark: 28' Geodesic dome with the LED cloud forest inside

name: Champagne Campaign
description:
For the past 12 years, a champagne-loving group of friends have been traveling to Burning Man, spreading the love of burning man upon return, and growing larger with each burn. In 2016, Champagne Campaign was first officially placed as a registered theme camp. The universal activity enjoyed by this group of friends is meeting in front of the temple every sunrise for a champagne toast to the new day. 

Come stop by our Champagne bar daily at the Burn!
landmark: Large champagne bottles outside camp at frontage

name: You're Doing Great
landmark: Labryinth with the birdbath in the center

name: Hammered and Sickled
description: An international camp compromised of members from 30 plus countries of origins. We run a flavored Vodka bar as well as other libations and our mantra is "No one leaves our bar thirsty or walking in a straight line". We offer the weary desert travelers an oasis where they can take a break, relax and kick their shoes off.  Our campers come from different corners of the world, backgrounds and offer a variety of insights and opinions to liven up any conversation. We have our in house DJ's spinning lounge and mashups through out the day.
landmark: 30+ Country flags above our lounge structure

name: Playa Info/VRT
description: Playa Info is located in Center Camp and is a central location for on-playa information. We have people to answer mundane and esoteric questions, bulletin boards filled with information, and computers with access to our Digital Directory that contains camp locations, events, messaging, ride-share, and Lost & Found items. Also Lock out and towing services info.
landmark: look for the large blue eye in the sky

name: Raised by Wolves
description:
A real wolf pack is primarily composed of brothers and sisters. We're not related—or wolves—but we do yell at the moon a lot. Raised by Wolves is a community of artists and doers who gather together in the desert to create epic fun, howl at the moon together, and invite everyone in to share our space and run with the wolves.

We serve iced cold brew coffee EVERY morning, have the playa's most banging hip-hop/reggae dance party—complete with Dark 'n Stormys—and lots of opportunities to move your body in our dome.

You're welcome for being your favorite memory on playa.
landmark: Pyramid-shaped dome topped w wolf head LED beacon

name: HORIZON
description: HORIZON is a camp of community, celebration, curiosity and creativity. Enjoy the stunning views from atop our 16' viewing decks, lounge under our stretch tents, and get weird at our corner Carnival Bar. Show us your moves at our variety of dance parties, recenter during a yoga or meditation session, or help solve the mystery of our latest camp murder.
landmark: Large "Horizon" sign + many stretch tents

name: Silicon Village
description: Silicon Village is home to 9 Theme Camps. Theme Camps offer interactive fun, including workshops, classes, Mother Prism's Mad House of Horrors, M.U.S.E.'s Santa Meet and Greet,  Saints & Sinners button-making, Bad Idea Temp Tattoos, and Jam Sessions, Joyism Morning Coffee Service, and Climbing Wall, Bad Boy Discover Your Kinks interview, Dungeon Tours, Suspension Bondage Rides, and Cool Mist Experience. Mindwerk: Make a sound with your Brain, Dometop Platform View. Mindwerk & NoDrama Bars serve cold beverages to quench your thirst. We're particularly proud of Wheel on Meals, a service team that provides much-appreciated food to Art Project workers Playa-wide! Come visit! You trick, we treat!
landmark: Two pylon-style steel-tube pyramidal towers.

name: Duck Pond
description: The Duck Pond is the best dive bar on the Playa. Since 2006! Bring your ID and your cup to enjoy an ice cold drink. Dance to the sounds of our Duck Pond DJs and special guests. Ride the Bucking Duck or enjoy the view from our lifeguard tower.
landmark: 40 foot tower with lighted rubber ducky on top

name: Desperados
description: A hitching post for forlorn outlaws and seductive renegades. Begun in 2011 with a dollar and a dream and a bunch of stuff we found at the dump, Desperados has blossomed / decayed into an opulent shantytown, a depraved palace full of freaky desert creatures. Come by, take a load off, have a drink, duel someone, exchange bodily fluids! Lie to yourself about who you are as a person, and make those lies come true!
landmark: Western saloon , swinging doors, Desperados sign

name: Zendo Pod
description: The Zendo Project provides a safe space and peer-to-peer support for individuals who are having challenging experiences, drug-related or otherwise. Our services are open around the clock during Burning Man at the 3:00 and 9:00 portals.
landmark: Zendo Project flags next to medical and rangers

name: Legends of the Hidden Playa
description: We run an obstacle course/escape room that is loosely based off an old 90's game show and its recent reboot. With 11 separate rooms, each with their own puzzle, we will truly test your Burning Man preparedness! We have daily timed trials to earn a spot on our leader board and see if you can solve the Shrine of the Silver Monkey-Man!
landmark: Tall scaffolding structure & arched camp name sign

name: Land of Monkey
description:
We call ourselves monkeys not only to identify members of the camp, but to highlight that we are not yet fully human. Humanity is a process of becoming, one that we all practice throughout our lives. Learning to listen, to be patient, to understand, to forgive and to be more merciful: these are among the skills we practice in becoming more human. 

In 2022, we will be inviting others to join us in this practice through a series of interactive experiences that explore ourselves, our connection to each other, and how the 10 Principles help guide that discovery. By sharing these experiences with the Black Rock Community, we hope it will help all of the monkeys of this city to fulfill their ontological vocation of becoming more fully human.
landmark: Large monkey sign

name: HOVerlandia
description: A place for riders of the Burner Express Bus to land and call home. Located directly across the street from the BxB Depot, we are a camp for anyone that rides the bus and needs a home.
landmark: buses!

name: Dusty Mule Saloon and Playground
description: We have a large colorful dome with a welcoming bar and refreshment offerings every morning and through out daylight hours with a daily music theme. We serve boozy beverages and a few iced non-alcoholic ones. Interior games include Yard Yahtzee, Pin the Man on the Ass, Truth or Jenga. We have an -ation dome to serve any and all -ations. Examples might include hesitation, disintoxicaton, meditation, transformation, rejuvenation or claymation. Our playground boasts a wide variety of interactive games to entertain the masses and bring forth maximum laughter. We have large scale Connect 4, Rubber Ring Toss Your Cookies, Shut Your Cornhole, LED Tetherball, Pinko Drinko, What Goes Up Must Come Down (hydraulic teeter totters) and other carnival games.  Laughter is the universal love language.
landmark: Colorful 30 ft dome, 10 ft dome and playground.

name: Rumpus
description:
There once was a camp they called Rumpus.
They would cheer even the severest of Grumpus.
The playground is fun, the people are neat, and the music rarely goes UNZ-UNZ.
landmark: blue and tan shade with purple flags.

name: TBD Camp
description: We have been, and always will be, Totally Legit Camp.
landmark: TLC Sign

name: Brain Freeze Camp
description:
Brain Freeze Camp is back again! Naturally we will be serving frozen Margaritas, hot coffee in the morning and plenty of entertainment. 
This year we are adding "Power For The People". We will have an area for charging all your electrical devices. This includes cameras & phones all the way up to electric bikes and Mutant Vehicles. It will be available 24/7 during the entire Event.
landmark: Tall flagpoles and blue strobes at night.

name: dust & stars
description:
this is dust & star's ninth year as a placed theme cult. 

that's right: we're a cult. for years, we've donned black robes and warned other burners the endless night was coming. in 2022, we'll return with an even more important message to black rock city:

WE TOLD YOU SO.

well… kind of. we got some stuff right. but while the endless night has been doomy, gloomy, and long (so long!), we're starting to think it might not actually be endless. in fact, the horizon is getting brighter — and from what we've glimpsed, there's a breathtaking new dawn on the other side. 
literally breathtaking, and shiny. 
blinding, even. 

we welcome all who dare.
landmark: 10ft stars atop our temple + culty flags

name: A Touchy Subject
description: Shady Waffle is a full-service breakfast restaurant in a brilliantly colored, unique, forty foot tall, elliptical dome. A machine that converts cranky hippies into happy hippies. Come eat, cool off, relax, and make a stranger even stranger.
landmark: Brightly colored, 40 foot tall elliptical dome.

name: Joie de Vivre
description:
Our name and our ethos are one in the same: Joie de Vivre!

An international group of Joiers (as we affectionately like to call ourselves), we join you from all over the world: France, Sweden, Belgium, Germany, Ukraine, Canada, Norway, Korea, the United Kingdom, Australia, the good ole' USA, and more!

This year, we invite you to join us for sustainability workshops each afternoon. At our camp, we'll be offering a plastic waste upcycling solution that will turn waste into clean plastic flakes that can be upcycled to create useful products for campers. The interactive workshops will showcase how useful products can be created from plastic waste and take the notion of "Leave No Trace" to the next level!

Joie!
landmark: The Glowing Joie de Vivre Arch

name: MindShark
description:
Stay out of MindShark. 
Do not Consume our Drinks.
Do Not Observe Our Fire or Lights.
Do Not Dance to Our Beats.
Stay Grounded, Dream at Night.
landmark: flaming archway with our logo and name on it!

name: Misters & Sisters
description: Misters & Sisters offers a custom-curated Blend-Your-Own Essential Oil body spray experience. Choose from a selection of 26 essential oil ingredients (all of which have holistic health benefits), and make your very own one-of-a-kind 2-ounce spray bottle.  Also, cool off under our overhead water misters, brand yourself with a temporary tattoo, put some ties and ribbons in your hair (or wherever), participate in camp games such as Corn Hole Toss and Twister, and enjoy our shade and refreshments.  We are an oasis to the wandering spirit.
landmark: Misters & Sisters camp sign

name: The Hookah Lounge
description: Come to the Hookah Lounge and enjoy our flavored tobaccos. Our Moroccan style lounge serves up shisha filtered through juice and water every night, sun down to midnight. The plush seating, soft carpeting, and great people make this the ultimate chill-out zone.
landmark: The sign that says "The Hookah Lounge"

name: Big Puffy Yellow
description: Big Puffy Yellow (BPY) is a family of wahoos on the quest for the eternal optimism of the color yellow! Born in the dust of Burning Man in 2001, here we are, still standing behind the yellow way of life we believe in. Our roots are deeply planted in the Ten Principles, love for house music, delicious lemonade, and good times. We strive to create an open, welcoming space where people can gather and share the magic of a burn. This year BPY presents LEMONADE, a spiritual, ritual elixir to balance chakras, made fresh for your journey. BPY is the perfect mixture of Southern charm, newly combined with Philadelphia grit, reflecting our sweet and salty nature. We invite you inside our world of boisterous color and shenanigans. Come loiter with us!
landmark: Yellow/pink bar & House Facade Yellow flags

name: Nectar Village
description: Nectar Village is about you. It is about what you need....to survive, refuel and revitalize. Mind, body and spirit are all served, and you'll find the Nectar you seek for any of them in the camps at our oasis.  Offerings continuously from 10am-6pm
landmark: Nectar Village arch, 1 lg. domes, 1 lg. pyramid

name: Camp Reno Nation
description: If you love great beer and weird ass people. We got you covered.
landmark: Reno Nation Arch

name: Iron Rose
description: A sweet rose-themed bar with iron strong people behind it. Our drinks are delicious and our conversation and burn barrels are sure to be a welcomed stop on your way around playa. Bar is open in the evenings and burn barrels on cool nights.
landmark: Burn barrels and benches out front, red canvas bar

name: Cafe Calm
description:
"Come find the tribe!" A desert oasis is our vibe. Looking to discover your vocation, prepare for a Playa exploration, examine that inner divine sensation, or find respite on a jungle space station?

Where jungle meets the seaside meets the desert, there's a land called cafe calm, where they play hippie house to surreal sunsets and warm gusts of sea air in a utopia of radical self expression. Come visit the Cafe Calm Dream Kiosk this year. 

Minimal yet enveloping, familiarly encompassing, join us at our jungley dream oasis for great beats, deep yoga, daily speeches, guided playa exploration, queer and diversity meetups and activities, movement and psychedelic breath, downbeat music, smoothies and evening to night European house parties, and maybe...some snacks.
landmark: Big Cafe Calm Dream Kiosk Sign

name: Martini Camp
description: Martini Camp is ready to serve you cold drinks and fun! Stop by daily from 3pm-6pm for our scheduled events, check out our activity board to join us for a fun event!!!
landmark: Giant martini glass in the sky or the big red bar.

name: Cheezy Oasis
description: A camp for burners. Come get some coffee, a drink or just to chill. If you find yourself wondering the streets and night find our camp, you are welcome to hangout and get some rest on the many blow-up mattresses, chairs or couches. Then when you wake up in the morning you can revive with a cup of Joe.
landmark: banner in the front and the beacon light at night

name: Back To Camp
description:
Back To Camp is a summer camp oasis in the hot dust of Black Rock City. Come on down for daily movement classes, themed cocktail parties, and our signature arts 'n crafts postcard program.

New this year: Queendomme of Dumplings food service on select evenings.

Send your virgins down for our Sunday night "Virgin Campfire" where we'll help point them the right way to an enjoyable week as a new Burner and Participant!
landmark: Pyramid shaped shade and playatech pine trees

name: Pink Mammoth
description: Pink Mammoth is a house music and creative arts collective based in San Francisco. We strive to create an environment of love and compassion, selflessness and support, connection and self expression, that encourages everyone we encounter to shine and thrive.
landmark: Big pink steel shade structure w/ flags & PM sign

name: I Miss My Dog Cafe
description:
Sit and stay at the I Miss My Dog Café! If you have a furry friend at home, you understand how much we miss them while we're out on playa – their unconditional love, the warm greeting when you walk through the door, the cuddle sessions on the couch. Get the therapeutic comforts of having your pup around even when you're on playa. 

Our on-duty DOG-tor (human therapy dog) will be available sunrise to sunset to listen to your stories intently, comfort you when you're down, and dexterously serve you coffee, tea, and food that the house is cooking up that day. As a food & flow camp, you'll also find yoga, meditations, flow jams, and workshops. Plus, we have playa-dog-ified twists on the cafe events you love (trivia night, open mics, etc.)! Lunch served daily from 11–1pm.
landmark: Big Tie-Dye Dog Installation

name: Houpla
description:
Houpla is Houston's largest burner theme camp and part of the Burning Man Houston regional burner community. 

We burn year-round with weekly gatherings called Thermal Thursdays, our own warehouse space for build projects and events, an annual regional burn called Heartburn, an ongoing mutant vehicle project, and a community truck effort each year to playa and back. 

We're always looking to meet new people, and we hope you'll join us online or in-person. Learn more about us by visiting: https://www.burningmanhouston.org/houpla
landmark: Large flat panel shade structure with a Texas flag

name: Parks and Wrecked!
description: Parks and Wrecked! Provides a colorful and creative 'park' experience to the citizens of black rock city. We curate a welcoming space to experience fun, wonder, playfulness, freedom, and silliness- values of the utmost importance at this park.
landmark: Large ball pit with a slide going into it

name: Camp Buttercup
description: The Official Burning Man Crab Free Zone! Adjusting attitudes since 2009
landmark: AEZ tower and sign

name: Boobs & Berries
description: BC's legendary daytime party camp Boobs and Berries is coming to Black Rock City for the first time! Drop by our famous Boobs Bar for a frosty cocktail, and shake a tail-feather to some bouncy afternoon House music!
landmark: bar covered in photos of boobies

name: Tazii
description: Lustre Village provides a bouquet of burner pleasures from daytime glittering in the Glitterbox, to immersive theatrical experiences at the Fever Dream Theater.  Join us for rest, ease, and libations in the Tazii tent chill lounge 24 hours a day.
landmark: Three spired Moroccan tent on the corner.

name: The Great UnGnome
description: A camp of gnomes, ready to host you at our roving garden party.
landmark: Large Geodesic Dome and Gnome-decorated art car

name: Grilled Cheese Incident
landmark: VERY LARGE Shade Cloth - Orange lights at night

name: Bubbles and Bass
description: Bubbles and Bass is a 100% volunteer run art and music collective that brings joy to burner events worldwide! Our goal is to provide a home conducive to connecting: spiritually, conversationally, energetically. Best known for our sunrise to midday dancing revelry: more Bubbles and Bass makes the playa a magical place!
landmark: Camo netting over our dance floor and white tents

name: KoKo LoKo
description: KoKo LoKo is your tropical oasis where you can get yourself one ice cold Thai Coconut. We're here to love and rejuvenate you.
landmark: KoKo LoKo sign spelled out in lights.

name: Brulee
description: For 2022, Brulee - your Esplanade Kinky Circus since 2013 - presents... Les Cirque des Rêves, The Circus of Dreams.  We feature near 24/7 interactivity and actively advocate Consent Culture, creating Brave New Safer Spaces for us to play.   Start your day with Sunrise Sinatra, roll into Champagne Bacon Brunch, then have a nice nap in S.I.E.S.T.A., only to awake for Tea and Consent, and in the evening we host circusy events and new this year, ConSensual Carnival!  Also this year, come visit our new experimental cArousal of Consent.
landmark: Giant 20' structure with circus tents inside.

name: Cirque de Licious
description: Every morning we serve up iced-cold cold-brewed coffee!  We have high quality, cold extracted bean juice so you can start your day right.  While you're here enjoy some shade and music!  Don't be surprised if a flow artist or other performer pops out and tries to entertain you.
landmark: Big wedding tent covered in aluminum shade netting

name: Kostume Kult
description: Come to Kostume Kult for daytime costume transformations and runway shows (M-F, Noon-5pm) with evening events and dance parties. Born in NYC and Baptized in BRC, we gift a truckload of costumes but you have to "wear it to own it"and dance down our runway with the encouragement of our DJs and Emcees -- out onto the Esplanade and into your new life. Also featuring a crafting tent, variety shows, random absurdities and a rich brew of playa magic including our annual Brooklyn Block Party on Wednesday evening.
landmark: New York City skyline, K-Train and kostume runway

name: TRIFECTA
description:
Our friendly camp is primarily Montrealers, and we offer our classic friendliness, humour and joie de vivre!

Widely considered the Amsterdam of North America, Montreal is a playful and bohemian city. Montreal has long also been a very open and queer friendly city. TRIFECTA represents Montreal's free and open spirit with playful, inclusive LGBTQ+- and poly-friendly interaction, performance and community.

Trifecta offers interactivity with seating, tables and friendly company in our shaded lounge. We'll be offering a food service featuring some local Quebec classic delicacies.
We'll also be offering creative activities which aim to be accessible as much as possible.
Our interactive activities are a fun mix of wholesome, friendly, quirky and ridiculous
landmark: Sign out front of Camp with our Name

name: MiM0SA SUNRiSE
description: Mimosa Sunrise - "Here comes the Sun".. Come enjoy the rise of the sun over the playa every morning 5am-10am with mimosa's, great tunes, awesome vibes with a cast of characters and costumes that will make your smiles bigs and your laughs loud. Come with good vibes and win a prize, take home a decorated champagne bottle or dare to take a champagne shower, either way you'll be coming back all week
landmark: Spiral bar with 3 umbrellas on frontage

name: DusTea
description: Our aim is to be a sanctuary on the playa. We wish to nourish passerby's, radiate love, and create a comfortable environment that would make anyone feel welcome. We are intimacy and connection amidst the chaos of the beautiful and exciting playa. Join us for a cup of warm/cold tea, daily yoga, or at the daily OcTeapus bar.
landmark: DUSTEA LED illuminated Sign, 7ft tall Tea Lamps

name: Melons Present
description: Where better to decommodify, then The Melon Mall! From juicy, cold melons to hammocks, sunglasses to smut – our fruit-based love has what you need!
landmark: 14-foot watermelon dome & bright "Melon Mall" sign

name: PhoCureBurn
description: Building communities one hot bowl of Pho at a time
landmark: The giant LED Teddie-head on top of the Teddiedome

name: Rum Amok
description: Running Amok? Find your tropical oasis on the playa and stop by to chill, relax and enjoy with us coffees in the mornings or well crafted rum cocktails in the evenings!
landmark: A colorful, large RumAmok Sign (well lit at night)

name: Chop Shop
description: Chop Shop is the Best Playa Repair garage in BRC!  We are ready to repair a wide variety of Playa transportation with parts, repairs and advice.
landmark: Green Shade Garage

name: Black Rock Socks
description: The home of magical tea, shock collar karaoke, darts in the dark and so much more. Come by for some tea, talent, music and a great pair of our signature camp made 2022 socks.
landmark: Half pirate ship half ocean RV

name: Pepperland
description: Pepperland is a great place to stop for a moment out of the sun to grab some shade, meet some really nice and mellow people and count your playa blessings!
landmark: Lighted Pepperland sign or the Pepperland flag

name: Way Way SuperGood (by Full Send)
landmark: 28ft Climbing wall and huge camel shade structure

name: Butt Disco
description: Butt Disco is a Brooklyn-based camp that has come to the playa to make you shake your booty to organic house beats. If you like dancing, djs, laughing, getting weird, and butts as much as we do, you'll want to come and join our party. Also offering other butt stuff throughout the week. We're an ass-tastic group of individuals with one thing in common: having a good time. Hope you'll join us!
landmark: Butt Disco mirror sign and mirror mannequins

name: Carrot Tribe
description: Carrot Tribe is a sound camp bringing only the best vibes via house, techno, positivity, and booze. And of course carrots.
landmark: Big glowing carrot tower

name: Camp of the Rising Buns
description:
We are here to celebrate the sun and its gifts of power and daily renewal! Come join us for "bunrise" yoga with steamed bun food service in the morning, and be sure to check out our "Fun & Buns" booth at the Bao Chicka Wow Wow Night Market!

Sun's out, Buns out!!!
landmark: large bun-shaped tent.

name: Baconeers
description: The Baconeers return for more BACON, BOOZE and BEATS!
landmark: 8' tower base with our Camp name in vertical letters. (BACONEERS)

name: I Taste Purple
description: Martini Village offering up cold refreshments, entertainment and laughs! Stop by daily from 3pm-6pm for our scheduled events, check out our activity board or just pop in to see what we have going on at the Tiki bar, play a game or get some advice. Participate in the fun and be prepared to be immersed in the 10 principles of the playa.
landmark: Giant martini glass in the sky or the big red bar.

name: Vault 21+
description: Welcome to Vault 21+!  We've resurfaced after many years of hiding away in our vault hidden under the desert!  We bring with a ranging array of music, booze and stories to share for our adventures as we reenter what remains of the society after the world ended many years ago.
landmark: Vault door with a blue LED lit 21 in the middle

name: Reno Housewives
description: Costuming BRC since 1998. Do you need bridesmaids for your playa wedding, or are looking for the perfect outfit for that party? ASK US -- From frumpy to fabulous, we have you covered.
landmark: Purple gypsy wagon on the street by our boutique.

name: Luxurious Vagrants
description: Lux Vag is where sandy bodies come to get fancy! Visit our temporary tattoo and bedazzling parlor Tuesday-Thursday afternoons.
landmark: Canopy with LED diamond, and LUXVAG sign

name: Wasabi Kisses
description: A safer space for queer, trans, and kinky burners and their allies.
landmark: green and orange flags, banner, and disco ball

name: Possible Muertos
description: We're a laid-back group, with a shaded bar area where you can come take some instant photos with us in the morning, and by afternoon enjoy our cocktail of the day and music stylings, anything from lounge to old school trance.  Each day we will metamorphosize to a different culture from around the world, theming the daily cocktail with a matching game from that culture.  And if you have a USB stick, feel free to drop by and impersonate your favorite DJs with head bobbing & knob spinning on our DJ equipment, or just rest and lounge in our double decker Dome and enjoy the sunset.
landmark: Skeleton with Sombrero + double decker dome

name: Dusty Pineapple
description:
The Dusty Pineapple is a tropical oasis with a bicycle drawn Tiki Bar that ventures out at sunset to the farthest corners of the deep playa to provide wandering burners the joy of discovering a tiny oasis of light, music, fun, & camaraderie where it's least expected.

Come join us in camp for tropical themed block parties, Apre-Ski BRC Ski Patrol events, workshops & talks, & our moop pick-up game- Pick It Up With Your Butt! 

The Dusty Pineapple does not disclose its location in the deep playa. Rather, we prefer to be that moment burners find by chance. Creating an intersection of serendipity, intimacy and great times that form the most enduring connections and memories.  The Dusty Pineapple serves tropical drinks with groovy jams.  We look forward to you stumbling upon us along your journey!
landmark: yellow flags

name: BRC HOA
description: The BRC HOA prides itself on offering a wide range of options for any prospective Black Rock City homeowner. Hydration! Dehydration! Art! Craft! Heckling (the good kind AND the bad kind) and so much more!
landmark: Raised geodesic dome that lights up at night.

name: WünderMint
description: WünderMint is a multicultural theme camp in its fourth year with members hailing from four different continents. Take a break from the playa to rest under the chandeliers or join us at our Wed champagne and lingerie sunset party! We will host events most afternoons in our theme-focused civic space. Come by, say hello and interact!
landmark: Look for the Chandelier lamp post at the front

name: I Need An Adult
description: We are the camp you stop at to grab a drink and a laugh to start your night, come back for a round and games later that night, and finish your night or after party at. We are full of relaxation during the day; then dancing and meeting new people at night. Everyone is always welcome just the way you are. RADIATOR!!!!
landmark: Multiple flags at the top of our structure

name: Camp Bang Bang
description:
Camp Bang Bang is an Aussie at heart camp with a global family.

Adventurers and well, dare we say it, a bunch of legends welcomes you to our playground to play, drink, dance and laugh with real people from amazing places, doing cool shit with no pretentiousness.  

We have awesome places to hang, chill or get wild. Guaranteed awesomeness and welcoming vibes when ever you need. 

Sunday: Cocktail Lounge of Silliness, treating thirsty travellers - 6:30 onwards

Monday: Bang Bang's Brunchcovery session 9am-midday

Tuesday: I, Legend Speaker series -1pm-3pm

Wednesday: Wild Animal Party  - 6:30pm-late

Thursday: Bang Bang's Brunchcovery session - 9am-midday

Friday: Bang Bang takeover of the Distrikt Bar - 1pm-5pm

Plus much more... see you there.
landmark: Elevated large Neon Bang Bang Cowgirl sign.

name: Chicken Cooter Soup
description: a burning man mega camp serving hot cheeses and luke warm sake since the beginning of time
landmark: mega bus and chicken cooter soup sign

name: Questionable Camp
description: Antevasin, a Sanskrit word referring to a border dweller, is a person who has left the bustling center of worldly life to go live at the edge of the forest where the spiritual masters reside.  No longer apart of traditional society, the Antevasin are somewhere between the conventional and transcendental.  They live in sight of both worlds, joining the cultures together through embracing the unknown and seeking truth.  Come join us!
landmark: Tall metal pyramid with shade structures

name: The Carrot Club
description:
Our camp is focused on health and happiness; health through fresh vegetables and fruits at the Black Rock Farmers Market in the mornings and happiness and festivities at the Carrot Club in the afternoons. 
     Enjoy tasty, fresh produce to feed the body, refresh the spirit, and nourish the soul! One of the best parts of exploring any city is checking out the farmer's market- and Black Rock City is no exception! Come try one of our wide array of fresh fruits and veggies! 
    In the afternoons, join us for fruit and vegetable based cocktails at the Carrot Club, or better yet, ride our bike operated blenders to prepare one of our signature alcohol infused smoothies
landmark: Giant Carrot

name: Whynauts
description: Embrace your child-like wonder and ask ¨why not¨and ¨what if¨. Come play around with us.
landmark: Whynauts Sign

name: FANDANGO
description:
Once upon a time, a group of friends decided to go to this Cacaphony Society-sponsored event out in Black Rock Desert. Over next few years they convinced many of their friends to join them out in the desert.  Much merriment was had, and in 1994 Fandango proper was born. Over the years our Village has grown to at times include the SLO-Orbitals, MoTown, Butterzone, Haiku-for-Beer, The Blight, Campoline, Temple of Fluff, Ministry of Special Permits, Town-Town, and manynother sub camps.
So now we are a big ole village with members spread all over. Nothing has changed, and everything has changed. These are our people. We are our people. Welcome to Fandango. Be sure to say hello when you stop by for a beer!
landmark: Large LED sign on the corner that says "FANDANGO"

name: La Grange
description: La Grange is a space open for every burner were we celebrate art, culture, music and spirituality.
landmark: big bulg sign of "LA GRANGE"

name: Giraffelot
description: Come set sail with Giraffic Cruiselines. Sample from our fine craft beers in the afternoon or keep warm by our roaring fire at night. Enjoy mimosas while watching sunrise or sunset from our large communal crow's nest high over the playa, or just stop by to say hi. Don't worry, we don't bite.
landmark: 2x 20 foot steel fire-breathing giraffes

name: Devachan Lounge
description: Resting place of the gods/goddesses, a comfortable lounge space with cushioned floor, lounge chairs, cushions, and cozy blankets. Come by to relax, join our fun workshops, or even spontaneously host your own!
landmark: Sign and pole with lights on shade structure

name: SIZE DOESN'T MATTER
description: We are a small but mighty crew from Reno. Come visit and shadow dance with us for a warm up. Then we'll rope you into running or biking a 1/2 marathon around the trash fence!  And if you need a mom's advice, we come with references.
landmark: Academy of Arts and Science and Shotski

name: Tetrix
description: Home to a bunch of Aussies welcoming you to the humble abode of the Stargazer Artcar. We will be serving up daily disco coffee and donuts from 9am-12pm, Coffee and Nachos from 12pm-4pm, so come party with us and then hop aboard the Stargazer Artcar for a journey out to deep playa from 8pm onwards
landmark: Double decker art car, Twin 53ft trailers

name: Ahimsa
description: Come enjoy an iced Morning Matcha latte (plant milk, of course). Hang, chit-chat, talk animal welfare, go as deep as you want to, and get your morning buzzzz on.
landmark: Gold and red curtains and signage.

name: Oontz Pouch
landmark: Circus Tent

name: Fermented Reality
description: Fermented Reality celebrates fermentation in all its forms - of foods, drinks, the mind, and the body! This year, we're hosting events to ferment the SELF, ONE ANOTHER and the COMMUNITY. In the mornings, join our healing and energizing sessions, including yoga, latin HIIT, or a mindful cacao ceremony. Swing by our happy hours for fermented food, drinks, funky house tunes and laughs. Participate in games we can guarantee you've never seen before: Can you prevail in our Dickle Fencing ring? Or give our pickle glory hole wall a try–you never know what you might get! Participate in the inaugural Kimchi Circus and don your gowns for an evening at the Preserved Prom. We hail from 10 countries and 6 US states and would love to meet you and share stories on the playa!
landmark: illuminated green pickle & multi-colored dome!

name: Sundowners
description: 'Sundowners' comes from a South African sunset friendship ritual. A safari-themed art car and joyous South African "shebeen" speakeasy are our experiential tentpoles. Our creative center is Afrofuturism, imagining a positive, inclusive future through speculative art and technology, representing the diverse background and skills of our community. We feel Burning Man, as the planet's largest temporary city, is a fitting ecosystem to explore and express this unique Afrodiasporic ethnographic theme.
landmark: Lion head logo, Sundowner Sign, African Speakeasy

name: Art Haus
description: Art Haus is a collective of musicians and dancers dedicated to creating classical and contemporary productions on playa and sharing their art with the citizens of Black Rock City. We are a mix of professional and recreational artists and their supporters from all over the world.
landmark: Silent Dancer logo (A quarter rest)

name: Scar Bar
description: Temporary Rewards for Permanent Damages. Show us your scars, we'll give you a drink! Stop by our bar for some iced green tea and whiskey and tell us your scar tales. We take scars big and small, external and internal, we will even give you a scar if you want (a fake one, we aren't monsters). While our Happy Hours are set, stop by our camp for some late night bar service, subject to playa time.
landmark: Vaulted EMT structure with blue shade cloth

name: Quick Dip
description: Quick Dip - come jump on in with us!
landmark: Illuminated Camp Quick Dip sign (white on black)

name: Bisous
description: Our aesthetic and interactivity seek to explore the human experience as we awaken, inviting each citizen of BRC to spend time inside what we call the Bizarre Bazaar. We will bring this vision into every aspect of our design including the built infrastructure, decor, lighting, culture, and programming.
landmark: Large glowing heart in the sky

name: Here
description:
A rambunctious gathering of ridiculous souls with lounging, entertainment, refreshments, music, and the most satisfactory grilling on playa.

Wherever you are you can always find yourself Here.
landmark: HERE Sign

name: Steam 16
description:
In Kurt Vonnegut's 'Cat's Cradle', written after the crisis there is a substance called Ice-nine: a form of ice that can turn all water it comes in contact with into ice, a metaphor of weapons of mass destruction and broader of existential dangers of technology misapplied.

So we come up artistically with a new substance called 'Steam-16', which is a touch of free spirit, a liberating experience, a message contained in itself - of the human and communal rebirth.  Steam-16 is what we can come in contact with, what we can catalyze within ourselves and propagate into expanding communal circles. It's precious, elusive, and only available once the danger is imminent - an antithesis to the Ice-9, of a sorts. As much as Ice-9 freezes - Steam-16 elevates, cleans and connects.
landmark: Moon like Artcar

name: !Knot! A Bondage Camp!
description: Campocalypse - We're an adult-themed camp with members hailing from up and down the West coast of the U.S.  Come by for instruction in sensory deprivation, meditation, and bondage safety techniques (including negotiation and consent).  We might treat you to an ice water flogging, let you play on our dungeon furniture, or invite you to climb one of our raised platforms for the view.  We're also offering suspension bondage rides and Tarot card readings.  Because at Campocalypse...your future hangs in the balance.
landmark: Two white view platforms with rotating benches.

name: The Wastelanders
description:
Feel the warmth of our fires, see our lights when the sky is dark or filled with dust, and share our vintage spirits. But be warned, some things that can outlast an apocalypse, have mighty sharp teeth!  
We are an oasis of fire and rust, surrounded by a sea of neon, thumping tones and desert chaos. Learn not to fear the end of civilization, step into our world and learn alittle about yourself. 
All those that enter our lounge are welcome to become completely immersed in our world. Full attention to detail is everywhere, from the rusted fire sculptures to the burning bar. The stage is lit with fire and torches, while dancers spin hoops and metal.  Performers share the stage with our unusual blend of house music ranging from death metal to the 40s jazz of the Atomic Age.
landmark: Island of Rust in a Sea of Neon

name: Dragon Heights
