description: Dragon themed shady canvas yurt with comfortable couches, cold nonalcoholic drinks, and a hookah lounge. We have puzzles, games, picture books, and of course, DRAGONS! Come do some dragon themed art with us, play weird instruments, or tell us about your cats. A quieter place among the chaos of Black Rock City.
landmark: Lit up Mongolian yurt and inflatable dragons

name: BeeYond:
description:
BeeYond: We have been buzzing the playa for more than 20 years now, and we are ready for more, indeed moving BeeYond Bees! We will still have our Bee-Swarm pub crawl on Friday, but no big party this year, in favor of smaller interactions.

We rely on serious energy, creativity, love, and silly shenanigans to keep our love flowing.

We seek to inspire, proselytize, and lead by spreading our love and care for our fair Black Rock City. This shows in our efforts to be a clean green camp, in the way we BUZZ people (imagine a buzzing vibrating swarm!) in the way we welcome all passersby into our NectarSector to escape the sun or onto our Mutant Vehicles the Red Hot Beverly and the Apis, and most of all how we love each other and all we meet!
landmark: 15 foot tall sign metal lit sign that says BeeYond

name: Connect MOAR!
description:
Camp Connect Moar
Fostering intimacy through human connection 
From Foot washing to late night snuggles and tea, Connect Moar is the place to meet a smiling face, a warm hug and experience the radical love that is the Burning man we all adore.
landmark: 12 foot tall lit Connect (4) Moar board

name: Church Of Now
description:
A sanctuary in the desert where all factions of faith come to play.
There is No Heaven
There is No Hell
There is only NOW
Daily bar and dance party welcome to the Deadliest of Sinners or the Purest of Saints
landmark: Large metal facade saying CHURCH OF NOW or CON

name: Whisker Biscuit
description: Feeling rambunctious and want to take a whirl on the tire swing? Or just thirsty and in need of shade and entertainment? We've got it all. Stop by Mon-Fri evenings for the happiest of happy hours to check out all the action the Whisker Biscuit has to offer. Can't make happy hour? No problem. Stop by anytime, there's sure to be someone awesome here. You might get snark…you might get a hot dog…the sky's the limit. But we'd love to see you all!
landmark: Tripod

name: Stardust Lounge
description: Stardust Lounge is an eclectic pit stop for dusty travelers on their inter-playatary journeys. The three sections of the camp--the Casino, Spa, and Wedding Chapel--offer visitors a fun blend of rituals, games, and opportunities for self-care.
landmark: infinity mirror box Stardust sign!

name: The DusTea Den
description: The DusTea Den Aurora Borealis Experience is a visual simulation of laying under the sky and watching the Aurora Borealis above you, accompanied by soothing ambient music.
landmark: large dome with red sails

name: It Was Better Last Year
description: It Was Better Last Year is our refuge from everything that's going to ruin Burning Man. Our camp bar, The Crusty Burner, is where we spend our afternoons drinking. We only share with the rest of you because we have to, so don't expect any fancy, hippy-dippy bullshit with your pint of warm piss.
landmark: Crusty Burner sign

name: Camp Axolotl
description: Camp Axolotl is nestled in La Calaca Village come say hi, friends!
landmark: Welcome Hut

name: Society for Temporal Preservation
description:
The Society for Temporal Preservation is a collection of time travelers dedicated to introducing Black Rock City to time travel and vice versa. Not to say we told you so, but we told you so.

We have been tasked with preserving the fabric of space time. Space time tends to take care of itself though, giving us the opportunity to misuse our technology to visit historical Black Rock City. In this role we serve as ambassadors of the temporally free, working to introduce Black Rock City to the magic (science) of time travel.
landmark: Shiny satellite

name: Burning Man Bike Course
description: Come test your skills on the Burning Man Bike Course! A bicycle challenge obstacle course and pump track for all ages, abilities, genders, and sexual preferences. Look for our morning "Kids Only" hours and our world famous Nitro Circus Biketakular Demo and Competition!
landmark: Bike features - pump track and teeter totters

name: Playful Lounge
description: Visitors will find a friendly, light-hearted lounge environment with seating, background music, mood lighting and the opportunity to spin the wheel for an interactive, participation based experience.  Our wheel includes a collection of activities designed to encourage stepping out of one's comfort zone. Our greeters and facilitators (staff) encourage participants to commit to the experience without knowing where the wheel will land. Staff is on hand to provide encouragement, confidence boosting, guidance, training and education for the experiences on our wheel.  Examples of wheel experiences: Pole dance, Petting Zoo (sensual touch), lap dance, body shots, spank (or be spanked). We welcome all that meet the minimum age requirements for adult activities (21+).
landmark: Red sign on twin peaked tent, 15 feet tall

name: Cloudy AF
description: Camp Cloudy As Fuck is a stormy ensemble of veteran burners, hailing from the Bay Area and beyond. Come drink Dark-and-Stormies with us, get a powertool massage from our Body Werkz team, and relax in our new Cloud Pit! We are dedicated to raising the hearts, body and souls of the broader Burning Man community through our art, events, and welcoming space. We dew take our fun quite cirrus-ly.
landmark: 20 foot tall aerial rig and 20x20'x4' cloud pit

name: It's All Made Up (IAMU)
description:
Once you have done something, it's hard to convince yourself that you can't. It's not that you think your way into a new way of acting, it's that you act your way into a new way of being.
 
This is transformation in the world as it is. It's easier said than done, and way more possible and fun together.

Creating an evolving culture and context of doing new things for the first time is as much play as it is art as it is an ever rendering ecology of everything we are and share with one another. 

Getting to be what we each are, and being there to help each other get there. That's the Why. It's All Made Up is a dynamic home, platform and connecting place to do so.

We are known for: DC Containers, Sky Bar, Green Innovations
landmark: 6-story Bar in the Sky

name: Beardhaus
description: Queer camp and LGBTQI+ safe space. Filthy drag show Monday night. The best cucumber cooler cocktails on playa. Daytime disco dance parties. Daily beard care and maintenance kits.
landmark: Pink bearded man LED art piece & BeardHaus sign

name: Porch Catz
description: Come cat around at Porch Catz! Sit a spell on our rustic wooden porch and see why we are such a close camp year round. After you've been christened with a cat collar, grab some cat ears and recite the three rules. Sunset Naked Happy Howls, questionable Yoga & decisions, in general - we've got it all! Keep your hands and arms inside the vehicle, but don't forget to maintain thigh contact!
landmark: giant wooden porch

name: Bait Shack
description:
Bait Shack!

A relaxing place to get out of the sun, have lively conversation, get an official fishing license, and then fish for hippies.  Come on down and tell us about the biggest whopper you caught, or even the last time you caught crabs...  All are welcome at the Bait Shack and we look forward to seeing you!
landmark: Bait Shack sign, 20' fishing poles with fish kites

name: Cosmiquarium Village
description: Utah's best kept secrets! Several theme camps coming together to create silent discos, playgrounds, vaudeville shows, and dining experiences. Our space themed, cosmic energy invites you to become a kid again. Black Rock City can be fast and hectic, slow down at our camp and experience intimate, meaningful connections.
landmark: 20' Scaffolding Tower & Dragonfly Scissor Lift

name: The Refuge
description:
Come find a magical oasis in the desert, a respite for all. 
We are dedicated to creating a space for recharging, refreshing, and reflecting with a diverse selection of food, drink, and community.  Join us for breakfast daily, and a magical Saturday brunch. Miss breakfast? Come relax in our visual oasis with your own waking dreams.
landmark: Moroccan Living room and Balinese Sculptures

name: Shackleton
description: Join us at Ernest Shackleton's 1915 Antarctic Base Camp! The icebergs and freezing cold temperatures will be warmed by the hot beats our DJs will be dropping, and the hot toddies on offer.
landmark: 53' refrigerated trailer w/ wooden stairs off back

name: Half-Ass
description: Camp Half-Ass is a group of fun loving individuals that has been bringing Peace, Love, and Laughter to the Playa since 2006. Come enjoy our infamous Bike Bar, Art Installations, and Beer Garden Parties.
landmark: Golden figure with raised arms, getting blow job

name: Groove Oasis
description: Groove Oasis is your refuge in the dusty desert to rest or move your body. We are hosting dance workshops and parties throughout the week so check the playa schedule and come get your groove on!
landmark: Pink and Blue Heart-Lotus Sign

name: ClusterF*ck United
description: Dust, Sun, Booze, Bikes, Night, and Noise--it's a ClusterF*ck out there and that's exactly what you'll find here: a ClusterF*ck of activity. Drop by to jump on our slide, refresh yourself at our bar, or enjoy a jaw-dropping playa sunset from our 24' tower.
landmark: 24' tower with a large asterisk beacon on top

name: Do More Now
description: The Firehouse bar at Do More Now is the best little hangout in the neighborhood.  We have parties, events, workshops, and performances happening every day. Come and introduce yourself!
landmark: Multi-storey Firehouse

name: Three of Cups
description: Tarot readings, cocktails, friendship, and something unexpected.
landmark: geodesic dome + adjoining shaded area w purple bar

name: Nice Nice
description: Nice Nice comprises an international group of artists, musicians, yogis, dancers, scientists, and creators. We're the camp with the great Hanging Gongs and Rimba Pipes. At Nice Nice we take an old-school approach to Burning Man -- interacting and connecting one-on-one, person-to-person.   You're invited to come by anytime to Bang the Gongs or Jam on the Rimba Pipes. Or join us around our camp fire at night and warm up with a cup of Hot Tea or Broth.
landmark: Nice Nice sign, hanging bells/gongs, and fire pit.

name: Banana Hammocks
landmark: Star Lights and camp sign

name: Monkey Love
landmark: Giant Monkey Tent

name: Stranger Games
description: The playa's premire gaming lounge! Come play all kinds of games with us, from board games, to party games, to... mind games?
landmark: The large "Hall of Game" sign out front.

name: EBB & Glow Village
description:
Come get your glow on with EBB & Glow Village!

Enjoy cold drinks and live music, or get on stage yourself at the Piano Bar's open mic. Take lessons on how to onewheel. Get your gorgeous playa portrait shot by pros, or selfie with a giant snarky conversation heart. Soothe yourself with spa treatments for parched playa skin, or relax with a cold stone treatment or massage. Swap stories for prizes and get your playa magic on. Broken bike? We can fix that too. Swing by later for some late-night drinks and nosh. If you're lucky, you might even win a stay at our beautiful boutique inn.  ​

Don't be a stranger, but do strange remain!
landmark: neon EBB+GLOW block letters & a massive pink heart

name: intergalacTEA lounge
hometown: San francisco, San Antonio, Santa Cruz, and Tulum,
description: The intergalacTEA lounge is a serene and inviting setting in the style of a neo-traditional Japanese tea house located on a planet in a faraway galaxy. Dusty visitors are invited to rest and recline among plush pillows and carpets surrounded by beautiful, billowing fabrics while sipping cups of revitalizing solar-brewed,  Hyper-Space Hibiscus-Cooler, among other herbal teas, Come hear musical sounds channeled from another galaxy while munching on a custom misfortune cookie!
landmark: Two aliens in front of the camp

name: Burners without Boundaries
description:
Chill Ville is an interactive tiki bar where patron becomes bartender and friends serve friends. Conversations are made, drinks are shared, strangers become friends, and dreams come true at this rustic bar.
Happy Hour 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, one week only, at Burning man.
ig @chill.ville.on.the.esplanade
landmark: rusti bar that shoots flames

name: Turbaza Chayka
description: A friendly camp of like-minded individuals bringing together the diverse experiences of people who grew up in the countries of the Former Soviet Union
landmark: A large flag with a seagull holding a flogger

name: Cascadia Lodge
description: Missing some key supply or part of yourself? Come find it at lollypopolus. Relax or dance in our domes, rejuvenate with drinks and snacks, peruse our 24 hour pharmacy for anything you may have forgotten, discover a new friend in our welcoming space.
landmark: colorful domes and spiral lights above bar

name: Camp Kühloff
description: Shaded oasis of Black Rock City and home of the ice cold lavender towels.
landmark: large white tent and blue flags

name: Goonies
description: Welcome to The Goonies! Where your childhood freedoms collides with the best part of adulthood in one giant SLAP of the goon bag.
landmark: Geodesic dome with a sign that says GOON LOUNGE

name: Inflation Station
description: A Bike Repair Theme Camp that encourages you to learn how to fix your bike. We have pumps, tools, tubes and other parts necessary to get you back out there ASAP. Open 24 /7, we are the first bike repair to open pre-arrival and the last to close post-event. Enjoy our comfortable shady lounge with a cold beverage and get outfitted in our fashion clothing exchange while you visit!
landmark: 15 -20 bike pumps standing up by the curb

name: Monks of Funk
description: The Monks of Funk welcome you to come to get down in our Dance Church. Join us at our Wednesday Worship party as we dance into the night!
landmark: Big church with the disco ball rose window

name: GalixAxia
description: A Dive Camp of Synthwave, Retro-Future Wave, CyberPunk Wave, Interstellar and Space Travel. Synthwave Music, Neon Colors Lights and Lasers. Apocalyptic Retro Future, Neo-Noir Atmosphere.
landmark: Black flag with two Bunnies

name: Zoom!
description: a Fire Circus under the sea.  Come for the fire stay for the playground.  Play a rousing game of Hungry Hungry Human Hippos.  Events and fire posted daily on chalk board out front and in the How What When Where guide.
landmark: a 30' tower with a LED Z at the top

name: Floristonia
description: Floristonia - Offering a daily Margarita Bar, non-alcoholic and ice cold water, under a relaxing, soothing, shady space.  Stop by and say hello.
landmark: Floristonia Sign, BIG, Red, truck with upper deck.

name: tldr village
description: tldr village! home of led dinosaur, sixes & sevens, good question!?, and dumpling trap. we got music, bars, trivia, new friendships, and speakeasy dumplings. make your way over to see what we are about.
landmark: large inflatable dinosaurs and led dinosaur sign

name: Disco Ballz
description: Disco Ballz camp is where you can find all the old disco played with original videos on huge wall.  Our over 30 disco balls hanging from ceiling, multiple disco lights & Saturday Night Fever dancefloor come by starting on Weds night and hang out with us.  Look for our Mutant Vehicles and come take a ride (Boogie Bug & Purple People Eater).
landmark: Giant "BOOGIE" sign on front of our disco tent

name: Crossroads & Moon Cheese Village
description: Crossroads & Moon Cheese have worked together for eight years to provide entertainment and hospitality in the form of LIVE music, a fully functional bar, a couple of chill spaces, a jungle gym, DJs and literally TENS of thousands of grilled cheese sandwiches - feeding over 10,000 burners. Crossroads' unique energy and next-level musical talent draws humongous crowds who come with a serious hunger to sing and dance and drink, while Moon Cheese serves up the tastiest grilled cheeses with all different types of bread and cheese, including gluten-free bread and vegan cheese, as well as a range of sweet, spicy, tangy and juicy dipping sauces. This year we're so jazzed to be adding a brand new food offering: French toast! And at the bar... popsicles!
landmark: Giant lit stage & fiery Octopus sign and wedges

name: Camp Orange
description: In 2022, Camp Orange will return to Black Rock City for our eighth consecutive year, and our 16-foot tall banana stand will once again tower erect over the Playa — a shining, lighted beacon for all citizens of BRC in search of a place to rest their weary, dusty bananas! Join us for chocolate covered frozen bananas, fruity frozen drinks, silly dance parties, fun and educational sessions inside our cozy dome, or just to hang out and have a good time.
landmark: Banana Stand, Orange Dome, Largest Known Hammock

name: Opulent Chill
description: Opulent Temple - Sacred dance to world class music since 2003.
landmark: 'O Pod' DJ booth shooting flames out of it.

name: Cafe Diem
description: We are an immersive cafe experience where each cup of coffee or tea is lovingly made. Take a break from the playa and enjoy the ritual of sipping coffee or tea from a handmade cup under our airy shade structure.  Stroll around to check out our art, play board games, or socialize and make new friends.  We happily serve cold brew and French press as well as a wide array of teas from around the world including classic and herbal varieties, not to mention hand-crafted sodas.
landmark: Tall wooden tensegrity tower supporting a canopy

name: BRC3PO (BRC 3:00 Post Office)
description: Set in a giant rural postbox, the Black Rock City 3:00 Post Office (BRC3PO) provides postal services up to 20 hours per day that include authentic, one-on-one, creative interactions that range from the side-splittingly silly to the supremely sublime. We also provide an array of curated Burning Man postcards, and postage to send them anywhere in the world. Imagine the intersection of immersive improvisational theater, spontaneous talent show, soulful conversation, and stifling but corrupt bureaucracy. You never know what will happen next at BRC3PO -- YOU could be what will happen next at BRC3PO, if you pay us a visit!
landmark: Giant white postbox with BRC3PO sign and red flag.

name: Salty Jacks
description: Camp Salty Jacks: Day and night we are the local deep dive bar of the 9:00 neighborhood.  Nautical, underwater themed, we are your safe haven from the fervor of the playa playing Hip Hop, R&B, Soul, Blues, Electro-swing, and Disco.
landmark: Lighthouse and giant SALTY sign

name: Kaleidoscope
description: Come get your morning caffeine fix with the best coffee on playa!  We serve single-cup pour over coffees from a menu of home-roasted single origin coffee beans from around the world.  And, come get a birds-eye view of playa from our 26 ft crows nest lookout tower!
landmark: 26 ft crows nest lookout tower

name: Art Wall for All
description:
YOU are invited to EXPRESS yourself on canvas and paint on the Wall! All materials are provided for this community art project, all we need is you! Get creative, set your imagination free and help your fellow citizens create a public art masterpiece! 
After the Burn, the art panels that make up the wall will be gifted to participants from around the world.
landmark: 24 foot canvas wall and tables covered with paint.

name: Nom De Plume
description: Come to our circus tent to drink yerba maté, lounge, and enjoy dub music. Relax while thriving, and drink tea. The way life should be.
landmark: White circus tent with a red stripe.

name: Ataraxia
description: ATARAXIA, it's a camp with a lot to offer everyone.  Come relax, laugh, and dance with us.  We've got daytime wellness programs and night time fun for all.  Please join us to escape the heat during the day and the cold at night.
landmark: The big white tent and lit up ATARAXIA sign.

name: Peace of Sit
description: Heart Beats is a small playa family offering a cuddle dome with ambient and downtempo tunes aimed at opening the heart, mind, and soul. We're offering a consensual safe space to relax and get real with music, open mics, runs, unicycling, yoga, mocktails, and 24 hour good vibes. Lift your spirits, lift your neighbor's spirits, elevate the collective, and chill. Come by any morning after the event opens for some cold brew coffee.
landmark: pulsing LED heart on top of our dome!

name: My Reply is Yes!
description: My Reply is Yes: Come for our Magic 8-Ball's wisdom and advice sourced fresh from another dimension, stay for the cozy vibes offered by the Ball's human helpers.
landmark: giant Magic 8-Ball. Seriously, you can't miss it!

name: Fever Dream Theater
description: Don't turn the page, we have a stage! A seductive home to a troupe of vaudeville and cabaret acts, bringing live entertainment to the Playa nightly. Have a talent or act you'd like to share with the city? Our stage is open and welcome to performers seeking the spotlight. Come see performances great and small, planned and spontaneous, sexy and hilarious. The greatest thing you'll ever learn is to laugh and be laughed at in return!
landmark: Three spired Moroccan tent on the corner.

name: Menagerie
description: We can't wait to welcome you back to playa with an elevated experience. Come on by for good food, great music, even better drinks, playa fashion boutique. We promise to deliver a sometimes sexy and always salty vibe.
landmark: Glowing Pickle with Hair Blown Back by Speakers

name: Camp Corny
description:
Camp Corny.  Find your spirit animal. Put em on a Pole. Thrust them to the beat. They're out of fucking control!  

Jump into a pile of 1,000 spirit animals and use our state-of-the-art technology to guide your hand to YOUR spirit animal.  Then our team of experts will help you put your spirit animal atop a gorgeous party pole.  As we all know, spirit animals eat dance, so FEED your new spirit animal, dancing wildly w/your new creation at our insanely joyful day club w/amazing DJ's and music.  Relax in our lounge, or on the shaded observation decks with playa scopes, or gaze at the 20' tall, flaming double unicorn arch with bubbles coming out of their butts.

It's all about joy @ Camp Corny so come n' get some and spread it around.

We're the friendliest fucking camp in the universe.
landmark: 20' Tall White Unicorn Arch That Shoots Fire

name: Start to Finish
description: Camp Start to Finish is an all-inclusive interactive zero distance endurance racing camp where participants, spectators, and passers-by give in to our fun spirited peer-pressure and take place in a made up NO distance running, walking, or cycling race that begins and ends on the same Start/Finish line. Warm-ups, pre-race preparation, event participation and post-race cooldowns are all celebrated and encouraged by cheering fans, libations, and music from little know Dj's. "Winners" are presented with a super cool Start-to-Finish metal as they stand a top our podium and bask in the glory of the victory in their heads!!! You don't want to miss it!
landmark: Start-to-Finish sign

name: Electric Cheese Land
description: Electric Cheeseland brings the fun of the Apres-Ski culture to the desert. Yodel songs, cheesy evenings to taste delicious food from the Alps, play interactive games and cheer with a shot of vodka. The "Naked Cheese nights" will feed the crowd with melted cheese, the "Cheese-n-Chill tent" will provide shelter and entertainment and the Polish Vodka Bar will challenge anyone's knowledge about flavors and mixology.
landmark: Flag with Cheese and Man

name: Vision Train Station
description: We are an art movement built by "connecting prayers manifested into inspired visions for the future." Our space is lined with conscious art, and filled with laughter & treats.
landmark: Vibrant 6ft. tall paintings on vinyl, lit at night

name: Camp Shark Cage
description: Camp Shark Cage - the playa's one and only nautical Nicolas Cage theme camp
landmark: Camp Shark Cage flag

name: Camp Butter
description:
Camp Butter is not only a camp of deliquescent souls. It is a movement... a way of sliding through life with a groove at your sails.
Equipped with DJ's, Butter-Inspired drinks, and a universal deep desire to churn ~ We're here to spread a simple message...
"Talk less, slide more",
-The Butter Crew
landmark: large yellow butter stick

name: Flying Falafels
description: Flying Falafel is an Los Angeles based theme camp, ran by a group of burners from different backgrounds. We are happy to bring to the playa unique Mediterranean culinary experiences every year with some great beats and vibes.
landmark: Shade structure made of 4 Blue shelving uprights

name: The Lavender Lounge
description: The Lavender Lounge is a day spa specializing in our patented and ultra-secret lavender day-spa treatment! Just kidding, its no secret! We lie you down on an air mattress in the shade and mist you down with lavender scented water while giving you a luxurious scalp massage! Come in hot and dusty, Leave refreshed and ready to take on the day!
landmark: giant silver tent

name: Yummy RUMInations
description:
Playfully-mindful camp uniting burners through laughter, curiosity, and consciousness. Daily experiments in vulnerability, intimacy, self-discovery, storytelling, and emotionally engaging workshops. 

Come enjoy a taste at the Yum Cart or at the Kava Bar!
landmark: The Rainbow 🌈 Colored Yum Sign!

name: Gender Blender
description: Gender Blender is a home for for trans, genderqueer, enby, gender variant, nonconforming, queens, kings, cross-dressers, and anyone shape shifting the gender paradigm. We welcome all genders always and we focus on creativity, fun, consent, and liberation education. We make smoothies in the desert, dance, celebrate our lives, and do epic performance art.
landmark: purple flags, giant blender  near C&J iconic flags

name: HexMix
description: HexMix will be open 1pm to 4pm M-F for spa time and meditative activities. Come join us for facemasks, hair care, drawing kolams, singing chants, and the occasional sound bath.
landmark: Hot Pink Shade Wings on the Carport

name: Synaesthesia
description: Camp Synaesthesia is a synaesthetic dreamworld where movement, light, and sound unite, empowering groups to create and experience multisensory, collaborative performances. Interact with our immersive spatially mapped light and sound installation or come jam with us. We will be hosting a variety of workshops and collaborative performances of all kinds! Contact us if you'd like to collaborate!
landmark: Glowing multicolor "Synaesthesia" sign in front

name: KonaZona Coffee and Tiki Bar
description: Serving  Kona Coffee-Liquid  Hugs for your Brain every morning
landmark: Suspended Burning Piano & flags of many nations

name: The Pearly Gate
description:
We are the 69th Precinct
Violators will be ticketed for their "crimes" against the 10 Principles.  Issued citations will have trial dates/times per the What Where When event guide.  Violators that report to the 69th Precinct during arraignment will be booked, tried and prosecuted.  All parties will likely be found guilty...as determined by a 12 member jury of Radically Included Burners during the Judge, Jury and Sexecutioner events as scheduled during the week. Don't run the purple stoplight on our intersection, unless its run the purple stoplight minute. It could a rainbow. Who knows. Watch our for the T.W.A.T. team. They may come to your camp to flush out crimes.
landmark: The guard tower, chain link, and the Tripper Stick

name: Dead Hand Path
description: Dead Hand Path is founded on the idea that now is a pivotal time for humanity, where we stand on the precipice of an incredible future or total annihilation. The decisions we make today have consequences for the world in a pay that people of the past or future may not even be able to image; that this is a sort of "dream time" for the world. Confronting this is a difficult thing and we need to put effort to maintaining our essential humanity as systems around us shape our lives more and more. The name comes from the Soviet "Dead Hand" system, which was set to automatically respond to a nuclear attack with a second strike, ensuring total annihilation with the decision ultimately placed in the hands of machines.
landmark: Podium with books near the geodesic dome.

name: Herding Cats
description:
Herding Cats camp is a cozy spot that welcomes any and everyone to come and hang out. Cats are known to be independent, lazy, shy, spontaneous and playful. We as humans are no different so we invite you to come to our lounge where you can embrace you being you without judgment.
We offer a comfy lounge cat zone where you can enjoy a cocktail, play on our aerial silks or if you're feeling less social, just hang out with your awesome self and listen to some good tunes and people watch.
landmark: LED Cat head on 15 ft wooden stand

name: Pretentious Fox
description: A diverse gathering of pretentious FOX and other eclectic and venerable animals! We provide an essential neighborhood BAR with good MUSIC, a giant SWINGSET, and many EVENTS including Bloody Mary Brunch with live music!
landmark: Big swingset, with turquoise aerial silk

name: PG Squirt House
description: A place with the grooviest of tunes and vibes to get anyone dancing. Come in to lounge or for a quick drink to get the party started!  We got Pre-Game in our name and that's what we are all about.  No better way to get the party started then with the PG Squirt House Crew!
landmark: All the Purple Easy Ups! And Purple PG Logo Flag

name: Penguin Place
description: Penguin Place is an Antarctic oasis where people come to chill / relax and make friends.
landmark: giant king penguins

name: Happy Seats
description: Come one, come all! Chill, eat, drink, relax, refuel. We can help with all your needs and even fulfill desires you did not even know you had.
landmark: Large Moondrive sign, it will be lit up at night

name: Asian Fetish Camp
description: We have a fetish for all things Asian and would love to share it with you!
landmark: Large aluminet structure with AFC sewn on corner

name: Fuck Yeah!
description: Fuck Yeah is a fun interactive camp throwing an eclectic array of events from hair braiding, yoga, music and more!
landmark: Fuck Yeah sign illuminated 50' up on scaffolding

name: Coyote Garden
description:
Coyote Garden is BRC's all-ages, all-hours neighborhood coyote park built around a kinetic art installation that brings together dozens of UV-reactive coyote art pieces to celebrate the native song dog of the Americas (and BRC itself). It's tended by an eclectic group of coyote-adjacent artists and designers to increase coyote consciousness by showing them in different lights.﻿

Coyote Garden exists outside of known time and space. It appears out of the ether on very special occasions when the colorful progenitor coyotes are summoned to this realm by the secret rituals and dark science of the mysterious Coyote Gardeners. The Interdimensional coyotes are especially active from dusk till dawn, when the garden fully transforms and reveals its truest form. Sometimes pancakes and coffee too.
landmark: Giant glowing coyote towers & UV-reactive coyotes

name: Octopus Garden
description: Octopus Garden is an interactive lounge featuring funky beats, salty treats, and tropical drinks. Come lounge in our garden, play a game, or dance your tentacles off!
landmark: giant inflatable tentacles

name: DUSTFISH
description: DUSTFISH, a legacy camp providing live performances, Pho and Fire.
landmark: Fire & the 90 gallon cauldron hanging from a crane

name: Gnomeman's Land
description:
Everything beautiful on the playa happens with a bit of luck — and the gnomes at Gnomeman's Land have it in spades! We originate from deep in the forests of your most charming fairy tales. Some are stout & rotund, others are slender & sultry, but all are jolly & wear pink heart-shaped nipple pasties.
 
Our rainbow-picketed lawn will be an oasis from the scorching sun, and we serve ice cold lemonade all day long! Come join our annual block party — we'll be manning the grill, and dancing in the Gnome Dome - a giant mushroom cap structure with bedazzled disco interiors. Come wander into Gnomeman's Land, who knows what you may find!
 
As for the luck — a well-embraced hug with the right gnome will grant you some, and legend says a sloppy smooch may grant even more!"
landmark: Large red & white spotted mushroom-shaped dome

name: Nordic Paradise
description:
Nordic Camp brings you the dear, but immensely silly, elements from a crazy northen heritage, culture and tradition. 

We will have a amazing workshops focusing on your body's wellbeing; massage, yoga, meditation, but also ass-piano, wrestling and ass-piano.
Our DJ will play awesome music and the bar will serve all sorts of delights. 

Monday and Wednesday are our big workshop days, where we focus all our enegy on the workshops mentioned above. 

On Thursday Nordic Camp will host an amazing DAY-TIME PARTY that will blow your mind! We will serve everything at the same time!

It's a crazy camp and we love to see you in the crowd, jumping around in joy and lust, like there is no tomorrow. 

Welcome to Nordic Camp!
landmark: Big illuminated midsummer pole

name: Black Rock Boat Rentals
landmark: Big wooden dock

name: Seashell Cartel
description: Ragnarok is the End and the Beginning.  It tells a story where destruction is necessary for creation to flourish.  It is rebirth, it is recovery, it is rejuvenation, it is a renaissance, it's renewal, restoration, and resurrection.  It is what we are experiencing in our lives right now.  It is Burning Man.  And now, it's us.  We are camp Ragnarokk!
landmark: The giant Thor and his flowing red cape.

name: Conception
description: Conception is an arts collective and Burning Man theme camp.  We represent the miraculous still point between imagined and actual.  We highlight that moment when ideas become tangible:  the birthing of whim, desire, and emotion into art and performance. We believe in everyone's innate creativity.  We foster and celebrate that inner spark and provide a fertile (play)ground for it.
landmark: Entry gate at corner and a large shade sail

name: Elvis Wedding Chapel & Gardens
description: "Happily ever after" begins here! Now in our tenth year of hosting ersatz Playa weddings for the nuptially needy, EWC welcomes individuals, couples, trios and other configurations without regard to race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, species or any other limiting factor. The Moist Rev. L. Ron Presley (No Relation) officiates over a variety of custom-tailored ceremonies, each climaxed by the dramatic revelation of the spirit of Lord Elvis himself—as embodied by the amazing, life-size, audio-anatomically accurate ELBOT 2000, Black Rock City's most venerable robotic resident! But first, Fashion Director Ms. Lilly Vargas and her team of trained experts will outfit the Bride, Groom and Attendants in dazzling Playa finery, on loan from our legendary Bridezilla Lounge!
landmark: Bell tower w/ Elvis on it; listen for wind chimes!

name: IDEATE
description: We are dedicated to amplifying solutions at the intersection of sustainability, community, and art - to solve our world's greatest problems and build a better tomorrow - as a global community of purpose-driven entrepreneurs, creatives & humans. On playa, we are helping green the burn thru example and leadership, hosting interactive workshops on wellness, climate, and psychedelics, and creating magical art pieces and curating musical experiences. Off playa, we are a year round community spreading the Ten Principles, sharing experiences of wonder and joy, and making the rest of the world feel more like playa one day at atime. Come join us!
landmark: large illuminated "I" in the sky

name: Captain Pump's Raiders
description:
Captain Pump's Raiders is Black Rock City's finest giant-robot driving mercenary company, and we roll a mean D20. Come visit us for RaiderCon VII, the Playa's premier (and possibly only) roleplaying-game convention!

This year we have our StarCraft tournament, the Night Garden Dome, DUSTWORLD Sci-Fi LARP, Make Your Meeple, Serenity Movie Night, and lots more.
landmark: Captain Pump's Raiders sign

name: Illuminaughty
description: Illuminate your naughty side! Come visit our naughty carnival Monday-Tuesday 4PM-10PM, Wednesday-Thursday 4PM-8PM to challenge yourself to feats of great debauchery. Tuesday and Wednesday, the festivities continue through midnight - just follow the bright lights of our Ball of Light raised 40 feet into the sky.
landmark: 40 foot tower "Ball of Light"

name: Serenity Now
description: Serenity Now is the most welcoming coffee house on the playa! We serve delicious cold brew, and offer a respite for weary travelers to refuel and continue their Burn. Cold drinks, a place to rest, and the best friends you haven't met.
landmark: Tall aluminet dome with triangular door

name: The Institute
description: Visit the Institute of Higher Yearning where our overeducated undermanaged staff will jam in your brain all the science that you can take and provide electro-shock therapy while you demonstrate your best refrigerated dance moves. God created the playa to train the faithful and we will teach you EVERYTHING you need to know.
landmark: The Institute spelled out between a pair of domes.

name: Bedouins Camp
description: Relaxing and refreshing paradise in the scorching desert sun for the dusty travelers of the playa to enjoy the legendary hospitality of the bedouins.
landmark: the walled off shade area with a bar in the middle

name: Illumination Village
description: Illumination Village offers the most old school, beautifully chaotic and welcoming Burning Man experience on the Esplanade. We are one of the oldest villages at 20…some..thing…years? Do Covid years count? Anyway - flame on!
landmark: 12ft Flaming "Illumination Village" sign

name: The Heart Collective
description: This camp is a safe heart filled space that wants to promote and encourage you to take exquisite care of your mind, body, heart, and spirit, so that you can experience the burn from a place of wholeness and bring more of your own talents and gifts to the playa. It is our great honor to provide healing services at our sanctuary, squish in our consensual cuddle lounge, hydrate with superb elixirs at our nourishment lab, serve tea in our lotus lounge and most of all, love you up the heartist way we know how to. Work Heart. Play Heart. Rest Heart.
landmark: Large Lit up Heart

name: HEX
landmark: Metal Fire Ants

name: Intergalactic Sasquatch Village
description: The Intergalactic Sasquatch is returning for its 8th year-  for the day trippers, the night walkers, the virgins to the vets, our funky lil cantina offers a place to escape the madness and go down the rabbit hole! Take a stroll through our fractal forest, guests are welcome to walk about the woods through fractal trees, but we warn you to tread carefully and keep an eye out for the very creatures that find their home in our camp! You might be asked to pay the "squatchtoll" in our interactive gameland and if visitors are 21&older, Squatch O'Hairs offers deliciously refreshing bevvys for in between rounds! Our illustrious crystal grid serves as a space for dancing, musical performances, workshops, yoga, and our Sasquavision Theatre, showing films nightly.
landmark: Liteup Sassysquatch Cutout, Fractal Forest, & UFOS

name: VITA
description: VITA Camp has the purpose of sharing experiences that will impact you in all levels, such as:Physically, Mentally, Emotionally and Spiritually
landmark: Vita light sign

name: Yellowstone Burners
description: Come explore the Healing Power of Ritual and Placebo at our apothecary lounge, Playacebo. Our Life-Tenders will guide you through a healing ritual based on what you're seeking out of life in the moment. As a bonus, we'll also top off your water bottle before we send you on your way. You'll leave rejuvenated, hydrated, and ready to go explore, connect, and play.
landmark: large brown school bus with the upper deck.

name: Camp ThumpThump
description: In Drums and Dust We trust! Come one come all, we invite all drummers across playa, regardless of musical background or ability to drum with us. We host daily unfacilitated and facilitated drum circles for all abilities and ages. We are not performance focused, but community focused! That means you! We have drums or bring your own. We offer instrument building workshops as well. Drum with us!
landmark: Big Orange Striped Circus Tent

name: Seaweed
description: Play the  Burning Piano ,  get massaged and learn at our presentations. Chill  in our  pillow filled  "Comfort" tent.  Be entertained or dance in our Joy  venue. Make a Tutu on Tuesday.
landmark: Suspended Burning Piano & flags of many nations

name: 8-bit Bunny
description:
Enjoy our steam sauna everyday from noon to sunset. Sweat out the dust and sunscreen, and leave feeling refreshed and ready to explore. 

Looking for a drink? Spin the wheel at our bar and complete a task for your drink.
landmark: Giant pixel bunny

name: Disco Space Shuttle
description:
The Disco Space Shuttle (DSS) LaunchPad will assist camps and art projects that need extra hands/support to realize their vision.

The LaunchPad space will be a place for our camp to play matchmaker; matching people who need build support with people who can volunteer to help them realize their dreams. It will also act as the home base and meeting point for our DSS team of volunteers, a minimum of 10 daily, that are dedicating service hours to help other camps and art projects to launch! The LaunchPad will include a LaunchPad Book to write help requests or sign up as a volunteer with availability to help support others.
landmark: 20' Tall Space Shuttle, Pink Lounge, Star Lanterns

name: Mystical Order of Dust andShadows
description: Our order has discovered that the concentrated, transcendent creativity of Black Rock City has formed an energetic vortex, allowing contact with beings from another dimension. They appear to be dreaming our reality, and we can communicate with them through their dreams. Help us solve puzzles to unlock this mystery and make contact. If you are successful in this endeavor, you will be initiated as a member of our order.
landmark: Mystical Order of Dust and Shadows Sign

name: Gigsville
description: Gigsville is one of the oldest villages on the Playa (we're turning 25 this year, hooray!). We're dedicated to fire, fun, and good old fashioned jackassery. You'll find us gathered around the car that's on fire in the center of camp, probably arguing about whether or not ocelots should be allowed in camp, and whether or not that was, indeed, our camel.
landmark: large glowing red "G" and the car on fire.

name: STRANGELOVE
description:
Airline-themed lounge celebrating the high Jet Age, and how it opened new possibilities for connection to so many.  

Join us for a drink and a dance in our flight cabin, make new friends at our 16-foot long Chart Bar, which features an air navigation map of the entire continental United States, and a crew waiting to serve you the 'beverage of your choice!' 

Sit back, relax, and enjoy the flight!
landmark: shade structure that looks like an airliner!

name: Lost + Found
description: We are a family and community, a California-based collective of dreamers, artists, adventurers, and passionate doers, that loves throwing fun badass parties as much as we love connecting on deeper levels. We are professionals at being, playing, curating unique experiences, and faffing about - whether it's flow, dance, music, magic, bubbles, movement, fire spinning, food, drinks, art, live jams, deep talks, tiny things or a whole lot of silly nonsense. We're a diverse group of eclectic individuals that operates with love and respect for the 10 Principles of Burning Man. We create interactive and magical experiences together as we inspire others to flow, love, and be their free and fearless selves. We also take lost and found items, including people. ;) Come play with us! Get lost with us!!
landmark: Lost + Found Neon Sign and 25-Foot Light Totem

name: Gauchos del Fuego
description:
Gauchos del Fuego, the home to Argentinean burners in  BRC since 2014. Come by to enjoy some mates in the morning and may be you might end up taking your own mate kit home. 

We are also home of Fuego Austral, our regional burn. We'll have information and postcards for you to take home about the only regional burn in Latin America.

On Thursday show your Gaucho's skills at the Guachopartooza, a Pampa's Rodeo BRC Style.
landmark: Large Argentinean flying flag on top of the shade

name: Bring A Pheromone
description: Are pheromones the secret to lasting love and connection? Or do you just want an excuse to smell a stranger's armpit? Not Sure? Bring a Pheromone!
landmark: blue, red, and yellow Armpit Smelling Booth.

name: Amber Dust
description: One of the most diverse camps with lots of amber love to share: Amber, Amber Dust, Amber people, Amber drinks. And home of THE Sausage party! Two of them!
landmark: A 33ft diameter dome with pink pompoms.

name: Shangri-Lawless
description:
A forgotten paradise to soothe the wary adventurer, or a lawless land of risk & reward? We are both. A yin and ayang. An amalgamation of two elements, each playing off the other.
Come and enjoy our beautiful bar-lounge replete with delicious concoctions and hookah or meet the love of your lifegetting nasty on the dance floor. We are here for you!
landmark: Glowing "Shagnri-Lawless" sign above our lounge

name: Syncytium
description: Syncytium consists of people who Do: Creators, Scientists, Engineers, Artists, Flow Artists, Builders, Makers, Musicians, Healers, Seekers and Circus performers. Syncytium is an incubator, open to all who want to play! We create beautiful experiences for others and ourselves.
landmark: Domes and Fire. 14ft tall LED and Fire spire

name: Atlantis
description: "dance" camp
landmark: Two 25' towers and 6' Disco Trident

name: Awesome!(ville)
description: Awesome!(ville) is the home of daily classes, fun spaces, and organized chaos. We'll teach you a new skill, find your hidden artsy talent, move and grove your body, and pour you a tasty cocktail. Kick back and enjoy artwork, new friends, and lots of laughs. We're here to celebrate just how AWESOME you can be!
landmark: 40ft dome with red, tan, and green shade sails

name: Jaguar Occult
description: The Jaguar Occult seeks truth about the beyond. We reach it by diving internally and aligning with the principles of the Jaguar! Silent, Deep, Curious.
landmark: sunken pirate ship with lasers

name: The Notorious Scoundrels' Club
description: The Secret Gentlemen have had it with the high life. They're The Notorious Scoundrels now, and they're getting in touch with their inner lowlife.
landmark: S!

name: Flamingo Camp
landmark: the Pink flags and 450 plastic flamingo garden.

name: Ashram Galactica
description:
Ashram Galactica - The Grand Hotel | Your Home Away From Home Away From Home

Located Directly Above the Center of the Earth
landmark: large "Ashram Galactica" archway sign out front

name: Sensual Pleasures (The Camp for)
description:
The Camp for Sensual Pleasures is dedicated to providing pleasure for women in an environment that's sensual, safe, comfortable & private.

The well-known Orgasamator Experience is back, enhanced to give women an even more intensely enjoyable experience, and our Personal-Contact Hair Wash and Massage will be a treat to all.
landmark: The signage for the Sensual Pleasures camp.

name: Spice N Vice
description: Spice N Vice offers Bedouin hospitality every day from 12-4 p.m. Visit us for some hot or cold chai tea. Our comfortable oasis is also the perfect place to take a break from the sun and talk to one of our travel sages for stories about life abroad and travel advice.
landmark: Large red bedouin tent

name: Lunar Disco
description:
Lunacy with a Pinch of Disco. Follow the sound, follow the moon.
For all intergalactic Burners on the dark side of the moon: Daily Sunset Discos - gyrate while you howl at the setting sun!  Zero Gravity. Disco Nap. Time, Space & Heart Exploration. Teleport your body & mind with Art, Dance & Music. & Get your moon all shined up with a moon massage!
landmark: Lunar Disco main entrance structure with signage

name: Grand Lind Voyager
landmark: Village signs

name: Music Savages
description: We like beats and a healthy serving of comedy. Come by for a shotgun and motorboat
landmark: 13' tall pallet shelving with sail shades

name: Camp Maru
description: We are Camp Maru and we love asking deep uncomfortable questions that make you pause and reflect, we love helping you express what you truly want in life through embodiement and through your voice in all shapes and forms!
landmark: Ask at Hushville entrance

name: CornHub
description: CornHub is your local watering hole for all your corny needs. Stop by for a good shuckin' and kernel poppin'.
landmark: CornHub flag. It looks like what you think it does

name: Bat Country
landmark: Flaming Bar

name: Camp Homeslice
description: Drop in for a cheerful "Slice of Home"—Playa-style. Participate in our Experimental Grilled Cheese Theatre, climb the sky-high HomeSlice Tower's inverted pyramids, or re-engineer your Playa duds and gear at our Radical Alteration clinics.
landmark: 30' hourglass-shaped wooden climbing tower

name: Dymaxion
landmark: Look for the Dymaxion camp sign

name: Priscilla
description: Transporting a bunch of queens to the desert to help others in the quest to find their most fabulous selves. EXPRESS YOURSELF!
landmark: The Pink Bus!

name: Secret Passage
description:
FLUFFY'S SECRET: 
A surrealist, cloud-scape CAFE of your waking dreams, with:
24 hour self-serve iced coffee, tea, and lemonade,
Plus DAILY SPECIALS of fluffy treats: either edible, visual, audio, or performance
landmark: Inflatable LOVE ball, Space-cat ball, lit at night

name: A Transformation Station
description: An art school, new camp incubator, a cultural exchange hub, a place of learning, transformation and sharing ... & Gifting Galore!
landmark: Red LED strip outlining the frontage perimeter

name: Unnecessarily High Five
landmark: wood A frame with UH5 sign on top- lit at night

name: Sheep Thrills
description: Sheep Thrills is your homo-licious home on the range, co-located with Pink Ponies and TomorrowLamb. We're a group of booty rams here to give you no-frills Sheep Thrills! Come to our pleasure pasture for daily talks and workshops related to queer issues, knock hooves with us during the annual Black Rock City Naked Pub Crawl on Wednesday, and join us for the first annual FRITES & BEATS party — we're shear delight!
landmark: Sheep Thrills sign and Sheep Thrills bike flags

name: PlayaDough
description: Explore the purifying and bonding experience of a traditional Russian sauna: dry and steam heat with birch twig lashings.
landmark: Hexayurt with "БАНЯ" written on it, "Banya" sign

name: Bathrobe Camp
description: Bathrobe Camp occupies a little tiny portion of Gigsville.  Come see us for great conversation, cold canned beverages, and to check out our pedal powered dining table.
landmark: CarBQ--we'll be nearby

name: iAwake
landmark: Robot Happy Hour sign

name: Fat Panda
description: Welcome home my dusty little panda. We would love to introduce you to our flame menagerie. Come push our buttons and see what happens! While you're there, maybe grab some food and settle in to watch a movie. We can't wait to meet you.
landmark: Large Metal Animal Sculptures

name: Cloud 9
landmark: tall pyramids, golden suspended cube in front

name: Happy Hour
description: Hard day on the playa? Unwind at Happy Hour, where you'll be greeted by one of a kind refreshing spirits served with smiles! Enjoy our lounge, bar, and dance floor!  Start your day with Happy Hour!
landmark: Firepit Lounge

name: Tarna
description: The home of the jackalope mutant vehicle, Tarna. Come see her antler flame effects and booming sound system, and maybe join us for a ride out on the playa.
landmark: Tarna the Jackalope Mutant Vehicle

name: Vitruvian
description: The Vitruvian Lounge (formally Pongo Lounge) serves up good gyrations with our LED Human Gyroscope, great music, great craft cocktails, and a chill lounge. Every day from 10am to 10pm, burners are invited to step into our 15' Human Gyroscope, assume the position of da Vinci's famous sketch of human ideals, and turn their world, quite literally, upside down.
landmark: Spinning LED Human Gyroscope

name: Peanut Butter Jellyfish
landmark: Hanging Jellyfish

name: BLD
description: Burning since 1996!
landmark: colorful flags on bamboo along street, 30' dome

name: School of Black Rock
description:
School of Black Rock is a comical, self-deprecating school house where we teach a variety of random subjects, or learn from our students!

Examples include, but are not limited to: 
- 10 Principles of Burning man
- Black Rock Geography
- Fairy shrimp
- Swearing and "I love you with" bad accents or in another language
- Jousting/Horse Racing-general PE 
- Learn The Hustle
- Learn a School of Black Rock Cheer
- Moop, don't be Trashy
- Consent
- Geography - Explain this map
- Arts and crafts
- Short history of Burning Man
- English: Innuendo
- Safety Third

We also activities like stick-pony riding/racing/jousting or making a corsage for our prom.

If students are lucky they might even get a visit from our Faerie Shrimp School Mascot!

Behave (or don't) or you will get a detention stamp!
landmark: Red school house facade and bus facade on RV.

name: Red Nose District
description: Red Nose District (RND) has been in existence, in one form or another since 1998. In 2013, we resolved to keep our hearts, minds, and noses RED from now until the end of time! RND has roots and participants in LA, SF, Santa Fe, DC, NYC, Oregon, Canada, Israel, France, & various states & countries around the world. Our members are involved in (or are lovers of) the circus arts, & work to bring our skills & talents to the playa in forms that allow for immersive & participatory experiences for citizens of Black Rock City. Notable past projects/activities include: High Chair Stilt Bar, PedalBump, Muse, Fire Wire, Wheel of Fortune, Zenobia Blanca stilt limo, Zeppelin art cars, stilt lessons, Whiskey Kickball, 30' swings, & circus variety shows of all forms!  Come find us on the playa!
landmark: Red & white big top & 30' high swing

name: Perihelion
description: Welcome a brilliant morning at our Planet Brunch parties (Mon-Fri, 11-1)! Discover an unexpected oasis under the scorching noonday sun: chilled cucumber sandwiches, loaded drunken pancakes, and frozen Pina Coladas! Come for the hotcakes, stay for the dance jams and giant adult coloring boards.
landmark: Blue & gold camp, lines of blue streamers in front

name: Coyote Club
description:
Howdy, welcome to the Coyote Club! 
Come by our misty taqueria to cool down and fill up! We are offering table service tacos and a full bar to refresh you with one of our cactus coolers. If the sun going down then we're just getting started. Come dance on our padded dance floor, grab a drink or just chill while we bring you into the night in our neon desert oasis. Later in the evening, we will be slinging up midnight quesadillas to fuel you on your journey coming in or going out. If you catch us on the right day you'll get to experience the energetic and creative effects of raw cocoa. Stop by and grab a drink, a conversation, or a bite!
landmark: Circus tent swathed in neon (and the sign)

name: 404: Village Not Found
description:
404: Village Not Found-Come here to get lost.
A visually rich and unique village with a long history, 404 is home to Death Before Decaf, Dye With Dignity, M*A*S*H 4207th, Pottie Project, and Horseshoes and Handgrenades. A diverse and welcoming environment, you can find something fun 24 hours a day here. Watch a movie, throw some horseshoes, grab a coffee, dye a scarf, eat a snow cone, drink the best martini on the playa, photobomb the red carpet, run a security checkpoint, learn about grey water evaporation or the importance of toilet access worldwide, or just find a place you didn't realize you really needed to be until you got there.
landmark: Tower with yellow sign next to M*A*S*H 4207th tower with sign.

name: Stars And Bikes
description:
Bike repair. Professional mechanics and tools. Learn to ride. Learn bike repair. Propaganda swag. Join us! No experience necessary!

And if you're in Minneapolis, join us for year-round events. We are motivated by the belief that access to practical transportation equalizes opportunity and improves connection to the communities around us. Also, bikes are awesome!
landmark: Barrel Boy

name: A&mpersand
description: Camp & will be hosting boozy snowcones in the afternoon and karaoke nights in the evening. Come by in the afternoon and cool off in our shaded space and make some new friends. Then come back in the evening with your favorite tune and sing your heart out. If you need a break from EDM, and just want some Britney bitch, this will be your spot!
landmark: & sign!

name: Coup de Foudre
hometown: San Francisco, CA; Boston, MA; Planet Earth, Milky Way Laniakea
description: Coup de Foudre is a group obsessed with bringing the technical into the art world. If electronic art touches your soul, stop by for an electrifying experience.
landmark: Institute Sign with Brightly Lit Large Dome

name: Camp Borborygmus
description: A Grumbling of a welcome to you! Camp Borborygmus (the scientific term for stomach noise)! Step right up and tame your troubled tummy rumbles! Here you may explore our Ol' Apothecary of Miraculously Rare Elixirs and Treasures. Settle your stomach from the likes of acid-reflux and dehydration, sway your tummy bubbles away in our hammock oasis. With faith healing and snake oils prepare to be amazed at how you can feel! Ease your rumbly woes with a variety of GI medicinal products including Tums, Probiotics and other light dietary sustenance and aides. Don't forget to check out our signature World Famous Mysterious Blue Tube while you're here! Very mysterious!
landmark: Borborygmus flag

name: That Camp Over There
description:
That Camp Over There.  Next to those tents and the dome, past the cars, on the left. Look for the dusty bikes and a bunch of people sitting around in the shade.  If you see a Snowcone machine, a small village of cool, shaded Hammocks, hear pleasant mellow jazz vibes drifting on the wind, and someone offers you a toasted cheese 
 snack, keep going, you've gone too far.
landmark: big sign saying "That Camp Over There"

name: Alice in Slumberland
description:
Known for intricate cocktails and zany decor, this year the bar returns with an extra tall and an extra short sections, just in case you suddenly change in height after consuming a drink. 
We also offer the caterpillar lounge, a hookah bar with a relaxing gathering space for our guests, open every afternoon (relaxing space open always). Also open always is our LED croquet court -- use some flamingos to hit some balls! Hit them at your friends!
And this year, we have much more fire.  Flaming croquet one evening, flaming juggling another. Come do them all, with hot drinks too. 

But careful, you might get trapped in the Queen of Heart's Bunny Cage, if you don't pass our arbitrary DUI checks.
landmark: LED illuminated Croquet Court

name: 1001 Nights
hometown: Originated: Dubai, UAE. Multinational (Los Angeles, CA; Middle East; Switzerland; ...)
description:
1001 nights is a haven to nomadic folk who journey from all lengths of the world.

Togetherness is our purpose. Our intentions are to bring part of middle eastern heritage and culture to the playa. Generosity and sociability  are the beauty of this culture and we invite whoever to be part of it, indulge as royalty and enjoy traditional offerings to share lovely connections under our dome. We welcome all as if inviting visitors into our homes and our hearts.

Our stories represent us and our project, Makateeb, is our flagship. Makateeb stems from the Arabic word "Makatoob" which means "written". Through it, we provide an immersive and warm environment capturing some middle eastern hospitality of communing and sharing experiences with each other through hand-written letters.
landmark: Big Dome covered with pink and purple fabrics

name: Burning Globe
description: For the past several years, we have brought a reimagined Globe Theater to the Playa and  we have filled it with people witnessing one another speak with joy, passion, abandon, imagination, irreverence, humor and pathos. We fully embrace the mission to change the paradigm of art from a commodified object to an interactive, participatory, shared experience of creative expression. As a piece of live theater, our work can only exist once in time and it is gone. We welcome folks from all walks of life to learn, create and collaborate!
landmark: Burning Globe Sign. Big red & shaped like flames.

name: The Hand Lovers Lounge
description: The Avant Yard Village is a motley collection of passionate burners from across the globe. We made our first trek to Black Rock City in 2008, and have acted as ambassadors for the culture of Burning Man to thousands of people, both on the playa and off!
landmark: Two domes with a bamboo fence in between

name: Grilled Cheese Experiment
description: The Grilled Cheese Experiment brings gooey comfort food deliciousness while we experiment with one of the 10 Principles. This year: Immediacy!
landmark: Large flag with rainbow grilled cheese logo

name: Love Puddle
description: A neighborhood bar, playground and lounge open every afternoon that serves the most refreshing punch on the playa, to enjoy before or after playing foursquare or swinging on the swings. Ask nicely and we might give you a Love Puddle or whip out Dildo Jousting. We make sure passerby are assaulted with friendly invitations to join in the fun whenever we are open. Check out our events in the What Where When or just come by and look at our calendar to see when we're having Strip Rock Paper Scissors, Topless Mimosas, and other ridiculous fun!
landmark: large wooden multi colored two-person swing set

name: MythMaker
description:
Make your Myth at
MythMaker Camp 
For fire, ritual, mythology, swords, dragons, heathens and Mead.
Flaming dragon stage with MeadHall and healing zone.
Workshops and live music.
Live your Legend
landmark: Giant dragon stage on our bus

name: Milk + Honey
description: Milk + Honey is excited to offer our thirteenth Playa Shabbat service and dinner which draw on secular and spiritual traditions for the creative expression and collective healing of individuals and communities. We nourish the hearts, spirits, and bodies of all who find themselves wandering in the desert! Come hang, dance, and perform with us at our stage setup throughout the week.
landmark: huge Milk + Honey banner hung on our 53' container

name: Camp Cul-de-Sac
description: Since 1997 Camp Cul-de-Sac has been the playa home to a diverse group from all over the country. We offer an open-air all night cinema, as well as an acoustic/electric jam dome in the afternoons.
landmark: Big Movie Screen and couches.

name: Questionable Behavior?
description: Questionable Behavior PyroTex is a combination crew of principal-oriented burners who unite around creating immersive experiences that inspire participation and inquiry. We share art in the forms of interactive installations, dance parties, workshops, and fire! Check out the weird and find a different view than the one you came with.
landmark: Large scaffolding with giant disco ball

name: Eurotrash Sangria Bar
description: Serving the best sangria and playing music from around the Latin world every afternoon, 3 pm to 7 pm!
landmark: Blue banner saying 'Eurotrash Sangria Bar'

name: Prawn Shop
description: American by birth; Black Rock City Citizen by the grace of the gods! Come see us at Apocalypse WOW, the place to be for all the things you love about the Apocalypse (and don't): Vietnamese iced coffee,  jousting in patriotic spandex, non sensical awards, cold beer and the famous spaghetti burrito…  We're here to quash those vibes of impending world doom and give you a chance to prove you're not a Narc while doing a naked handstand. We love you already, we look forward to giving you a high five and shaving your eyebrows.
landmark: 40' tall beacon with a glowing orb

name: Metric Duck Ton
description: Brewing Coffee and Ducking Responsibility.
landmark: White dome and a bunch of ribbons

name: Never Sleep Again
description: Electronic music and games, inspired by Berlin clubs and open air parties. Our intimately designed dance floor surrounded by individually themed chill-spaces with beds, couches, and pillows invites you to lounge with us, dance, have a cold drink, play a game, or do all of the above at the same time. We are an international bunch of dreamers and doers and want to meet you!
landmark: 8' Never Sleep Again LED-powered infinity mirror

name: Native Tongues
description:
Native Tongues speak a dialect that only the open heart can understand. 
We dance to a beat only the heart can feel.
We hear the words that speak of love and encouragement.
We acknowledge the signs that point to hope and joy.
We welcome the spirits of transformation to the best versions of ourselves and we support all on that beautiful journey.
Come sit with us to teach, to learn, to laugh and most of all to live.
Worship the present moment without fear of the future or regret of the past.
We speak a Native Tongue known to all but often forgotten.
Come on home and take a load off...
landmark: Look for the large flag w/an open eye "Wide Awake"

name: 706 Tribe
description: A pioneer, convener, and incubator exploring unlimited possibilities of personal, spiritual, and social transformation. In the long term we aim to incubate various of communities experimenting with authentic relating, psychological support, and co-living space with its members. We will explore & incubate sustainable living powered by technologies, and experiments future lifestyles. We eagerly participate in building a more compassionate, inclusive, connected, and sustainable world.
landmark: Red Chinese knot with a 666 logo

name: Prismaticamp
description: A community of LED light artists.  Join us each night at dusk for prismatic reception, the interactive LED Pleasure Dome, our other in-camp LED interactive art installations, our LED art gallery, and our nightly community LED procession to the night Playa. Also see the schedule for daytime interactive activities including LED fabrication/programming classes, solar power classes, and Zen Bell ritual.
landmark: 12' high LED dome mounted on 6 4"x4"

name: ConTent
description:
ConTent presents: Beetlejuice Beach Party

Come jiggle your bones back to life at the "Dome of the Dead", or enjoy some activity at the "Volleyball Court for the Recently Deceased"!
We have deathly good açaí, lights, music, and fun... for the rest of eternity.
landmark: Volleyball Court + Geodesic Dome

name: And Then There's Only Love
description:
Home of the world famous Orgy Dome – where couples & moresomes of all orientations are invited to come and play. We welcome the combination of love in all forms.

We're a sex-positive, inclusionary, and exploratory space that's been a place of fire, fun, and passion since 2003.

Everyone wishing to enter the Orgy Dome receives a detailed talk about Informed Enthusiastic Consent. Remember, anything other than an enthusiastic YES means NO!

Our (relatively) dust free and air conditioned space is designed for people to experience social sexuality in a safe and respectful way. We have a 'Just Us' and an 'Open to More' section - so monogamous & non-monogamous folks are all welcome.

And check out our workshops on many different sex-positive topics, hosted by some of the world's preeminent sex-educators
landmark: Lightup sign that says "Orgy Dome" on the carports

name: PlovKraft
description: Daily Plov Cooking Ceremony! Dance, Eat, Sleep, Repeat!
landmark: LED UFO Stage!

name: Atom Cult
description: The Most Radiant Camp! Come over to taste our delicious Hot Fusion pancakes with Nuclear Winter Brew coffee in the morning and Cold Fission ice cream at noon. Fill yourself with Happiness and Joy while exploring the magnificent and inspiring Art Garden filled with surprising immersive experiences. Or relax and recharge both yourself and your portable electronics in our Reactor Dome.
landmark: the "boobs" domes and a tall flagstaff.

name: Mansonian Institute of WWIT
description: Mansonian Institute & Camp WWIT Village celebrates & teaches Burningman history through large graphic banners & take-offs of each year's theme w info & stories of Burningman going back to first event. Stop & ask questions about Burningman history, get swag & chill out in Camp WWIT bar w fun games, drinks, music, Kundalini teachings, & offerings of curious combinations of adaptogenic, euphoric, and nootropic yerba mate concoctions. Alcohol for the brave! Each morning from Tues-Thurs, we will host Meditation/Yoga session w 20 min discussion on impact of meditation on the brain & on happiness based on neuroscience. Attend our talk/discussion with the Burningman Nerds, Veteran Burners , to discuss all things Burningman Wednesday 2pm-4pm
landmark: Large banners w long timeline on 2 story framing

name: Snowflake Village
description: Snowflake Village has been a haven for long-distance travelers, and small-scale direct interactivity, since 2000.
landmark: 11 foot diameter glowing sequencing snowflake

name: Bumblepuss
description: Bumblepuss brings a spa theme to the playa with the aromatherapy focused Lavender Lounge. Visit, sip tea, bask in the aromas while you relax in the shade.  Lavender Beestro provides shaded bistro seating to sip coffee and gaze upon the fine passersby in BRC. The Gungeon Crossfit Gym offers early morning cross fit activities for all abilities and interests.
landmark: pink and purple tie dyed Lavender Lounge 40' Dome

name: Take It Easy
description: Take It Easy is an international cyberpunk vaporwave oasis. Come immerse yourself in our "Sunset Cube" and cuddle in our intimate "Dreamcatcher" movie dome. We often serve international cuisine from our camp so keep an eye out for any lunch events!
landmark: The 8' x 8' x 8' glowing "Sunset" cube

name: The Dusty Alchemist
description: The Dusty Alchemist serves up cocktails, chat, and bar games around sunset on playa. Come and join the fun in the bar or explore the Dream Dome for a relaxing trip into your own mind!
landmark: Dusty Alchemist Bar - prominent sign

name: Lux in Fabula
description: Lux in Fabula is an art installation support camp by Burning Stories science-art collective studying the transformational aspects of burner cultures
landmark: wooden pyramid-shaped Lux in Fabula - sign ~4ft and lit at night

name: PickleBack Mountain
description: We serve the Universe Famous Home Made PickleBacks! Our bar is open daily Monday - Saturday from Noon-Sunset. Come by and replenish yourself with our Pickle juice and to top it off take a spin on our Bucking Pickle. Look for our Saloon Doors in space and come on in.
landmark: Bucking Pickle

name: Wake N Bake
description: Come for the Hipsters.  And stay for the snark, PBR-tinis, and Tuesday burritos!  Look for the big Sutro Tower!
landmark: Sutro Tower

name: Academy of Arts and Sciences
description: We're the scientists who are artists.  And the artists with a passion for science.  We can show you how a crystal is born, and then teach you to make wearable art with it.  Want to look at the sun?  Want to look at the sun and NOT go blind? We got you, and we'll even paint you up once you're done.  Want to learn more about Black Rock Desert geology, or have a question for an OB/GYN? Stop on by for our lively and interesting debate and educational sessions. You can also just kick back in the shade, trade a bad idea for a bad drink, and relax at the Bad Idea Bar - worst bar on the Playa (since 2010!).
landmark: Serotonin molecule hanging off shade structure

name: Sparkle Camels Costume Bazaar
description: Stop by Sparkle Camels Costume Bazaar to pimp your playa look!
landmark: Big Camel.

name: Mudskippers
description:
We are a radically-inclusive, radically diverse, and radically expressive tight-knit group of gays, straights, bisexual, and unlabeled lovers from LA, SF, NYC, Miami, Montreal Kansas City, Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, Central America, the Middle East, Spain, Paris, India, South Africa, and everywhere in-between. 
We are a Tribe. We are a Family. We are a Worldwide Network of Friends. We are work and play together to make the burn more fun and give bigger to those that come to our theme camp. Come enjoy our fruit smoothies, our amazing dance parties, fun workshops, or just come chill out with us in our lounge! We look forward to welcoming you to our dusty home on the playa!
landmark: three scaffold towers with flags, beacon light

name: Partner Dance Adventures
description:
Human beings crave connection with other human beings.  Step onto our dance floor, take a partner in your arms, hear the music and move together, a beautiful conversation in dance.   At our camp you can take lessons, practice dance at our socials, and meet partner dance enthusiasts happy to share a dance or a conversation.
Our camp exists to share our love for connection with each other and with the music, so we bring that love. Hard.
landmark: PARTNER DANCE ADVENTURES lightbulb sign

name: Camp Little Bitty
description: Riding the Burner Express? Camp Little Bitty is a great resource for bus info, luggage storage, and shaded wait areas.
landmark: arched entryway, camp flags, and camp signs.

name: ING
description:
We are ING! camp " ING ".
A wild and fun crew from all over the world and all walks of life that have been burnING together for about a DECADE. Stop by and shout a "FUCK YEAH!" then come in and hang out!

We have a bar, and daily happy hours, 2:22pm-4:44pm
Events and classes throughout the week. drinkING, artING, spinnING, playING, racING, dancING etc.
landmark: "ING" sign on top of the tower

name: Golden Gallery
description: Featuring works from 2D, 3D, and performance artists, the Golden Gallery invites you to explore even more. Sip your libation from any of the neighboring establishments as you move around our curated collection. Just as the void gazes back so does art; this rabbit hole is exactly as deep as you're willing to go…
landmark: Wall full of gold frames within Golden Guy Alley

name: Tragic School Bus
landmark: School bus

name: Tazii Lounge
description: Tazii will provide Moroccan chill space and top-shelf bar. New this year we will be bringing a speakeasy experience to complement our cozy chill space. Come find it and find fun.
landmark: Three spired Moroccan tent on the corner.

name: Big Girtha
description: Big Girtha is a queer camp consisting of people of all sexual orientations and gender identities. We create a safe space for otherness and a community of radical queerness, through music, wellness, and an open platform for communication.
landmark: Big Girtha sign, rainbow flag, and dome

name: Glittercamp!
description: BioGlitterCamp has been serving Black Rock City for more than 20 years, decorating its citizens as the decorate us. We transform those who visit us into brilliant, glistening gods and goddesses who radiate in blissed out beauty as the reflect the desert sun. A camp built on consent and communication, we encourage you to get up close and sparkly with friends and strangers alike as you reveal what's under those clothes and release the diamond crested being that lives inside.
landmark: glitterbox tent and our aluminet shade cloth

name: MESA
description: Climb up the steps of MESA to sit atop and see the world beyond.  Our space is designed to enable a journey of self discovery and inner enlightenment.  Bring your tribe and join us for a drum circle or meditation circle, either way the mezcal and laughs abound.  If you're looking to dive in deep, we will also be hosting temazcal ceremonies in our yurt.
landmark: Large wooden steps up to a large flat plateau

name: Galactic Cruzaders
description: We make music and laughter and encourage you to drop by and pick up an instrument and jam with us on our stage atop the Galactic Cruzaders (a shool bus in her former life)!  Dance to our DJ lineup while enjoying an adult beverage from our bar on Tutu Techno Tuesday or sign up to strut your stuff in our Men in Lace lingerie fashion show.  Come one, come all, and help us make the magic that makes BRC our home in the dust!
landmark: Large sign with camp name atop shipping container

name: Burner Dojo
description: Look for the Torii Temple Gate, bow in, and immerse yourself in the Place of the Way. The Year of the Wood Tiger meets Return of the Dragon, with courtesy, integrity, and indomitable spirit; you're ready to Enter The Dojo. Daily classes in martial arts, yoga, movement arts, ecstatic dance, meditation, sound healing baths. Youth programming: Kids Karate daily 10am, yoga for all ages. Offering training space to like-minded movement artists: Teach on our cushioned canvas barefoot mat for clean feet: AcroYoga, Capoeira, Judo, Jiu Jitsu, gymnastics... Events: Shoes-off daylight dance party, ecstatic dance vibe. Kumite Tournament for the martial artists — send your camp's best fighter to defend your camp's honor and compete in the first-ever Black Rock City Kumite! *Family / Kid friendly.
landmark: Torii Temple Gate

name: Pour Decisions Winery
description: Come make good decisions at Pour Decisions Winery while listening to mediocre music.
landmark: Pendulum with a wine bottle disco ball

name: LOBE
description: Come form new [neural] connections at Campus Callosum. Bring your most nagging questions or share your own scientific knowledge, and if you don't leave the camp smarter at least you'll leave drunker.
landmark: Large El-Wire Brain (1x1.5m) above shade structure

name: Las Brujas
description: At Curanderx, we take pride and joy in building a camp centered around community between our campers. We're diverse in age and background, hailing from New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Mexico City, San Miguel de Allende, and more.  Formerly Camp La Calaca, our new camp name stems from curar, the Spanish verb "to heal."  Balancing the adventure of exploring the vast expanse of the Playa with building a home "away from home," Curanderx is for those looking for a dynamic, broad, yet deep Burn. Get lost, but also get found; go deep and also embody pure joy; show up and let it all out with us.
landmark: two 30' white domes / a giant salamander art car

name: Off the Dome
description: FreeStyle Palace 2022: Playa Talent Incubator.  Now in its second decade, a collaborative music space and performance stage featuring open jams, hip hop, nightly DJ sets and live performance shows from sunset to about 2:00 am. Our stage and our microphones are open to all comers.
