Do you like to dance? Do you like disco? Do you like to snuggle with your besties and watch the sunrise... in super cute outfits.... and maybe spin a little fire..or spin on a Lyra? Well, welcome home. Fluffy Heaven is here for you, a safe space for women empowerment, carbon monoxide awareness, freedom of expression, entertainment, fashion and fun. Take me to Heaven, lets play in the clouds!
landmark: Fluffy Heaven flag and or sign in neon lights

name: CYBER DREAMS
description: Nothing in life is permanent. Once it happened, it passed. The only constant is the ever-evolving present. But what happens when we add synthetic intelligent life into the equation? What is its perception of 'life'? Can it go back or forward in time? Is it fully awaken or deeply asleep..?  Our thematic camp CYBER DREAMS explores the idea of AI dreaming of its human experience. It came from the outer space and crashed in Black Rock City and now a group of sci-fi researchers set up a camp around it to investigate the unknown object. The study shows that the new  'entity' is actually in the state of a deep sleep, dreaming. It is in its final moments before it fades, rendering out a new world for the new AI. It also renders us humans. It dreams of itself. So we wonder… are WE truly awake?
landmark: dome like a crashed alienship & blue mannequins

name: Hour Kava
description:
Swing by and bask in warm tropical vibes at our Florida-style kava bar. Enjoy a shell of kava or our variety of relaxing teas while hanging in our lounge or at the bar! 

We'll be slingin' shells from noon to midnight Monday-Saturday. 
We'll be bula'ing (Fijiian toast) every hour on the hour
Everyone's welcome! It's not just our kava bar, it's *our* kava bar
landmark: lit numeric chairs around fire pit form 20' clock

name: Barrio Bap
description: Bienvenidos a Barrio Bap! We are a mix of Latinx and Asian folks co-creating a fun fusion space for folks to chill, talk, and try some new snacks. Think prayer flags and paper lanterns, lychee jellies with chamoy, an altar for rice worship, and psychedelic cumbia interleaved with K-pop. We will also be hosting cultural sharing & teaching workshops throughout the week, including but not limited to: Chinese knot tying, a K-beauty salon, coffee tasting, and a teach-in about indigenous herbal medicine in Guatemala.
landmark: paper lanterns and prayer flags

name: Frog Prince Camp
description: Visit the Frog Prince Art Car Camp when the sun is hottest in the afternoon for a solar-powered sweat inside the Rain Bubble, a hydration therapy tent, where you will lose your playa dust and maybe even your heart. Clothing optional. Bring towel. No shampoo or soap.
landmark: Frog Prince Art Car

name: Todo Bien
description: We're a mishmash of Artist and Creators. Our art projects include: Kukulkan's Portal, Electric Dandelions, Pariah, Vibeapple, Elvispresso. Join us for a drink or to just chat.
landmark: Electric Dandelions, Pariah, Vibeapple

name: Love Tripping
description: Trip & stumble down a tunnel of good dreams and into our arms. We're here to show you love all week, with events of comfort, appreciation, curiosity, and acceptance. Featuring the Touchless Love Wash, 18-Hand Massage, Naked Breakfast Slop, and the gargantuan Book of Understanding.
landmark: neon pink "Love Tripping" sign

name: De Tinklesteinz
description: A multi-generational, international group of passionate Burners dedicated to Planetary Health both Environmental and Humanitarian promoting Green Peace across the globe Regional Burn by Regional Burn - Imagine Peace then join us at the Green Peas Corp, climb aboard and let's RIDE the Peace Train – you can't have Peace without RIDE
landmark: 30-foot tall Lightning Bolt - Power to the People

name: Burthday
description: The most common birthdays worldwide are in August and September. Come born, reborn, and yet-to-be-born to celebrate your Burthday. Burning Man and birthdays aren't mutually exclusive and you should be celebrated at both. Enter the Youterus and celebrate the day you entered this Waking Dream with a party just for you, any and all yous welcome. But also for everyone else.
landmark: Large banner with uterus shape outlined by a heart

name: Plan B
description: We're a support camp for the honorarium art project "What to Expect When Expecting". At Plan B we celebrate the many facets of choosing (or not choosing) parenthood and honor all of the hopes and fears that go into making that choice.
landmark: Plan B sign and belly casts hanging at the front.

name: Spritzerland
description: Spritzerland is home to the iconic Dragomi art car that has been touring the playa for years in an effort to bring music, dancing, laughter, and good vibes everywhere we go. We are primarily from Denver, CO and encourage anyone to stop by our camp for a variety of refreshing spritzers served throughout the week!
landmark: Dragomi Art Car

name: Square Empire
description:
We are a Queer POC camp based out of Seattle! Our gift this year will be Moonlight Outpost, so come find us in the evenings :)
We will also be holding morning guided meditations and interpersonal relating activities at camp.
landmark: Blacklit neon E² sign

name: Bat Haus
landmark: Bat Haus camp sign

name: Joshua Tree
landmark: White stretch tent size 36/36 ft

name: Weird Steel
description: Designer, Builder and Artist. Burning Man projects include Rhino Redemption art car, Medusa Madness art sculpture and more.
landmark: Rhino Redemption art car

name: Dickhead Camp
description: suburban bar catering to the neighborhood and passer byers. including fun shenanigans all around.
landmark: Camp Dickhead flag and horns on the bar front

name: Vibetopia
description: We are an international crew of party people, change-makers, and visionaries looking to help the world embrace our motto "We Are One." We offer world-class entertainment, music, food, drink, and seminars for all, both on and off the playa. Join us in revelry, growth, and (perhaps!) a bit of enlightenment.
landmark: House of Love flags at the camp corners

name: Theoretical Artists
landmark: Glowing star

name: Catharsis Art Support Camp
description: Catharsis Art Support camp will be in a HUB with the Waking Futures Theme Camp. We will be supporting the build/operation/strike of the Catharsis art piece, as well as have some auxiliary art in our HUB on display for people to enjoy.
landmark: Brightly colored Catharsis sign

name: Self x
description: Come at dusk for a communal and personal journey of the self. Each day our camp explores a new facet of our "selves" and opens to the entire playa to come and explore with us. Visitors will reflect internally and externally on the self and may choose to share their ideas or sit quietly with them. We hope each visitor leaves buzzing with curiosity about a new facet of their self.
landmark: Geodesic half dome next to a wall of writing.

name: Black Rock City Comics
description:
Black Rock City Comics
A comic stand and board games hub for all citizens!
landmark: Pentagonal Yurt & Comic Stand Shade Structure

name: Innerverse
description:
Innerverse offers guided practices to unveil the inner landscapes of the Self.

We are a diverse group of Journeyers with unique gifts and shared passions. We come together in service of Everything to inspire the discovery of infinity through inner exploration. Together, we travel to our Innerverses and bring back relics to enrich our shared experiences. 

Join us for live DJ'd cosmic breathworks, sound journeys, Kundalini, guided star gazing and Web3 chats.
landmark: C-shaped wall of RVs with carpets nested between.

name: A Trip Of Goats
description: It's a bird! It's a plane! Nope- it's A Trip Of Goats! A Trip Of Goats is an art car collective of 20 tricycles that look like goats. We ride as a group bumping music from our 20 connected speakers. If you're lucky enough to be at the right time and the right place then you'll see us connect our speakers to larger art cars or sound camp's sound system to create a true 360 degree musical experience.
landmark: Goat art cars at Name It Next Year Village.

name: Survivor Man Camp
description: Come participate in physical, mental and fun challenges by yourself or with a team.  We will host challenge events where the winner will be dubbed the "Survivor Man or Woman".
landmark: Hopefully a 16' Dome and a sign with camp name

name: Knotty By Nature
description: Knotty by Nature will help you survive and thrive on playa and beyond! Our knot-tying workshops will teach you a variety of ways to get yourself into or out of a literal bind. Our sober hangouts offer calm, peaceful opportunities for you to regroup, recenter, and re-caffeinate to you can be your absolute best Burning version of yourself! Our camp and activities are accessible to Burners of all ages and can accomodate a wide range of ability levels. Come to Knotty by Nature if you are ready to laugh, learn and connect!
landmark: Knotty by Nature arched sign

name: Juicy Rootz
description: Juicy Rootz is offering Juicy Frootz! Art you can wear! Come and meet us— the playful, welcoming and heart-centered Juicies. Throughout the week we're leading workshops wherein you make a zesty dried citrus fruit necklace to commemorate your week on the playa forever. We'll also be standing by each weekday with refreshing non-alcoholic electrolyte drinks at our "Juice Bar." Jump rope, jokes, and dancing included. Come for the Frootz necklaces, stay for the boogie-ing, tunes, juice, connecting, jump roping, joking and joyful vibes!
landmark: Citrus fruit trees and bright yellow flag!

name: Pachahunai Camp
description: pachahunai camp,  radical consciousness
landmark: big star

name: Firm Globe
description:
Kroger, Saab, Virgin Orbit, Virgin Galactic, Virgin Sagitarious, Virgin Black Holes, Chipotle, and Nalgene. What do they all have in common?

Nothing.

We're leveraging neural networks, distributed ledgers, influencers, Myers Briggs, and Omega-6 to create experiences you don't even know you had.

What if you could wake up, click a button, and be done with the day? It's not hard or even that expensive really to program a robot to live a less shitty life than you.

This is the future. We're just the words. Firm Globe. Just those, the words only. the Firm Globe words. Firm Globe, like I said.
landmark: Vinyl Firm Globe banner on top of the monkey hut

name: Chilopod Art Support Camp
description: We are the ambassadors who help Earthlings communicate with Chilopod. Please join us to bring Earth's climate and ecosystems back to health.
landmark: AquaZone water bar. We are adjacent.

name: HamLit
description:
Base camp for our Fruit Juice Serving Head on Wheels - JuiceHead.
We park and relax here when we need to recharge and get juicy.
landmark: "WTF" Street Sign

name: Dreamers Complex
description: Based out of Las Vegas, Dreamers Complex is a utility camp designed to inspire Burners to live their dreams by creating multiple structures that accomplish important tasks that directly help improve a Burner's time on the playa.  Come by to see farther (Dream Big), sleep harder (Sweet DreamZZZ), get hitched (Dream Wedding), or to see the most epic laser show you have ever seen (Laser Dream).
landmark: the Dream Big Viewing tower or the laser show.

name: Y Knot Saloon
description: A late 1800s western town with its saloon, apothecary, and old water tower. Come for a wellness check, stay for a refreshing beverage and fire-side story.
landmark: brightly lit Y Knot Saloon sign

name: The Kingdom
description:
Savage Kingdom is more than just a Burning Man Camp – we are a family of veteran and virgin burners who love to create and participate without limitation. This year we will be focused on a brand new art piece for the Playa, making our badass ArtCar (Savage Island II) even more party friendly, and upgrading our In-Camp experience.
https://www.savagekingdom.org/
landmark: Metal rectangular sign saying "Savage Kingdom"

name: MAD Recreational Movers
description:
Chicago-based, home of the ChiCargo community shipping program. 
 Check out our events about renewable energy micro-grids and reducing CO2 emissions of transport to- and from-BRC!
landmark: big orange semi-trailer

name: Ouroboros
description:
"The Study" is a Portal for Artists, Designers, Engineers, Builders,  Restoration Specialists, Storytellers, Performers that Celebrate with public discourse the revealing of the Forgotten Works.  We encourage the incubation for the staging of art installation, live performance and music.  
Part of this venture is The Serpent Queen, our Flagship. The SQ is a Victorian Steamboat Time Machine Exploration Vessel Designed by Langhorne Industries, under the auspices of the Nicola Tesla Propulsion Systems Corporation.  The SQ is primarily Designed for River Travel on Earth and Beyond.
landmark: Large Hexagonal Black and White Peak Tent

name: Twilight language
description: Strange Design is a collective and art support camp formed to provide a platform for creators to realize conceptual visual art and cultivate sonic energy around it. The team coalesced while creating The Man's Army in 2019. Our goal is to continue to create bold, interactive, innovative, and strange experiences.
landmark: Glowing strange design sign.

name: Justice League of Weird Art
description: We're the artists building Facing the Fearbeast. Come by to say hi or ask questions about our work!
landmark: Facing the Fearbeast sign

name: Shanti Town
description: We at Shanti Town Sound Movement strive to bring you the citizens of Black Rock City the most authentic experience in Reggae music and Sound System Culture. Delivering strictly Irie Vibes to Burninman since day one!
landmark: Very Large Green, Yellow, & Red Rasta Flag.

name: Hot Ass Trash
description: Do you like trash as much as we do? At The Dump! you will find a black hole of treasures, smells, and science. Organized by a team dedicated to direct action, mutual aid and community education. Come take a dump with us!
landmark: giant "The Dump!" sign

name: Sloth Dance Society
description: Where Crazy, mystical sloths live, play and create mischief. Come experience nourishing workshops, elixirs, tinctures, play, gifting, global music and mischief with our Alight Night Market stalls, Living Library Talks, Fairy Grotto, Sloth Care Unit (harm reduction) Slo Mode Marathon and the most fun party on the playa on Friday where celebrate Gifting.
landmark: Alight sign atop 10ft shade structure

name: Name It Next Year Village
description: Name It Next Year Village is home to 3 incredible camps designed to help EVERYONE have a better burn. Come by Dreamers Complex to see farther (Dream Big), sleep better (Sweet DreamZZZ), get hitched (Dream Wedding) or have your mind blown by the coolest LaZer show on the playa (LaZer Dream). Dance harder than you ever have before and watch the sun rise from our soundcamp Bangers At Breakfast and find yourself in the middle of a 360-degree sound art car collective with A Trip Of Goats. Together we form the ultimate homie hangout where you can take your burn to the next level.
landmark: Dream Big viewing tower or the LaZer Dream show.

name: qt pies
description: The qt pies are an adorable, eclectic collective of souls inviting you to explore non-normative interpretations of time. We are on a mission to queerify the cosmos by deconstructing our shared understanding of time - our most ubiquitous, yet most precious, finite resource. Traverse the 4th dimension with us. Embrace pie-in-the-sky ideas. Our doors are open to all who dare to question, who might be questioning, or who simply have questions. Come fetch that QT with us: Queer Time, Question Time, Quality Time through multi-level participatory activities that engage the six senses, and the seventh - our sense of time.
landmark: the colorful paper mache statue of a slice of pie

name: Quarks and Recreation
description: Games for Progress!  Play!  Scientists vs. Zombies!  Discover!  Nuclear Fusion Bocce-Golf!  Learn!  The modern wonders of the Atomic Age! Your local Quarks and Recreation department invites you to experience our comprehensive catalog of nuclear-inspired games, physics trivia, labyrinthian bureaucracy, and definitely-not-radioactive "drinks" at the elusive h-bar.  (Void where the strong nuclear force is inhibited; the electromagnetic force may apply).
landmark: Parklet w/ green "grass" and rad waste burn barrel

name: New York Dangerous
description: New York Dangerous features the all-day interactivity your mother warned you about: Running with Scissors (relay race passing scissors, winners get ice cream), Playing with Fire (using sun's rays and magnifying glasses to burn balsa wood necklaces we gift on a leather string), Talking to Strangers (daily 75 min conversation on a different topic led by a NYD camper; these have ranged from blockchain to polyamory to lucid dreaming to krunking), Strangers with Candy (our 24-hour free hard candy vending machine, "You'll Put Your Eye Out!" shooting gallery (plastic bows and foam arrows shot downrange to hit hanging targets), plus Bad Idea Bingo where the first 50 people who successfully complete 5 tasks in a line before Temple Burn are gifted a special "Master of Bad Ideas" leather necklace.
landmark: Strangers With Candy vending machine out in front.

name: Empryrean Temple Crew
landmark: Colorfull tool truck

name: The Embassy of Creative Economy
description: A new civilization is being born in Ukraine, and we want to bring it to the world. We also want to take the most advanced world experience and bring it to Ukraine. Firstly, we want to do it with a community of people "eyes to eyes".
landmark: Ukrainian flag

name: Planet Somewhat
description: We are an Art Car collective out of Pasadena, CA.  We have a public event space for displaying YOU! So, don't be shy!  Come, bring your audio/visual/ethereal art and enjoy your time by the fire.  Mostly Moscow Mules will be served as we buzz around the Playa on Robo Bee our gift to you, for being YOU!  Presented by The Moment.
landmark: Bumble Bee Art Car, 10' tall truss shade structure

name: The Honey Bears!
description: The Honey Bears!  Come by for some fun-loving, honey-spreading (and vinegar spraying) love!
landmark: Light up Dancing Bears

name: Goetta Life
description: Come to Goetta Life Camp for the Cincinnati sausage, stay for the drumming, hammocks, solar info, and bike chain cleaning and lubing!
landmark: International Flags surrounding our camp

name: The Juice Boxx
landmark: The Juice Box Mutant Vehicle

name: Play With Your Food
description: Come meet the artistic crew that built the Play With Your Food art installation, ask us questions about the process, and join us for a variety of casual workshops (dance, juggling, flow arts, etc) throughout the week.
landmark: signs on the corners of our camp.

name: Foam Home presents Foamenagerie
description: Visit Foam Home presents Bubble Entendre, where you can blast off into a dreamy foam bubble liberating body and soul, getting sparkly clean and dancing it all out Wednesday through Saturday from 1-4:20pm.
landmark: giant solar unit and 2 huge water containers

name: Chair Camp
description: The dusty, cozy-as-can-be living room with room for all of our Chair People. Chair Camp is proud to be on playa for the first year, with 3 cars and a 24/7 lounge-pad for when we're done stomping around deep playa + roll back to camp. Cold beverages and warm, cozy hangs? Purrr.
landmark: two giant 'jolly wrencher' flags w/ chair logo

name: Menage-a-trois-gerie
description:
We are the voice behind the Teapot, and the will behind the Steam. If you encountered a magical trash-fence tea service, it was us. Welcome to our camp for daytime teas: such as ICED and SODA, or HOT for the truly cold-blooded aficionados.

We also host workshops on Tea, Consent, and Clowning!
landmark: large light-up teapot, or the colorful Tea set

name: Rise Camp
landmark: "Solar Disco" sign

name: 404: Village Not Found Annex
description:
404: Village Not Found-Come here to get lost.
A visually rich and unique village with a long history, 404 is home to Death Before Decaf, Dye With Dignity, M*A*S*H 4207th, Pottie Project, and Horseshoes and Handgrenades. A diverse and welcoming environment, you can find something fun 24 hours a day here. Watch a movie, throw some horseshoes, grab a coffee, dye a scarf, eat a snow cone, drink the best martini on the playa, photobomb the red carpet, run a security checkpoint, learn about grey water evaporation or the importance of toilet access worldwide, or just find a place you didn't realize you really needed to be until you got there.
landmark: Tower with yellow sign next to M*A*S*H 4207th tower with sign.

name: Pathogen Trackers Annex
description: Pathogen Trackers camp is excited to return to the playa and provide the gifts of food and drink to those in need.  Please visit www.PathogenTrackers.com to learn more.
landmark: 60' Watch Tower, surrounded by Big Black Trucks

name: BRC Taxi Co.
description: Looking for a nice time? aNice Camp is a place where you go to a have a nice time, a nice game of chess with one-of-a-kind sets, perhaps a nice cocktail or even a nice party. Stay tuned for a bulletin for all sorts of nice happenings and be sure to try our homemade pickles… they’re nice.
landmark: a flag with the egyptian eye

name: BlinkingManCamp97
description: WELCOME BACK! For the 11th time the deep playa trash fence will be much more than a fence. 85 posts will be decorated with folk art, and recycled and repurposed items dangling from TIKIs. As you ride along the fence you will connect and enjoy the tikis and wonder what the heck are some of them? About 15 people have contributed art and the tradition continues. Also from time to time we will run an IQ test (wacky and fun) and returning for the first time DRAGNET INTERROGATION! It was last seen on the playa in 2009. Stop by we have unique swag and you will enjoy the unique experience.  And the TIKIZ will definitely bring a chuckle and a guffaw.......BlinkingManCamp - on the playa since 1997!
landmark: TiKiZ and Dragnet signs out front

name: Happy Acidents
description: There are no mistakes, only Happy Accidents. We are a group of Happy Little Acidents who want to share the Joy of Painting (and everything else) with YOU!
landmark: Big dome with a painting of Bob Ross in front

name: GDI's - Gawd Damn Independents
description: We're BM Workers - and you might be too. Maybe you just need to take time to watch the street activity roll by, with a cold beer in your hand and a snacks on a dusty table after a busy time at work. This little camp is a Sit+Chill - where we'll talk about our past BM stories; like there was this one time at Burning Man... and complain about the latest crop of Birgins and the sound camp two doors down. We'll be up early for sunrise - so don't bother dropping in until I get back at 9am or we are off shift at 4pm.
landmark: Mailbox with our designated street address on it.

name: Brahmaloka
landmark: Space of hammocks among the sculptures.

name: Jub Jub's Plastic Circus
description: Jub Jub always here to fling those funny hard-to-get drinks, uneasy rest, strange music, weird plays, loud noises, oh-so-friendly grief, bruises, nausea, vertigo i.e. Monkey Business!!!   maybe poo too…
landmark: The Smiling Monkey and Big Balls

name: Joey Glowey Bar
description: Just a small group of Burners, happy to help if you need help.
landmark: White Pick Up  Ranger Logo, on a corner on 7:15

name: PlayAground
landmark: 70 foot long swing set with flags on top.

name: Vampire Empire
description:
We are a group of old world Transylvanian vampires who have colonized Black Rock City and soon will hypnotize the whole Playa into submitting to our reigning and recognize us as their masters.

To enter our medieval party dome, you must first cross through our Merry Cemetery. We will provide workshops of writing your own obituary, grooming services for werewolves, a pickle bar, Rominimal djs, blood drinks, fire dance, burning at stake, and many other surprises. We will also have a High Vampiric Council meeting where we are sentencing Putler to being impaled by Vlad Dracul himself! 

For safety reasons crucifixes, garlic, and mirrors are strictly forbidden. 

Respectfully, 
The High Vampiric Council
landmark: Flags, Vampires, Dracula elements, Tombs

name: Elliphyno
description: Camp Elliphyno - So, what is your theme?... Hell if I know!
landmark: Stark Flag (from game of thrones) black and white

name: Chalice in Wonderland
description:
Our first home on the playa was fine
Then the madness and dust did combine
Bad advice on the way
Too much trouble to stay
Now with rabbits and hatters we dine

name: Wild Horses support camp

name: WHOMP WAGON
description: Missed us on the Playa? Stop by and say "hi" when the Whomp Wagon is parked at our camp.

name: Intergalactic Wandering Sideshow
description: We are the Mutant Vehicle support camp for The Noodleboat (a.k.a.) Intergalactic Wandering  Sideshow and Mystery Noodles.   Look for us on playa as a plasma jet powered space-faring Chinese junk.   All are welcome aboard.
landmark: N/A

name: Positive Reactor
landmark: Look for us at square 1

name: Dream Makers
description: We are dream makers. Man plus machine. We create futuristic and enhanced experiences through our artist showcases coupled with our innovative build and creations. We make and revive art cars and share it with the Playa. Drop by, at our camp for an immersive sunrise gathering, enjoy a Turkish Coffee, or ride in our art car drifting through Playa sunsets.
landmark: Lightning Bolt

name: Clusterfuck
description: Clusterfuck - the camp.
landmark: Playa tech bar with pink cloth wrapped around top

name: Mebuyan Vessel
description:
The title comes from Mebuyan, a goddess from Filipino mythology, specifically the Bagobo mythology, a large indigenous peoples of southern Mindanao, Philippines. 

She's a goddess of life and death, of the afterlife, traditionally represented as a woman living underground, sitting on a wooden mortar, with breasts covering her entire body. She is said to be nourishing the dead spirits of children in the afterlife, so that they can
grow up and continue on their journey to adulthood.

Banua Mebuyan is the mythological town where she lives cares for these spirits. The camp is the HQ for Mebuyan Vessel, a large scale installation in deep playa, who aims to be a nourishing, transformative, and cosmic place for citizens of Black Rock City for their personal and collective growth.
landmark: 20 foot container and 3 RVs

name: baby dragon camp
description: na
landmark: baby dragon
